story:
(castellano abajo...)

About Us

We are a small group of techies, media makers and community organizers whose mission is to increase access to mobile telecommunications to the over 2 billion people without affordable coverage and the 700 million with none at all. We work as a bridge between the potential users of the technology and the engineers and developers of these efforts to ensure the technology is deployed and appropriate for use in the developing world.

Rhizomatica started as a way to bring together resources and promote the application of new and novel telecommunications technologies to real-world problems. Our initial project was the first "real-world" deployment of the Serval mobile ad-hoc network software to facilitate communications amongst human rights defenders in the Niger Delta area of Nigeria (see:mediaforjusticenigeria.org).

Summary and Background

According to the ITU, 2-3 billion people around the world lack affordable mobile telephone services that facilitate critical communications and access to information. Due to market saturation in developed countries and economic disincentive in the developing world and especially rural areas, mobile coverage proliferation is slowing dramatically worldwide. And yet most telecom regulations forbid the provision of strictly rural service, effectively killing any chance for micro-telco’s to thrive.

Currently, only very large, powerful companies have access to the mobile spectrum and the concessions to provide cellular service. But their business model and the technology that these traditional providers use have proven unable to solve the problem of connecting much of the world. We want to break this oligopoly and allow communities to become service providers as well.

Thanks to a variety of open-source efforts developed in the last few years, it has become technologically and economically feasible for a community or an individual to provide carrier-grade cellular service to thousands of people. Yet no one has so far applied these technologies in the real-world, much less created the needed regulatory reforms or community-appropriate business models. This project has a parallel component that is seeking to develop the legal/regulatory space and secure access to the necessary frequencies to foment the growth of community, rural and micro-telco's.

What We Need

We are now trying to expand on our work, having established the first independent GSM (cell phone) network in Mexico, in the state of Oaxaca. The initial part of the project has been demonstrated using OpenBTS software and equipment loaned from Range Networks. We are now interested in exploring other equipment options, which means experimenting, buying accessories such as cables and amplifiers and  (hopefully) ultimately finding a low-cost and effective solution.

The Impact

We have already established the legal, economic and technical viability of the project and we have a number of communities and municipalities interested in investing and setting up networks. What is needed now is to consolidate the model and continue to push costs down, so that any community can replicate what we are doing and begin to take care of their own communication needs. We think what we are doing is a totally different and revolutionary approach to mobile networks – one that ensures the freedom to communicate and uses telecommunication technology as it was meant to be from the beginning: a way to help people talk to each other.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support us directly with money, there are still many ways to help out:

  • Spread the word! The more people know about what we are up to, the better.
  • Think about possible uses for a community-operated network, and tell us about it.
  • If you are aware of similar projects, based on GSM technology, please tell us where they are. If you are part of it, share your experience with us. We are still trying to figure out all the details and possibilities, and similar experiences from other people are always welcome.
  • We are going to write software, documentation, test equipment, and a million other things. If you are interested in any of these, get in contact with us!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


CASTELLANO


Sobre Nosotros

Somos un pequeño grupo de técnicos-cerebritos, comunicadores y promotores comunitarios quienes estamos trabajando para aumentar el acceso a las telecomunicaciones móviles para los más de 2 mil millones de personas sin cobertura asequible y los 700 millones sin ningún cobertura en absoluto. Trabajamos como un puente entre los usuarios potenciales de la tecnología y los ingenieros y desarrolladores de estos proyectos tecnológicos buscando asegurar que la tecnología se implementa de forma adecuado en el <<mundo en vía de desarrollo>>.

Rhizomatica se llevó a cabo como una forma de reunir recursos y promover la aplicación de nuevas tecnologías de telecomunicaciones a problemas reales del mundo actual. Nuestro proyecto inicial fue el primer despliegue sobre el terreno del software Serval de redes móviles ad-hoc para facilitar la comunicación entre defensores de derechos humanos en la zona del delta del Níger de Nigeria (véase:  http://mediaforjusticenigeria.org).

Resumen y Antecedentes

Según la UIT, 2 a 3 mil millones de personas en todo el mundo carecen de servicios asequibles de telefonía móvil que facilitan las comunicaciones críticas y el acceso a la información. Debido a la saturación del mercado en los países desarrollados y desincentivos económicos en el mundo en desarrollo y especialmente las zonas rurales, la proliferación de cobertura móvil se está desacelerando drásticamente en todo el mundo.

Y sin embargo, la mayoría de las regulaciones de telecomunicaciones prohíbe la prestación del servicio estrictamente rural, efectivamente imposibilitando el crecimiento de un sector nuevo de micro operadores.

Actualmente, sólo empresas muy grandes y poderosas tienen acceso al espectro móvil y las concesiones para prestar servicios de telefonía móvil. Sin embargo, el modelo de negocio y la tecnología que utilizan estos proveedores tradicionales se han demostrado incapaces de resolver el problema de conectar gran parte del mundo. Queremos romper este oligopolio y permitir que las comunidades se convierten en proveedores de servicios de telefonía también.

Gracias a una serie de iniciativas de hardware y software libre desarrollados en los últimos años, ahora es tecnológicamente y económicamente factible que una comunidad o un individuo proporcione con alta calidad servicios de telefonía celular a miles de personas. Sin embargo, hasta el momento casi nadie ha aplicado estas tecnologías en el mundo real, mucho menos creado las necesarias reformas normativas o modelos de negocio adecuados para una comunidad. Este proyecto tiene un componente paralelo con que se está tratando de desarrollar la cuestión legal / normativa y garantizar el acceso a las frecuencias necesarias para fomentar el crecimiento de un nuevo sector rural y comunitario.

Lo que necesitamos

Estamos tratando ahora de ampliar nuestro trabajo, después de haber facilitado el establecimiento del primer sistema GSM (teléfono celular) independiente en México, en el estado de Oaxaca. La parte inicial del proyecto se demostró usando el software <<OpenBTS>> y equipo generosamente prestado por Range Networks. Ahora estamos investigando otras opciones de equipo, lo que significa hacer experimentos, la compra de accesorios como cables y amplificadores y (con suerte) el encontrar una solución eficaz y de bajo costo.

El Impacto

Ya hemos establecido la viabilidad jurídica, económica y técnica del proyecto y ahora hay varias comunidades y municipios interesados ​​en invertir en la creación de redes. Lo que se necesita ahora es consolidar el modelo y seguir bajando los costos, para que cualquier comunidad puede replicar lo que estamos haciendo y así empezar a hacerse cargo de sus propias necesidades de comunicación. Creemos que lo que estamos haciendo representa una visión totalmente nueva en cuanto a las redes móviles - Un enfoque que garantiza la libertad de comunicación y utiliza la tecnología de telecomunicaciones tal como estaba destinada desde el principio: una manera de facilitar la comunicación entre las personas.

Otras formas de apoyar

Si no nos puede apoyar directamente con dinero, todavía hay muchas maneras de ayudar:

  • Corre la voz! Cuanto más se sabe acerca de lo que estamos haciendo, mejor.
  • Piense acerca de los posibles usos de una red comunitaria, y comunicase con nosotros al respecto.
  • Si tiene conocimiento de proyectos similares, basados en la tecnología GSM, por favor díganos dónde están. Si usted forma parte del proyecto, comparta su experiencia con nosotros. Todavía estamos tratando de averiguar todos los detalles y posibilidades, y siempre es bueno saber de experiencias similares de otras personas.
  • Vamos a escribir software, documentación, probar equipos, y un sin fin de tareas. Si está interesado en alguno de ellas, póngase en contacto con nosotros!

story:
Quick Summary of Jordan

  • Our man Jordan is battling Leukemia. Fighting the cancer with zero fear and an attitude that is so infectious and motivating. We just recently met him and his amazing family at his house and learned what his one wish would be through Make-A-Wish. Now, if (hopefully when) this wish comes true, it will truly be crazy awesome! But, I think this kid needs more than one wish! How about you? If so, please donate if you can! Any denomination of support (even a small one) will help make this happen!
  • During our first visit, Jordan impressed us in so many ways! His #1 Wish will definitely be one for the ages! However, he also mentioned that he would love to have a computer and printer to help him and his two sisters with their homework.  Make-A-Wish can only grant one wish, but those who know me, when do I ever stop at what is ONLY allowed? His wish should be awesome and fun... so we're going to get this computer and printer through our network of friends, so he can keep his #1 Wish, which truly encompasses this little guy's unbounded heart.

What We Need from You Amazing People

  • We will be buying Jordan an all-in-one computer and printer to accompany his Make-A-Wish wish. Any additional funding raised will go towards helping him get a PS4, as his activity has been greatly limited while he receives chemotherapy/ spinal taps. To maximize donations and gifts to Jordan, we will be visiting the local big box retailers and also reaching out to their corporate reps to see if they can help us with discounted goods. If anyone has these type of connections, that would be HUUUGE!  

The Impact

  • Jordan is seriously such an incredible young man. To have such strength and perspective at 10 is so moving and what makes being able to lead wishes at Make-A-Wish so rewarding.  Supplementing his #1 wish with this computer will mean so much to his entire family, especially as they face mounting medical bills. Jordan was even willing to give up his #1 Wish, so his family could own a household computer. This computer will not only help him and his sisters excel in school, but is very necessary as Jordan is currently having to be schooled at home during treatment.  
  • We chose this donation site, because it truly helps you effect your cause. The service fees are very low and if we reach our goal of $850, they decrease the fees by 5%!  So, let's do this!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate at this time, we totally understand! But if you could...

  • Help us make noise and awareness with this fundraiser by sharing with your friends/ colleagues through word-of-mouth or by using the Indiegogo share tools
  • Also, please let me know if you have any connections that could help us with purchasing the goods. 

You all are truly the best! Thanks so much for your time and consideration!

story:
Once upon a time...

A man put a blade to his face and called it shaving. Over the decades shaving has evolved into an an overpriced art form that you can find in malls, “niche” barbershops, and pyramid schemes. During that time, in the shadows and the peak season of Movember, the beard culture has grown (and in some cases completely out of control) into a formidable beast. What is man supposed to do at this cross road of destiny? To shave, or not to shave?

Whatever the F**k they want. But they better do it well as many people hold men to face value in this day and age.

My name is Tenisha Hicks but some people know me as “Demmy”. I live in Salt Lake City, Utah and am a student of the Skin Science Institute. Living in this mecca has shown me that the world of the gentleman is not dead. In fact, it is thriving. But it could easily be killed off by product that is overpriced, under made with outlandish chemicals, and falsely advertised. So I took it upon myself to study what natural remedies and routine enhancement products are needed to battle the various perils that poor skin, beard and shaving care befalls mankind living in this climate case of a state.

           


Finding logical and appropriate solution, I decided to create DemToffGuys.com, a natural based skin and beard care company to bring back the quality instead of the quantity to gentleman grooming routines. Doing your part to ensure my fundraiser succeeds not only ensures that you obtain some of this jaw droppingly (it's a word now, deal with it) good product, but gives you that amazingly warm and fuzzy feeling of knowing that you are helping to save beardkind and shaving routines across the nation.

Why I'm Fund-raising

After opening my online shop three weeks ago I've had several orders from people and not yet one dissatisfied customer. From friends to complete strangers, they have all found delightful uses out of what I have to offer in my care line,. The only unfortunate part of having all of this wonderful attention and orders is that I'm starting to doggy paddle and keep up. Dem Toff Guys needs a boost like whoa. Especially when you have customers saying this:

"Thanks to the fine products offered by Dem Toff Guys for making me smell like 1889. Fine, homespun moustache wax and beard oils for the discerning gentleman." - C. Fisher

“Used the lemon grass shaving cream this morning and we very impressed. Went on nicely and smelled amazing. Left my skin feeling very moist as well as there was no razor burn after, with very little irritation. Had a very nice light scent with me for a the morning. It felt almost wrong to not use a safety razor with this.” - R. Bixler

“No razor burn with your cream - and I felt some irritation in the shower when I was washing it out. It responded and nourished my skin. In fact, that was hours ago and my skin still feels and smells awesome “ - B. Spangler

“ OK, I got my first shipment from 'Dem Toff Guys', and in the nick of time, too. My Lemongrass shaving cream sample only had one more day left in it.

First, the package came in a brown paper wrapping, good old fashioned manly looking thing it was too! Nothing was broken, Demmy did a great job making sure everything was wrapped in bubble wrap to protect it.

So far, all i have used is the beard oil, since its 8 o'clock at night. (I will wait til tomorrow to use the shaving cream and the aftershave.) I did, however decide to try the beard oil right away, on my moustache. Since my moustache is so wild and unmanageable, I really had no idea or expectations as to how the beard oil would work. But i was pleasantly surprised, on my first attempt i noticed my scraggly moustache was softer and much less wirey. As i haven't received my moustache wax yet, i do not yet know how the two will work together, but just having the beard oil itself on my moustache has made a big difference. Also, I really love the scent, 'Carribean Sailor'. I mostly stayed away from the aftershave scents in the stores, always smelled too perfumey, or just didn't like them. But, THIS stuff is much different. Perhaps more muskey? but NOT like a perfume, and definitely a MAN's scent. (I got shaving cream and after shave in the same scent) 

Very happy with the new products, Demmy. You have managed to get me interested in grooming myself again, Thanks! I will report back about the others after I have used them.

Cheers!” - M. Mannonen

Shopping local as much as possible, all funding obtained from this project is to assist with expanding the business. I plan to produce wholesale order opportunities, obtain marketing materials, an advertisement budget, local fair and festival vending fees to be paid, promotional packets and materials, product to make my products faster, better, stronger and if a stretch goal of unthinkable measure is reached, open up a Gentlemans Parlor where I can not only sell my merchandise, but provide work opportunities for classically trained barbers, have an in house tailor for suit adjustment, and coffee lounge.

What makes my dreams and business so unique compared to the other shops? I am a woman who knows what she likes and grew up with barbers in the family who have been mentoring me about mens skin care, angst, and pains of being a modern day gentleman in such a way that I'm determined to bring my “holy grail” of care to the front lines. If I don't reach my entire goal, the funds still go towards making this possible, hard work WILL do the rest.

Fragrance is good and all but...

Though this is a female owned business, there are many males involved that are not only test subjects, but much appreciated voices in ensuring Toff Guys goes the right direction. There's not a frill to be found in this production line and our ingredients are organic so that they react well with your own natural chemistry. Nothing unneeded goes into our products. Below are a just a couple of our ingredients:


Other Ways You Can Help!

In this day and age with 1000000 other super cool fundraiser programs going and your wallet being kicked back and forth by unexpected kicks-in-the-nuts, sharing my project is just as good as donating! Ladies, you're also welcomed to participate! I know how often we scream about how there's no “Gentlemen” out there, well now's your chance to help keep their grooming tactics alive, and maybe even obtain a gift for the one you've been thinking of, or that is in your life now. It's like rubbing Buddah's belly for luck...except, you're wishing this project luck by sharing and or contributing.

Especially when you have customers saying this: 


"Thanks
to the fine products offered by Dem Toff Guys for making me smell
like 1889. Fine, homespun moustache wax and beard oils for the
discerning gentleman." - C. Fisher


“Used
the lemon grass shaving cream this morning and we very impressed.
Went on nicely and smelled amazing. Left my skin feeling very moist
as well as there was no razor burn after, with very little
irritation. Had a very nice light scent with me for a the morning. It
felt almost wrong to not use a safety razor with this.” - R. Bixler

“No
razor
burn with your cream
- and I felt some irritation in the shower when I was washing it out.
It responded and nourished my skin. In fact, that was hours ago and
my skin still feels and smells awesome
“ - B. Spangler 


“ OK,
I got my first shipment from 'Dem Toff Guys', and in the nick of
time, too. My Lemongrass shaving cream sample only had one more day
left in it.First, the package came in a brown paper wrapping,
good old fashioned manly looking thing it was too! Nothing was
broken, Demmy did a great job making sure everything was wrapped in
bubble wrap to protect it.So far, all i have used is the
beard oil, since its 8 o'clock at night. (I will wait til tomorrow to
use the shaving cream and the aftershave.) I did, however decide to
try the beard oil right away, on my moustache. Since my moustache is
so wild and unmanageable, I really had no idea or expectations as to
how the beard oil would work. But i was pleasantly surprised, on my
first attempt i noticed my scraggly moustache was softer and much
less wirey. As i haven't received my moustache wax yet, i do not yet
know how the two will work together, but just having the beard oil
itself on my moustache has made a big difference. Also, I really love
the scent, 'Carribean Sailor'. I mostly stayed away from the
aftershave scents in the stores, always smelled too perfumey, or just
didn't like them. But, THIS stuff is much different. Perhaps more
muskey? but NOT like a perfume, and definitely a MAN's scent. (I got
shaving cream and after shave in the same scent) Very
happy with the new products, Demmy. You have managed to get me
interested in grooming myself again, Thanks! I will report back about
the others after I have used them.Cheers!” - M. Mannonen 


Shopping
local as much as possible, all funding obtained from this project is
to assist with expanding the business. I plan to produce wholesale
order opportunities, obtain marketing materials, an advertisement
budget, local fair and festival vending fees to be paid, promotional
packets and materials, product to make my products faster, better,
stronger and if a stretch goal of unthinkable measure is reached,
open up a Gentlemans Parlor where I can not only sell my merchandise,
but provide work opportunities for classically trained barbers, have
an in house tailor for suit adjustment, and coffee lounge.

What
makes my dreams and business so unique compared to the other shops? I
am a woman who knows what she likes and grew up with barbers in the
family who have been mentoring me about mens skin care, angst, and
pains of being a modern day gentleman in such a way that I'm
determined to bring my “holy grail” of care to the front lines.
If I don't reach my entire goal, the funds still go towards making
this possible, hard work WILL do the rest.  

Fragrance is good and all but...
Though this is a female owned business, there are many males involved that are not only test subjects, but much appreciated voices in ensuring Toff Guys goes the right direction. There's not a frill to be found in this production line and our ingredients are organic so that they react well with your own natural chemistry. Nothing unneeded goes into our products. Below are a just a couple of our ingredients:
Other
Ways You Can Help!


In this day
and age with 1000000 other super cool fundraiser programs going and
your wallet being kicked back and forth by unexpected
kicks-in-the-nuts, sharing my project is just as good as donating!
Ladies, you're also welcomed to participate! I know how often we
scream about how there's no “Gentlemen” out there, well now's
your chance to help keep their grooming tactics alive, and maybe even
obtain a gift for the one you've been thinking of, or that is in your
life now. It's like rubbing Buddah's belly for luck...except, you're
wishing this project luck by sharing and or contributing.

story:
Your contribution will build a two-story EarthBag structure in Masoro, a small village in Rwanda. 

We are GA Collaborative (GAC), a 501(c)(3) registered non-profit group of designers. We research and design with new and old building technologies to find the right balance of practical, cultural, and community needs to best serve our local partners. We design the process of building as much as the building itself.

Proposed 2-story prototype building

In Rwanda, we are working with a new builder's association to develop the potential of EarthBag construction as a way of enabling them to build their own homes. EarthBags are stitched from recycled polypropylene, packed with sifted site soil, and stacked like masonry. The technology has a long history and can be found around the world but is new to Rwanda - in fact, we built the country's first EarthBag structure last summer. Our new goal is to build a 2-story building with the same group of builders in 2014.



Africa, Rwanda, Masoro - a village 20km north of Rwanda's capital city of Kigali

We used a type of EarthBag innovated by Eternally Solar in South Africa, and planned the construction of the house as a large-scale training workshop. It was led by Riaan Hough, an EarthBag construction expert, GAC and local architecture students. Using labor-intensive, low-skilled construction techniques allowed us to tap local knowledge and expertise and ensure that the building would be accepted by the local community. We want to refine and develop this collaborative building strategy, and eventually build 50 houses in Masoro.

The first EarthBag house in Masoro under construction

The design of the house was based on a standard government model that uses a breezeway to separate the living and bedroom spaces from the utility volume. We modified the design to incorporate shaded outdoor space, providing privacy while allowing sun and air to filter through. The same women who built the walls wove the screens, using traditional techniques usually reserved for smaller crafts.

The interior of the first Masoro house

Participation and collaboration defined the building process every step of the way. Students from the country's first university architecture department co-designed and co-managed the construction of the house. The villager-builders, students and GAC made decisions together during daily and weekly project meetings. After 3 months when the house was nearly complete, something remarkable happened: the workers, who were contracted through a local association leader, decided to work towards establishing their own organization and held impromptu elections of their own. Witnessing this event inspired us to reconsider our role in the building process (our entire business model too) and to work towards becoming an equal partner with the local association instead of acting as a donor.

The members of the new builders' Association Icyerekezo, or "New Vision," mark its inauguration in August 2013

The proposed building is a way of supporting the new association as they develop their capacity to build the remaining homes. The 2-story utility structure will support an adjacent 1-story building that will be used as a meeting space and for storage. While the overwhelming mass of the house is earth sifted from the site, other materials such as window frames, glass, roof rafters, purlins and roofing must be brought from Kigali, about a 30 minute drive through steep hills. The ability to transfer materials in bulk, and store them until they are to be used, will afford huge savings over time. Also, 2-story, multi-family houses are critical to Rwanda's future, as it is one of Africa’s densest countries and housing shortages are chronic. So this summer we want to combine two aspirations in one building by taking the project to the next level - UP!

For press coverage of our first Masoro house, please click on the below links:

ArchDaily, Domus, Phaidon Atlas, Archinect, Deborah Norden Fund

And this is us. You can find out more about us at our website.

GAC: Jamie Setzler, Yutaka Sho, Zaneta Hong and Michael Beaman.

Our Rwandan student partners are Patrice Ndababonye, Doreen Ingabire, Rene Isabane and Theo Uwayezu.


How it works

Our model is to enable self-building traditions common in Africa, and develop local community organizations that want to learn to build and to meet their own needs. GAC's direct involvement is limited to the first several houses, and is focused as much on developing capacity and resilience as it is on construction and technical knowledge. We want to go from a scenario like this:



to one that looks like this:


Over time, the local community assumes control of the building process, managing all the costs, labor and legal issues associated with the building process. Our involvement will taper, though we will always be available for consultation.

Last but not least - why EarthBags, and why the two-story building? EarthBag walls are water, fire, and bullet proof, and have superior thermal and sound insulation performance. The use of soil as a construction material is the only option for low-income people, and most buildings use either kiln-dried or sun-dried brick. The former requires cutting and burning of trees in a country that is facing deforestation, and the latter produces sub-standard homes prone to erosion. EarthBags avoid both pitfalls, and use a waste material that is by-product of oil refining processes. The walls can be erected quickly and require mostly unskilled labor, saving the cost of hiring contractors, and allows the introduction of new skills to villagers with little formal background in construction. And when finished, an EarthBag house can look like any other house, ensuring that it is accepted by the local community. The novelty of the bags brought people together around the excitement of trying something new. 

Brick vs. EarthBag Walls


The two-story house is a way to address the difficulties we have witnessed regarding land tenure. In this small and dense country it is hard to find suitable building sites. We are starting small, by limiting the two-story portion of this summer's house to the utility structure. A small building is a good way to introduce the idea to the workers, and it will allow us to test the incorporation of lateral bracing in the walls, floors, and roof, testing costs and constructability in an efficient manner. We want to limit the amount of bracing (therefore keeping the cost down) needed to build a structure that manages its own loads, active loads (people), and seismic and lateral loads without requiring an expensive concrete frame. This way we can make a great leap towards addressing Association Icyerekezo's housing needs and advancing EarthBag construction techniques along the way.

The Masoro builders


The Lowdown

  • We have raised $18,000 thus far through generous donors and foundations.
  • We need $20,000 more for material testing, equipment rental during the building process (a truck and scaffolding), wages for 50 workers and 4 student interns for 4 months ($2.00/day/person), bringing water to the site, and flights and lodging for one GAC member. Please contact us for a detailed breakdown of material and labor costs. 
  • The association has completed a draft of the bylaws that will govern their conduct, and is working to formalize their standing as a legal entity.
  • The ultimate goal is to build 50 homes in Masoro, developing the capacity of Association Icyerekezo until they are building homes for themselves independently of our involvement.
  • The mayor of the district has signed a Memorandum of Understanding to provide infrastructure for the new village.
  • Dr. Eric Lui, an associate professor of civil engineering at Syracuse University, is coordinating the necessary material testing
  • Dr. Johnny Anderton, who invented the improved EarthBag technique, and Riaan Hough, an EarthBag construction expert from EarthKaya, continue to work with us to ensure the success of the project.


THANK YOU!


Please visit our website at gacollaborative.org to learn more about what we do, aspire to do, and how you can get involved. Please email us with any questions.

Even if you can't donate, no worries, we are glad to be able to share our work with you. So please spread the word.


OUR FABULOUS GIFTS

14 artists, a print shop and GAC have been working together to create a series of fabric patterns inspired by African designs to raise funds for the Masoro project. Here are some samples when they are repeated and printed on fabric:

StitchWorks was initiated by Jungil Hong and Yutaka Sho. The Headlight Hotel Print Shop and Tiny Showcase in Providence, RI, have been donating a percentage of the money from each print sold to a cause chosen by the artist. For StitchWorks, they printed fabric patterns on paper for sale and up to 80% of the proceeds will be used to purchase building materials for the housing construction in Masoro. We would like to share with you these fabulous fabric designs in various forms and for all levels of donations, on postcards, in pamphlets, on paper and fabric.

For StitchWorks on the web, please see the below link:

New York Times, Tiny Showcase Gallery, Inhabitat, Rhode Island School of Design Newsletter

The contributing artists are:



Our BIG thank-you


The video was created by Alex MacInnis and Andy Fedak. The funding for construction and research has been provided by:

story:
Home Sweet Home Grocery

We are Laura + Diandra. We want to start something new in Prince George, B.C.. A downtown Grocery Store where people can buy all kinds of locally made products. From vegetables to cheese...we'll have it all. Bulk dry and deli items, local preserves, soaps and body products, and pre-made meals.

You know, all the things you want but don't have time to make yourself. 

HSH Grocery will provide local producers (farmers and makers of things) with a monday to friday market for their products. This means they can grow their businesses because they will have somewhere to sell their produce and products every day of the week. 

By supporting our campaign, you will help make this community business happen faster. You will be helping local producers grow their businesses and will therefore be helping to improve our local economy. 

The Impact

Raising money for a community project like this is hard.

We need $15,000 just to get started. Some of the costs we have include: leasehold improvements, rent, utilities, fixtures, display fridges, freezers, kitchen appliances, displays, certifications, and more. Oh, and let's not forget all the food! 

HSH Grocery is more than just a store, it will be a Community Hub. You can meet friends to grab a snack at the coffee bar, get information about local products, and learn about small scale gardening or preserving + canning in our workshops. Newly established local producers will be able to rent our certified kitchen to make products to sell in the store. 

Other Ways to Help 

If you can't contribute, please send along links to our campaign to folks who can. That will help us more than you know! 

Feel free to liberally post our videos and links on your Facebook page and Twitter feed.

Check us out at www.yerhomesweethome.com for more ideas!

story:
Kelly Claire Olson passed away on Monday, March 4th.  We will be celebrating her life with a 5k or 1 mile run or walk on Sunday, April 21st at 9:00 am, registration information to follow.

We have established this link for those friends that would like to support the fund but can not be present at the run.

The funds contributed will be donated to a scholarship fund to 'Girls on the Run' and 'Vermont Adaptive Ski & Sports' on behalf of Kelly Olson.


Thank you,

Friends of the Olson Family

story:
Slovenian Summary

Slovenia, A beautiful country that a few know about.

We (Boris, Nataša, Conor, Jolanda) are looking for the founding capital required to start a tourism company in Slovenia. We already have the business plan and contacts to make this work, now we just need to incorporate. Boris and Nataša run their own cafe and are raising a family and together. We see the opportunity this country holds for people in Europe to not have to travel very far with a 12 month vacation opportunity that exceeds the beauty of most countries and is also less expensive. Read on to find out!






Hello friends. Time to educate yourselves on the beautiful country I live in! Many people have never heard of the country.

I live in Ljubljana, Slovenia .. basically it is said like this lyoo-BLYAH-nah and It is the capital of Slovenia (a country of only around 2 million people). The city only has about 250,000 people in it and its the biggest one in the country followed by Maribor, Slovenia.

Slovenia is a ridiculously beautiful country and per land mass is the second most forested (tree coverage) in Europe. The country is very small but is the only one in Europe that falls in the location where the 4 major european geographic areas converge (the Alps, the Dinarides, the Pannonian Plain, and the Mediterranean) So 30 minutes you could be skiing and drive 30 more minutes and you are chill on a sunny beach.

Slovenia is the first former communist state to enter the Eurozone and the most successful south slavic state economically.
Although it is having trouble economically. Slovenia needs to be known and tourists would love it here!

We are forming a company to facilitate the option of Slovenia as viable to tourism markets across the world through travel agencies. Slovenia may be small and still recovering from its Separation from Yugoslavia. Tourism will boost the economy and raise the value of goods within the country.

The Slovenian flag looks like the Russian flag except it has the Slovene seal on it. These colors are considered "pan Slavic" and is why Russia, Croatia, Serbia and the Czech Republic have these colored flags.

I am asking for donations so we can help Slovenia become more known and accessible to the world.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slovenia

We Need Founding Capital You get Products

We just need the funding to deposit our founding capital so we can incorporate. Slovenia requires a decent amount set down for incorporation because when you incorporate you automatically get a pension fun and health benefits.

  • Once we are incorporated we have the contacts to get travel agencies over here and take them on Private tours to get them on board. We already have one on board but to do business we need to be a business.
  • Not many people know where or what Slovenia is. If we can show them, we can Help people find a great reasonable priced vacation/honeymoon/sporting destination while helping the Local economy.
  • Slovenia is In Central Europe and opening up this Region and getting your local travel agengies on board is our number one goal, to make it easy for you to experience the Beauty of this very unique country!

The Impact of Tourism

Slovenia is currently not doing so well in the European Union. Tourism helps a country benefit in multiple ways.

  • Putting Slovenia on the map as a tourist destination is an essential step to improving ALL business with in the country, which in turn helps all in the E.U.
  • Bringing foreigners in, and showing them Slovenia's local beauty and having people spend money directly into Slovenian companies helps those companies expand
  • When Local companies (eg. resorts, hotels) can expand they need to hire other Slovenian companies (eg. architects, contractors, etc.) to facilitate their business needs. Now you can see why Tourism and putting a country on the map for foreign interest would not just help us or the companies we work with but every company and the whole Slovenian economy.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word, Show them pictures of Slovenia. We need you to have faith in our small EU country.

We Need Founding Capital You get Products
We just need the funding to deposit our founding capital so we can incorporate. Slovenia requires a decent amount set down for incorporation because when you incorporate you automatically get a pension fun and health benefits.

Once we are incorporated we have the contacts to get travel agencies over here and take them on Private tours to get them on board. We already have one on board but to do business we need to be a business.
Not many people know where or what Slovenia is. If we can show them, we can Help people find a great reasonable priced vacation/honeymoon/sporting destination while helping the Local economy.
Slovenia is In Central Europe and opening up this Region and getting your local travel agengies on board is our number one goal, to make it easy for you to experience the Beauty of this very unique country!



The Impact of Tourism
Slovenia is currently not doing so well in the European Union. Tourism helps a country benefit in multiple ways.

Putting Slovenia on the map as a tourist destination is an essential step to improving ALL business with in the country, which in turn helps all in the E.U.
Bringing foreigners in, and showing them Slovenia's local beauty and having people spend money directly into Slovenian companies helps those companies expand
When Local companies (eg. resorts, hotels) can expand they need to hire other Slovenian companies (eg. architects, contractors, etc.) to facilitate their business needs. Now you can see why Tourism and putting a country on the map for foreign interest would not just help us or the companies we work with but every company and the whole Slovenian economy.



Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word, Show them pictures of Slovenia. We need you to have faith in our small EU country.

story:
Who We Are

 

We are Pri Lwan ( April) and Thet Thet Tun, friends and business partners who met in Montreal, April graduated from Mandalay University with Bachelor degree in Maths and   finished Construction Technology from Monroe Community College, New York state. Thet finished her BA( Geography) from Yangon university and BA (Political science) degree from Concordia University, Montreal. 

It is a new venture for us however we've been working to bring a Burmese restaurant for over three years, researching, planning and putting the pieces together.

Thet brings a strong background in hospitality and restaurant management having worked her way up in one of the most famous Burmese Restaurats in Rangoon. Pri has small business start-up experience, also has a background in hospitality and service industry and business administration.

 

The Smile and the Artwork of Authentic Burmese Food

In a very developed and well organized society, we are missing something: the friendliness and an authentic food that Montrealers never tried before. To remedy this, we're opening Ruby Burma, a friendly and authentic Burmese Restaurant in Montreal's historic Blvd St. Laurent. Inspired by and driven by local bounty and tourist alike, Ruby Burma will bring all our favourite dishes from every single corner of the our homeland.

Why Burmese Cuisine? After settled down in Montreal, we realized that there is none Burmese restaurant here. In our research at Internet forum, tireless market research, we found out that some Montrealers who experienced burmese food were looking for authentic Burmese restaurant. Why our food is different from other southeast asian countries? Some of the dishes you have never heard: Tea leaves salad, Ginger salad, Shan Noodle, Kachin rice baked with herbs, meat and veges and of course finally “Ohn Noh Khauk Swae”, one of the most famous national soup of Burma(Myanmar).

 

The Art Works of Myanmar Artists: Making food is an Art. While our dishes will be artistically prepared, we would like to add famous Burmese artworks to our dining room. We are bringing the original artworks of both late and living talented artists from Burma so you can enjoy tradition and cultures of Burma.

 

Healthy Food: All of our dishes will be prepared from a scratch to make sure the food is healthy and tasty for our customers. There will be no artificial flavor such as monosodium glutamate, nor processed food in our cuisine. All our sauces and condiments will be made in-house from quality natural ingredients.

In order to serve you the authentic Burmese cuisine, we import some ingredients from Burma while using fresh local products . Ruby Burma will be a BYOW restaurant as SAQ is just on the opposite side of our restaurant.

Moreover , some of the best house special juices such as freshly made Tamarind juice with palm sugar, avocado juice, fresh yogurt drink as well as a variety of unique Burmese Desserts andGelato Icecream will be available to help finishing your meal. Ruby Burma will be opened for lunch, friendly dinners, and possibility of serving Burmese breakfast in the future.

 

The Burmese Flavour Card Campaign

 

We're opening Ruby Burma on a small budget, purchasing an existing restaurant ourselves with our own savings. We're launching this pre-sales campaign to help complete our vision of what Ruby Burma should be and to generate momentum in the lead up to our grand opening.

With your support, we're aiming to raise $10,000 through pre-sales of Ruby Burma meal plan Cards. This money will go a long way in helping to complete the details that will make Ruby Burma special, welcoming everything from outfitting our late-night curry warts window, to getting the right promotion and marketing.

When you buy a Ruby Burma meal plan for a given value, you will get a card pre-loaded with that amount to spend at Ruby Burma. As our thanks to you for buying a Try Burmese flavour before we open, we're offering special perks that range from I love Tea Leaf salad, to having the whole restaurant for your own private party.

 

Thank You!

 

Ruby Burma will be a special neighborhood spot, a meeting place for good folks to eat tea leaf salad with Burmese tea without breaking your wallet. We thank you for your support, whether it's buying a Try Burmese flavour card or sharing this video with your friends.

We look forward to serving you Burmese Cuisine in the early spring of 2013!

 

Address of Ruby Burma Restaurant

3685 Blvd St. Laurent

Montreal, QC H2X 1A1

 

What we need

 

Your support will go towards mainly pre opening promotion, marketing and a commercial dish washer, fixtures and decoration. For that we need at least $10,000.

 

What you get

 

  • The dedicated Ruby Burma team is waiting for you to provide their fresh and nutritious food! Please help us to make this happen. We humbly ask your support to reach our goal!
  • You will be rewarded with the full value of your support with Magic Burmese flavour Card plus extra perks as our way of saying Thank You for believing in Ruby Burma.
  • You help to bring in the only one cuisine that is missing in the Montreal food arena and vibrancy to the Boulv St. Laurent neighborhood! Ruby Burma is not just food, also our unique culture that we want to share with you. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts!!
  •  Your support creates local employments.
  • You are a part of a success story of two Burmese immigrants.
  • you received the  Magic Burmese flavour Card with no expiration date until the day you actually use  it at Ruby Burma.
  • You do not need to go the Burma to experience Burmese Authentic Food.
  • We want YOU to be happy and healthy eating Burmese food and You change our lives!

 

 Note: The given coins in our perks are as old as 1949 made in Burma. These coins are no longer circulated.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you wish to contribute in other ways, your help is still greatly appreciated!

  • Please spread the word to friends and family and help create awareness about the Ruby Burma Restaurant
  • Share and like this link on your facebook and twitter pages.
  • Like us on facebook

Please help us make Ruby Burma Restaurant one of the success stories of immigrants.

You help to bring in the only one cuisine that is missing in the Montreal food arena and vibrancy to the Boulv St. Laurent neighborhood! Ruby Burma is not just food, also our unique culture that we want to share with you. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts!!

you received the  Magic Burmese flavour Card with no expiration date until the day you actually use  it at Ruby Burma.

Please spread the word to friends and family and help create awareness about the Ruby Burma Restaurant

story:
Do you like children? Help me give hope to the Ethandweni Orphans

I am Giovanna Cipriani and i am a journalist that has been covering crisis around the world. I have witnessed first hand the miseries and unjustices of millions around the globe. Please take a look at my work:

http://www.giovannacipriani.com

In the past 2 years I have been telling the stories of "the forgotten people of the world". I try and give a voice to those that most of the time remain unheard.

I went to Zimbabwe and i found a little miracle. The Ethandweni children home in the Motopos Hills.

36 Children live in this community based home. They arrive from different regions in Zimbabwe, they are hurt and sick. Their soulls have been shuttered by terrible events. What do they find here? they find love and care and attention. They find food and healthcare. They learn  and study. In a matter of weeks their eyes change, and their souls start to heal.  

Every day this miracle takes place. 

New children are brought in, saved from certain death and disaster.

We could help the home and the children retain their little and much deserved heaven on earth.

 

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to give the Orphanage $ 20.000 dollars.

They would improve their first aid facility

They would buy crops

they would buy clothes and shoes

they would pay teachers 

And much more..

 

 

 

The Impact

36 children will become your children, you will be proud in knowing that YOU are making a difference. YOU will help those children with HIV get the medicines they need. And The others build  a life they deserve.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't send money, PLEASE:

get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.

use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you!

Giovanna

story:
Summer Soiree!!

Club Venom is a small, one-team volleyball club that's been working hard for the last three years to get good enough to compete with the big guys!

Starting as just a parent that had played, now I now coach a group of hard working girls that play some amazing volleyball.  We had some great wins in Northern California and want to see if we can compete in Southern California.  Additionally, our girls are getting to the age in which they need to get exposure to College Coaches.  As a dad of two of the girls on the team, I don't charge the typical coaching fee of $5000.  I volunteer my time to make sure that these girls learn to love the game as much as I do.

It's going be expensive but with your help we can make it and get the exposure. Let's see if we can compete with the big dogs!! 

What We Need & What You Get

Here is the breakdown:

  • Tournament Fee $750
  • Hotel $1895
  • Extra money will go to getting the girls into Disneyland

We are looking for $1500 at a minimum to offset portions of the cost of this tournament.  We have some great packages available that I believe you will love!!

  • T-Shirts
  • Tournament Entries
  • Team Photo (from the tournament)
  • Autographed Team Photo (my personal favorite, worth millions someday)

The Impact

What will your contribution bring to this group of hardworking girls?

  • Give them the experience they will remember for LIFE!
  • Exposure to College Coaches and maybe the ticket to a Full Ride!!
  • Opportunity to see more of the world than little ol' Modesto

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Please share this with all your friends!
  • Indiegogo share tools can help make this easy!
  • If you love volleyball, help us grow the sport.

story:
Manila Flood

Half of Manila was under water and 250,000 people fled their homes Tuesday as torrential rain paralysed the city, sweeping away houses, stranding residents on rooftops and triggering a landslide.

At least 15 people were confirmed dead as the sprawling metropolis and nearby provinces suffered the most extensive floods since a typhoon that killed hundreds three years ago.

What We Need & What You Get

It is very simpe needs which we are aiming to provide.

  • First Aid & Medication
  • Food, Clothes, toiletries & personal care 
  • Help to rebuild what is destoried, Homes, school, hospitals

The Impact

All of the donated funds will be used for the victims uffering from devastating flood

The National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council said that more than 800,000 people had been affected, with 18,600 in government evacuation centres and some 231,000 seeking refuge with friends or relatives.

Manila's population includes millions of squatters, who were forced to flee the huge shantytowns lining rivers and sewers overnight for the safety of schools, gymnasiums and government buildings.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help u share this fund-raising to your family and friends 

  • Please share our campaign on facebook, twitter or where-ever its possible
  • Click on the icons above to share

Below are the pictures of the flood.

story:
James, Kylei, Abby, and Adi need your help.

   We're all queer and poly, and vary from each other in other non-normative ways.  Daily life is a difficult maze, as we try to build our communities, develop close connections, and make ripples of change in a world that doesn't offer us the same resources that it offers more normative people.  Transcending Boundaries Conference ( http://www.transcendingboundaries.org/ ) is one place we can go where we can learn, grow, and connect with people who have similar experiences and goals.

  This campaign is to help us get to TBC -- we're poor and have work, school, and other time committments which mean we will need to fly to Massachusetts instead of taking a more economical (and slow) route.

our intentions for the conference are to:
James: build connections with other queer and trans folk to make a strong net of social justice activists.
Adi: talk to people, learn new ways to handle the injustices of the world and new ways to help right things.
Abby: learn from people who have taken the steps in their lives that I want to move towards and grown in ways that help them know how to interact in a sometimes difficult world in a kind and loving way.
Kylei: build connections with people I feel safe being out to, and integrate with activists and learn to converse about social justice with people that don't understand.

what we need & what you get

We need to buy conference tickets, flights, hotel rooms, and food: if we are careful and thrifty, we can each go to the conference for $500.  That's a total of $2,000 -- the extra $180 we're asking for is to cover indiegogo's fees.  If we don't meet our goal, the amount we do get will be shared among us and we'll try to raise the rest some other way.  If one of us end up not able to go or if we raise more than what we asked for, the remainder will go to TBC (transcendingboundaries.org) and N/A* (clubs.kennesaw.edu/nonnorm/about-the-group/).

note: If you possibly can, please donate directly with your card instead of by paypal -- they take a chunk in fees.

We're all pitching in to bring you awesome perks!  You'll be able to get custom beaded jewelry, sculpted jewelry for gauged ears, vegan treats (if you live nearby), art tins, handmade buttons, a song written for you, or even a photoshoot!

what your donation will do:

When you donate to this project, you're investing not only in the four of us, but in our impact on the world.  We will return stronger, wiser, and more equipped to handle the daily rejection that the mainstream world presses on us. Here is a more in-depth explanation of what TBC means to us:
 
James:
I hope to learn more about myself as a queer, polyamorous, trans, genderfree, pagan, social justice activist and make new connections that will help me grow. I went to TBC last year and realized for the first time in my life that I am not alone -- my community is just harder to find.  Being there felt like I had finally found the family I'd been looking for all my life.  Going to TBC again this year I have offered to lead workshops and I hope to give as much as I get.  I'm a member of N/A*, an organization dedicated to bringing resources, representation, safety, and community to non-normative people; TBC will help me learn how to better connect with change-makers.

Adi:
I have very few people in my life that I can speak to about human rights issues, even fewer that I can speak to about trans issues specifically. I enjoy speaking to them, most of the people I feel like I gain something from in the same way that you gain knowledge from teaching. A few of the people I feel like I am learning from because they have a different set of oppression and privileges than I do. I think it's important to gain knowledge of those different perspectives. But even fewer, maybe three people in my life, do I feel teach me because our of their much higher level of education on those subjects. I desire all levels of learning, and the fact that there is such a lack of this sort of learning in my life feels wrong. TBC would be important for my life because it could offer that. Not to mention a feeling of belonging that I rarely experience.

Abby:
I've struggled to find words to things I know to be problematic, struggled to make the spaces around me feel inclusive to the diversity of our community when I know it has the potential to be. I feel like a sponge walking into the activism world and I just want to learn more. You can help us start important conversations that lead to action and change in our communities, you can help us so we are better able to create the space and words that are so needed for awesome queers like us.

Kylei:
I went to TBC last year and felt... Home. I still had anxieties, but for once I felt like I could talk about them to people around. It was wonderful and amazing, and I made some (brief) connections there that made me feel like community was brewing. I want to strengthen those bonds. I also feel like I learned more from TBC about successful, non-self-damaging, activism than anywhere else. I want to learn more about activism, and learn better ways of doing it. I feel like I'm very close to the point of being able to explain to non-questioning-oppression-people when something upsets me. For example, a friend of mine uses the word retarded when someone makes a mistake at work, and I feel really upset every time I hear it. I told this person that I have a cousin that is mentally challenged, and they use it less around me, but... I'd really like to be able to explain why it's better to avoid the word completely.  Also, I feel like there is a wall between me and my next step of understanding social justice issues, and while I don't think that TBC would remove the wall, it would probably give me the tools to remove it myself.

other ways you can help

If you can't contribute with money, please help us get the word out -- ask your friends to donate if they can!  Any little bit helps.

Adi: talk to people, learn new ways to handle the injustices of the world and new ways to help right things.Abby: learn from people who have taken the steps in their lives that I want to move towards and grown in ways that help them know how to interact in a sometimes difficult world in a kind and loving way.Kylei: build connections with people I feel safe being out to, and integrate with activists and learn to converse about social justice with people that don't understand.

what we need & what you get

We need to buy conference tickets, flights, hotel rooms, and food: if we are careful and thrifty, we can each go to the conference for $500.  That's a total of $2,000 -- the extra $180 we're asking for is to cover indiegogo's fees.  If we don't meet our goal, the amount we do get will be shared among us and we'll try to raise the rest some other way.  If one of us end up not able to go or if we raise more than what we asked for, the remainder will go to TBC (transcendingboundaries.org) and N/A* (clubs.kennesaw.edu/nonnorm/about-the-group/).
note: If you possibly can, please donate directly with your card instead of by paypal -- they take a chunk in fees.
We're all pitching in to bring you awesome perks!  You'll be able to get custom beaded jewelry, sculpted jewelry for gauged ears, vegan treats (if you live nearby), art tins, handmade buttons, a song written for you, or even a photoshoot!


what your donation will do:

When you donate to this project, you're investing not only in the four of us, but in our impact on the world.  We will return stronger, wiser, and more equipped to handle the daily rejection that the mainstream world presses on us. Here is a more in-depth explanation of what TBC means to us:
 
James:I hope to learn more about myself as a queer, polyamorous, trans, genderfree, pagan, social justice activist and make new connections that will help me grow. I went to TBC last year and realized for the first time in my life that I am not alone -- my community is just harder to find.  Being there felt like I had finally found the family I'd been looking for all my life.  Going to TBC again this year I have offered to lead workshops and I hope to give as much as I get.  I'm a member of N/A*, an organization dedicated to bringing resources, representation, safety, and community to non-normative people; TBC will help me learn how to better connect with change-makers.Adi:I have very few people in my life that I can speak to about human rights issues, even fewer that I can speak to about trans issues specifically. I enjoy speaking to them, most of the people I feel like I gain something from in the same way that you gain knowledge from teaching. A few of the people I feel like I am learning from because they have a different set of oppression and privileges than I do. I think it's important to gain knowledge of those different perspectives. But even fewer, maybe three people in my life, do I feel teach me because our of their much higher level of education on those subjects. I desire all levels of learning, and the fact that there is such a lack of this sort of learning in my life feels wrong. TBC would be important for my life because it could offer that. Not to mention a feeling of belonging that I rarely experience.

Abby:
I've struggled to find words to things I know to be problematic, struggled to make the spaces around me feel inclusive to the diversity of our community when I know it has the potential to be. I feel like a sponge walking into the activism world and I just want to learn more. You can help us start important conversations that lead to action and change in our communities, you can help us so we are better able to create the space and words that are so needed for awesome queers like us.

Kylei:
I went to TBC last year and felt... Home. I still had anxieties, but for once I felt like I could talk about them to people around. It was wonderful and amazing, and I made some (brief) connections there that made me feel like community was brewing. I want to strengthen those bonds. I also feel like I learned more from TBC about successful, non-self-damaging, activism than anywhere else. I want to learn more about activism, and learn better ways of doing it. I feel like I'm very close to the point of being able to explain to non-questioning-oppression-people when something upsets me. For example, a friend of mine uses the word retarded when someone makes a mistake at work, and I feel really upset every time I hear it. I told this person that I have a cousin that is mentally challenged, and they use it less around me, but... I'd really like to be able to explain why it's better to avoid the word completely.  Also, I feel like there is a wall between me and my next step of understanding social justice issues, and while I don't think that TBC would remove the wall, it would probably give me the tools to remove it myself.


other ways you can help
If you can't contribute with money, please help us get the word out -- ask your friends to donate if they can!  Any little bit helps.

story:
Our Project

For the past 7 years the Northeast Beginning Farmer Project has helped thousands of new and aspiring farmers get started, by providing trainings and connections to the resources they need to develop strong farm businesses.

Hearing advice from real farmers--and seeing how things are produced on the farm--is priceless both for these new farmers and for any eater interested in how food is produced. So we began producing videos in 2008, starting with a series called "Voices of Experience," which provides farm business advice from successful small farmers, and "Video Mentors," which shows behind-the-scenes production techniques for vegetables, fruits, poultry, pigs, and more. We've made these clips freely available on our YouTube channel. We've received comments from new farmers all over the world about how helpful these clips have been.

With the funds from this campaign, we will use footage we've already captured to edit and produce 15-20 new video clips, on topics including all aspects of tree fruit farming, farming with draft animals, building and growing in an unheated hoophouse, and more. Just like our previous videos, these will be high-quality, detailed clips that will help new and existing farmers learn first-hand from successful farmers.

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for $15,000, and every penny of that will go to pay our phenomenal videographer, Peter Carroll Productions, to edit and produce new clips, and make them freely available at our YouTube channel. We have set up our campaign to have flexible funding, because if we don't meet our target, we'll just produce fewer clips. If we exceed our goal, we'll produce more clips than we've promised. 

To express our gratitude, we're offering funders a great range of gifts, including farm scene thank-you cards, hard copy "sneak previews" of each video before it's publicly released, and printed copies of our popular Small Farms Program publications. For our highest contributors, we have a few very special opportunities: Associate Producer credits on each video, free beginning farmer online course registration, and a 1-hour Skype consultation with one of our featured farmers!

Our Track Record

The videos we've already produced have been well received by people all over the world, and have actually helped new farms get off the ground. We are approaching 1 million views on our YouTube channel, and nearly 4000 subscribers. Comments from viewers reflect on the quality and level of detail demonstrated in the videos. Don't take our word for it though. The following are excerpts from actual email and Facebook messages sent to the farmers who starred in our videos:

"It amazed me that I could learn so many things I didn't know by just watching your videos! Something that really compelled me to e-mail you and to thank you for was your overwhelming compassion, empathy, and kindness that you show your animals." -from a 16-year-old new farmer in Texas

"I want to thank you for all the generous and detailed information you have shared with the public. It has helped us two city-gone-country people."

"I watched all the Kingbird Farm videos from Cornell while I was in Afghanistan this last go around, and it helped me significantly in my research and inspiration for starting my farm. This year, when I separated from the military, I jumped into farming, and raised many broiler birds. Next year we're expanding to woods-raised pork, and vegetables. Just saying thanks for the videos...I still watch them again from time to time when I need a farm-boost." -from a veteran and new farmer

"I wanted to take just a second to sing your praises. You have inspired our farm to take on pigs, so after three months of planning we got our first pigs yesterday and I wanted to say thank you! You were the only Youtuber out there who talked about training the pigs to the electric fence and how the pigs' nature is to drive past the fence not back away from it."

"We love the videos. Not only are they beautifully done, but we love what you share with viewers and how you share it. You really describe how you arrived at your management, and that gives viewers an example of how they might adjust to make things work for their own land and management needs."

Please help us produce new video clips on topics we haven't yet covered, and help more new farmers develop the skills needed to be successful!

Other Ways You Can Help

There are a few important ways you can support this project without contributing funds! Please help us spread the word by using the Indiegogo share tools to let everyone in your social networks know about it.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Melissa. For the past 6 years, I've been in the Video Game Industry, but, I haven't been that lucky. All my work has been contract work. I've been out of work since June of 2012, and it's time for me to get out of the very fluid industry that I love. I have the job, and the place to live lined up. What I don't have, is the money to get me there. I just need a little help. A little help from a lot of people will get me where I need to go to get set up, and get things in order.

What We Need & What You Get

I need around $1000 to get me, my things, and my two adorable cats to Iowa. 

  • Estimated cost of the U-haul: $604
  • Estimated Gas: $300

The rest of the money will go to additional gas, and getting my boss/friend down to where I am to drive the truck for me.

 

The Impact

This isn't some earth shattering thing. Not some way to change the world. But it's a way to help someone who just hasn't had the best of luck in life get things turned around. And the cats. They'll have a good home, where they can be well cared for. Don't forget the kitties, my little fur-children.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to help, please, spread the word of my campaign to your friends. Maybe they can help.

 

Thank you for reading this, and if you donated, thank you again.

story:
*Missed the Campaign?  Don't Worry! You can still be one of the first to use our plugin or get one of the other perks.
Visit: http://moresharesforyou.com/pro/ 

MoreSharesForYou (formerly known as the Social Exchange Plugin) is the first WordPress tool that puts your content discovery and social sharing on autopilot. You just set up a campaign and people will discover and start sharing your content in minutes.

The test plugin we launched 3 months ago received an enthusiastic response: more than 3500 downloads and great feedback from our users!


http://wordpress.org/support/plugin/social-exchange-plugin

What is it?

A Wordpress plugin for Wordpress powered websites.

How does it help you?

It gets your content shared by other Wordpress users which are also using this plugin.

How it works?

  1. you install the plugin and get free points
  2. you gain more points by sharing other people’s content on social networks
  3. you select the content (blog posts, web pages) that you want others to promote
  4. you use the points in order to have your content shared by others

Which are the advantages?

  • Easily get Social Signals and Social Proof
  • Everything in the same dashboard
  • Fast
  • Easy
  • Autopilot your social sharing
  • Growing network of websites
  • SERP and SEO improvements

For whom is this plugin useful?

  • Website owners
  • Wordpress bloggers
  • Web developers
  • Social media managers
  • Lead generation specialists
  • Online marketing professionals
  • Article writers, contributors
  • Promotion specialists

What is it not?

  • This is not a simple plugin that shares your posts on Facebook after you publish them. It is a complex networking Serving-System plugin that connects your content with thousands of other users. We display (Serve) the content of your choice in the other users dashboards. And their content is served to your dashboard.It is a Win-Win system: if you promote others, you will get promoted (through a points-exchange server system)

We are coming now to ask for funding in order to extend and improve the existing plugin.


Here's what we will offer in the new version:

  • a simplified interface for managing the campaigns
  • more social networks: Twitter tweets, LinkedIn Shares, Google +1
  • a new sharing engine
  • a PRO version with premium features


How will the new MoreSharesForYou plugin work?

Step1: Campaign Start

You start the campaign for any post or page in your WordPress website. This means you open the post you want to promote and fill in the "MAX shares" - that is how many times do you want your post to be shared.





Step 2: Discovering and Curating Content


Your posts and pages are displayed to other users. They can see your information and decide if they like it and want to share it. Your content is thus promoted and you get referrals from all the websites so you can see who (which other bloggers) viewed your content.


Step 3: Sharing

The other users decide on which Social Networks (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Google) to share your content. The same for each user through a reciprocal system of content discovery and sharing based on points.


Step 4:  Watching the results and adjusting the campaign

MoreSharesForYou  is compatible with any plugin that displays social buttons on your site. So if you have any of these social plugins installed, you'll see your shares growing.


If you don't want to install the buttons and show them to your readers, you can edit your post and look for the "Shares done" value - this is the number of shares done through our system. You can pause the campaign, increase or decrease the number of shares to be made.


Where we are now?

We already started the work for the new plugin and a final product will be on the market in January 2014. All the funders will receive the perks they contributed to.


What's the money for?

We use our time and expertise in designing a better product, talking to site owners and getting the things done. Basically all the money goes to programming, servers and marketing (to extend the base of the users).

Also we have many other cool ideas (like cashback, prioritizing posts, targeted sharing) that we would want to add as features in the next releases. If we get enough funds from this campaign, we'll make these ideas happen much sooner.


Choosing the right Perks

The product we build now is MoreFansForYou PRO. You can have this hit for 18$ (the normal price on the market will be 45$ so you are getting a 60% discount). If you need the license for more sites, you can get our 5 X MoreFansForYou PRO perk for only 72$.

You can also contribute by choosing website reviews (with do-follow links), likes campaign or by hiring us for your website evaluation. Please explore the perks on the right and choose what's best for you.


Thank You! 

Alex and Vlad
