Thank You! Alex and Vlad

story:
It Takes A Village

Help us Build a Medical Clinic in

Djati, Guinea Bissau, West Africa

 

Project Summary:

Guinea-Bissau is a small, and often forgotten, West African nation that ranks as the 4th poorest country in the world. Only 56% of its population has access to clean drinking water. The youth remain part of a cycle that leaves 47% of them without the opportunity to attend primary school. The 1.5 million citizens share access to the countrys approximately 45 doctors, leaving them with an average life expectancy of 48 years.

The remote village of Djati, population 1,000, suffers even greater extremes due to its 160 mile distance from the capital city of Bissau. Djati has no medical facility so the sick must be transported 35 miles away to the village of Quebo before they can be treated. During the rainy season the road turns into a river and there is no way for medical help to enter. Only the critically ill are transported out (which is a several hours by canoe).

Djati is the land that time forgot. This project can change that.

 

Project Objectives:

Three Phase Project

Build a Medical Clinic - Phase III

It Takes a Village has teamed up with hip hop artist, Hasan Salaam, FLOW and Lifelink to provide much needed services to Djati, Guinea Bissau. With your help we have already completed the building of a school to replace the temprary structure made of palm frawns and built a fresh water well to end the long walk for water.

We are now beginning our final phase, to build a Medcial Clinic, for which there is an urgent and dire need!


A two room medical structure will be built for the use of trained villagers and/or visiting nurses and doctors. The clinic will make medical care available to the villagers when no outside help and during the rainy season. We will stock the clinic and provide solar lighting so that medical and dental care can be given after daylight hours. Presently there is no electricity in the village and medical services are conducted by flashlight. The new facility will greatly benefit many individuals from the nearby villages who could also be treated at the clinic.

We will fund the project in 2 stages - this is phase 1

All buildings and structures will be designed according to indigenous architecture and constructed with input from the community, creating a sustainable and comfortable space for both children and adults.

 

Project Accomplishments:

Build a Well: Phase II

A hand dug well by Wateraid includes a reservoir tank and a small generator to pump the water to the tank -- or the water may be drawn by hand. The well will be hand dug by 20 men from Djati. This will provide the village with a local and reliable water source.

Completed April 2012

Build a School: Phase I

A permanent 4-room school will be built which can hold up to 200 students. The school will have two classrooms along with two small bedrooms, (which will house the two assigned teachers). Funding for the school will include school supplies and desks. The new school will provide education for children in Djati, as well as children from nearby villages.

Completed February 2012

 

Project Budget:

(itemized breakdown available upon request)

Total Budget for Medical Clinic= $8,000

Round one Total= $2,000                

   

Timeline:

Begin Construction - January 15, 2013

Estimated completion of Medcial Facility - May 15, 2013

 

What you will receive:

Here's your chance to makes a difference. Support our work with a tax-deductible donation today.

When you donate you will become part of a larger global network of hundreds of thousands of people who believe there's nothing wrong with today's world that can't be fixed by empowering people to dream big and figure out how to enact those dreams into real actions in their lives, their communities, and our world.

There are no traditional perks for this campaign as we need all the money to go straight to the project.

What you will receive: Big thanks! Updates! Karma!

To assure your money is going directly to the effort, we will send updates and photos of the project in progress. Every donation no matter how small or large is a tremendous help!

************************

Project Participants:

United States

Devon Austin Blogger and Founder/Project Manager, It Takes a Village, San Francisco, CA

Devon is a Client Advisor with Marsh & McLennan, a Global Insurance Brokerage firm, and a former Stockbroker. Her past accomplishments with It Takes a Village include leading a successful project to send 125 handmade dresses to the girls of Casa Emanuel Orphanage in Guinea Bissau.

 

It Takes a Village - Project Volunteers

A group of DNA traced descendants of Guinea-Bissau working together to give a voice to the voiceless. Their goal is to raise funds to improve their standard of living and quality of life and to bring awareness to the conditions existing in Guinea-Bissau. The group fosters mutual understanding by encouraging cultural exchange through the arts.

 

FLOW For the Love Of Words Music & Media company; Raj Raju, President, North Brunswick, NJ

FLOW is a hip hop music, media, and management company, founded in 2004, focused on musicians striving to make a difference in society. The core belief is that music should touch people, and be a voice for those that dont have one. FLOW is the management and label partner for Hasan Salaam. Together they traveled to Guinea-Bissau in November 2010 to work with the youth, and hold a freedom of speech concert.

 

Hasan Salaam Hip Hop Artist, Speaker, Humanitarian, North Bergen, NJ

Hasan Salaam is an award winning hip hop artist, humanitarian, and public speaker. Hes toured with some of hip hops greatest legends, and been recognized both in the US and internationally. Hes been featured in major media publications, websites, and TV stations as an emerging force in hip hop culture. Hasans work with charities, non-profits, and youth all over the world is a testament of his passion to touch lives. He is the first U.S hip hop artist to ever perform in Guinea-Bissau.

 

Life Link 501(c)(3) Charity; Connie Alessi, President, Claremore, Oklahoma

Life Link is a non-profit, international human services corporation committed to improving the quality of life for children everywhere. Life Link operates orphanages around the world. They currently support five orphanages in West Africa.

 

Guinea-Bissau

Maritza Alvarez Romero Project Advisor, It Takes a Village, Bissau, Guinea Bissau

Maritza is Principal of Liceu Communitario Emanuel High School at the Casa Emanuel orphanage.

 

Freddy Schafer - Executive Director, Project Self-Help, Quebo, Guinea Bissau

Freddy has been doing humanitarian work with the villages of Djati and Quebo for 9 years.

 

Raquel Schafer Nurse, Quebo, Guinea Bissau

Raquel works with her husband Freddy and their youngest son Luke with projects in Quebo and Djati.

  

For more information Please Contact:

Project Leaders

  

Devon Austin

It Takes a Village

devon4africa@gmail.com

925-286-2898

 

Raj Raju

FLOW For the Love Of Words

Hasan Salaam Music

Raj@SimplyFLOW.com 

732-679-7711
story_txt:
It Takes A Village
Help us Build a Medical Clinic in
Djati, Guinea Bissau, West Africa
 
Project Summary:
Guinea-Bissau is a small, and often forgotten, West African nation that ranks as the 4th poorest country in the world. Only 56% of its population has access to clean drinking water. The youth remain part of a cycle that leaves 47% of them without the opportunity to attend primary school. The 1.5 million citizens share access to the countrys approximately 45 doctors, leaving them with an average life expectancy of 48 years.
The remote village of Djati, population 1,000, suffers even greater extremes due to its 160 mile distance from the capital city of Bissau. Djati has no medical facility so the sick must be transported 35 miles away to the village of Quebo before they can be treated. During the rainy season the road turns into a river and there is no way for medical help to enter. Only the critically ill are transported out (which is a several hours by canoe).
Djati is the land that time forgot. This project can change that.
 
Project Objectives: 
Three Phase Project
Build a Medical Clinic - Phase III
It Takes a Village has teamed up with hip hop artist, Hasan Salaam, FLOW and Lifelink to provide much needed services to Djati, Guinea Bissau. With your help we have already completed the building of a school to replace the temprary structure made of palm frawns and built a fresh water well to end the long walk for water. We are now beginning our final phase, to build a Medcial Clinic, for which there is an urgent and dire need!
A two room medical structure will be built for the use of trained villagers and/or visiting nurses and doctors. The clinic will make medical care available to the villagers when no outside help and during the rainy season. We will stock the clinic and provide solar lighting so that medical and dental care can be given after daylight hours. Presently there is no electricity in the village and medical services are conducted by flashlight. The new facility will greatly benefit many individuals from the nearby villages who could also be treated at the clinic.We will fund the project in 2 stages - this is phase 1All buildings and structures will be designed according to indigenous architecture and constructed with input from the community, creating a sustainable and comfortable space for both children and adults.
 
Project Accomplishments:
Build a Well: Phase II
A hand dug well by Wateraid includes a reservoir tank and a small generator to pump the water to the tank -- or the water may be drawn by hand. The well will be hand dug by 20 men from Djati. This will provide the village with a local and reliable water source.
Completed April 2012
Build a School: Phase I
A permanent 4-room school will be built which can hold up to 200 students. The school will have two classrooms along with two small bedrooms, (which will house the two assigned teachers). Funding for the school will include school supplies and desks. The new school will provide education for children in Djati, as well as children from nearby villages.
Completed February 2012
 
Project Budget:
(itemized breakdown available upon request)
Total Budget for Medical Clinic= $8,000
Round one Total= $2,000                
   
Timeline:
Begin Construction - January 15, 2013
Estimated completion of Medcial Facility - May 15, 2013
 
What you will receive:
Here's your chance to makes a difference. Support our work with a tax-deductible donation today.
When you donate you will become part of a larger global network of hundreds of thousands of people who believe there's nothing wrong with today's world that can't be fixed by empowering people to dream big and figure out how to enact those dreams into real actions in their lives, their communities, and our world.
There are no traditional perks for this campaign as we need all the money to go straight to the project.
What you will receive: Big thanks! Updates! Karma!
To assure your money is going directly to the effort, we will send updates and photos of the project in progress. Every donation no matter how small or large is a tremendous help!
************************
Project Participants:
United States
Devon Austin Blogger and Founder/Project Manager, It Takes a Village, San Francisco, CA
Devon is a Client Advisor with Marsh & McLennan, a Global Insurance Brokerage firm, and a former Stockbroker. Her past accomplishments with It Takes a Village include leading a successful project to send 125 handmade dresses to the girls of Casa Emanuel Orphanage in Guinea Bissau.
 

It Takes a Village - Project Volunteers

A group of DNA traced descendants of Guinea-Bissau working together to give a voice to the voiceless. Their goal is to raise funds to improve their standard of living and quality of life and to bring awareness to the conditions existing in Guinea-Bissau. The group fosters mutual understanding by encouraging cultural exchange through the arts.
 
FLOW For the Love Of Words Music & Media company; Raj Raju, President, North Brunswick, NJ
FLOW is a hip hop music, media, and management company, founded in 2004, focused on musicians striving to make a difference in society. The core belief is that music should touch people, and be a voice for those that dont have one. FLOW is the management and label partner for Hasan Salaam. Together they traveled to Guinea-Bissau in November 2010 to work with the youth, and hold a freedom of speech concert.
 
Hasan Salaam Hip Hop Artist, Speaker, Humanitarian, North Bergen, NJ
Hasan Salaam is an award winning hip hop artist, humanitarian, and public speaker. Hes toured with some of hip hops greatest legends, and been recognized both in the US and internationally. Hes been featured in major media publications, websites, and TV stations as an emerging force in hip hop culture. Hasans work with charities, non-profits, and youth all over the world is a testament of his passion to touch lives. He is the first U.S hip hop artist to ever perform in Guinea-Bissau.
 
Life Link 501(c)(3) Charity; Connie Alessi, President, Claremore, Oklahoma
Life Link is a non-profit, international human services corporation committed to improving the quality of life for children everywhere. Life Link operates orphanages around the world. They currently support five orphanages in West Africa.
 
Guinea-Bissau
Maritza Alvarez Romero Project Advisor, It Takes a Village, Bissau, Guinea Bissau
Maritza is Principal of Liceu Communitario Emanuel High School at the Casa Emanuel orphanage.
 
Freddy Schafer - Executive Director, Project Self-Help, Quebo, Guinea Bissau
Freddy has been doing humanitarian work with the villages of Djati and Quebo for 9 years.
 
Raquel Schafer Nurse, Quebo, Guinea Bissau
Raquel works with her husband Freddy and their youngest son Luke with projects in Quebo and Djati.
  
For more information Please Contact:
Project Leaders
  
Devon Austin
It Takes a Village
devon4africa@gmail.com
925-286-2898
 
Raj Raju
FLOW For the Love Of Words
Hasan Salaam Music
Raj@SimplyFLOW.com 
732-679-7711

story:
My beautiful wife and I celebrating my return from Afghanistan

I need your help to grow my Business, Strictly Silver LLC. I have been ignored by dozens of Veteran "friendly" lenders, even though I more than qualify for the Patriot Express Small Business Loan. I've exhausted all the traditional routes for funding. I need your help in order to expand my Business and service the thousands of small scale Silver Investors, and Coin Collectors that are ignored by larger Companies.

________________________________________________________________________

Welcome to my campaign!

  • Strictly Silver LLC is a Certified Veteran Owned Business
  • Contributions will help us purchase the inventory needed to expand our operations
  • We have developed a safe platform to buy and sell rare coins from home

There are thousands of people excluded from silver/coin markets.

  • Large companies ignore the vast majority of silver investors via minimum orders
  • Call any of the Gold/Silver Companies seen on TV
    and note their minimum order requirements
  • We service to individuals who cannot afford a $2,500 minimum purchase order
  • Most people are unaware they can own physical silver for just over $20/Troy Ounce
  • Honesty, Integrity, and Trust will be a breath of fresh air for coin collectors

Additional Information to Consider

Let us know if any of the following documentation would assist you in your due diligence!

  • Cash Flow Projections
  • Current Financial Statements

  • Expense Reports 

  • Company Assets

  • Business Model
  • Business Profile
  • Risk  Mitigating Milestones
  • Streams of Revenue (Short Term/Long Term)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot afford to help financially, but like the idea; spread the word!

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about us

Visit the site:                                          www.strictlysilver.org

Find us on Facebook:                           www.facebook.com/strictlysilver 

Most importantly; we are not the first company to experience the hurdles involved with funding a start-up. However, The Patriot Express Loan was designed to help Veterans navigate these hurdles and ultimately fund small businesses upon returning home from war. The program is not being implemented the way it was written into law.

BLOW THE WHISTLE on Patriot Express Loan for Veterans Program 

  • Report lenders for exploiting Veterans at  www.sba.gov

Just to name a few:

 Bank of America

 Wells Fargo

 US Bank

 Armed Forces Bank


We were denied before we applied! The issue was not related to credit scores nor insufficient income requirements. On top of that, there is absolutely no 'litmus test' to determine Veteran status.

Participating lenders tout the fact that they have lent tens of millions of dollars to Veteran Owned Businesses. This may be the case, however, those millions of dollars loaned are dispersed to only a handful of Veterans.
With the Patriot Express Small Business Loan for Veterans, financial institutions can issue loans that are 85% guaranteed by the Federal Government. 


Thank You for Your Continued Support

-Strictly Silver

_______________________________________________________________________

How to Contact Us:

1 (800) 280-0571

strictlysilver@outlook.com

vincebaur@hotmail.com

Vince Baur:       (713) 449-3748   



                       We are a winning team, and we welcome you to join us!

story:
Happy Birthday!!

Over the past year, we have grown to over 100,000 activists who have walked, run and biked enough miles to go from earth to the moon...and back...three times!

  • You've earned $354,570.47 for charity! Among other things, you have:
  • Funded over $127,000 of Autism, Cancer and Parkinson's research
  • Earned over $50,000 for wounded veterans
  • Earned over $50,000 to protect animals and nature
  • Educated 554 girls for a year
  • Provided 23,584 doses of antiretroviral pills to people living with HIV
  • Fed 407,540 people

And we're only just beginning. At the rate we are growing, we have the potential to move millions of corporate dollars to charity every year — money that companies would otherwise spend on digital advertising like banner ads and spam email campaigns.

But moving this market requires scale. So, to get this scale, we personally funded most of this past year's sponsorship pool ourselves. And this has enabled us to grow large enough to secure great sponsorships from companies like Lifeway and Promax Nutrition.  

However, we're not entirely sustainable yet. Which is why we're hoping you'll invest in the Charity Miles sponsorship fund so that we can continue adding great people like you to our team.

This will enable us to attract more sponsors, so that we can all have an even bigger impact than anyone of us could have alone.

It will also enable us to attract other investors so that we can continue to improve upon the app and build the features that many of you have been requesting. (For example, so that the app can work indoors, on treadmills and spin bikes.)

So, if you've enjoyed using the app this year; if you've been inspired to run just a bit farther; if you've been touched by one of our emails; if you're proud to be a part of this team that is changing the world, please help us take Charity Miles to the next level. #EveryMileMatters!

Look What I Found!

You are the true founders of Team Charity Miles. And we want you to own your place in Charity Miles history. So, we've got some great rewards that will forever distinguish you as someone who helped get this whole thing started.  

Founder's Bib - $26!

 

Tree in The Charity Miles Founder's Forrest - $50

 

Founder's Technical Running T-Shirt - $75

 

Founder's Necklace - $100

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about our campaign to all of your friends.  If you use the IndieGoGo sharing tools provided on this page, then we can track to see who raises the most money.

About Charity Miles

Charity Miles is a free iPhone/Android app that enables people to earn money for charity when they walk, run or bike. Bikers earn 10¢ per mile; walkers and runners earn 25¢ per mile — all courtesy of Charity Miles and our corporate partners.

We launched the app one year ago and have since won wide spread acclaim. Charity Miles has been featured as a favorite app in almost every major fitness magazine, national news programs and morning shows like Live! With Kelly & Michael and The Today Show.

Mashable named Charity Miles as one of its five favorite fitness apps for 2013. We won two Ignite Good Millennial Impact Grants from The Huffington Post and Heartfelt Foundations. And we won both the SXSW Dewey Winburne Award for Social Good, and the SXSW People's Choice Award, two of the top awards at the world's most prominent interactive festival.

But most importantly, we are a team of over 100,000 activists who have walked, run and biked more than 1.4 million miles to earn $350,000 for charity. And we're only just beginning! #EveryMileMatters!

story:
Find us Online

ABC7 news coverage: | http://bcove.me/sl9xkitks |
Local newspaper story: | http://news.fredericksburg.com/newsdesk/2012/12/25/stafford-teen-knits-to-help/ |
Facebook page: | https://www.facebook.com/SoulThreadsKnitting?fref=ts | 

Short Summary

Soul Threads began as a project by friends on the track team and IB programme at Mountain View high school. Currently, Ben Sorensen, Alexander Burlingame, and Emmy Reinwald opperate the bulk of the work because we all have the same desire: to spread our love and affection for those afflicted with cancer. In order to do this, Soul Threads donates hand-knitted beanies to chemotherapy patients in local hospitals. We all know someone or have personally experienced the hardship of this disease, so it is vitally important to us that we can reach as many people as possible. 

If you help us by donating any amount of funds, we can continue this project. The cost of yarn, looms, and other materials is causing us to lose money fast. But we want to continue Soul Threads, and even continue it further. Your dollar could help us impact more hospitals, even homeless shelters, and ultimately more lives. Let us show the power of community in making a difference right here, right now.

 

What We Need & What You Get

One of our primary goals right now is to raise funds in order to subsidize the costs of materials. Each beanie we make can cost up to $10.00, so we are constantly looking for ways to supply the monetary fees to make this work.

We are asking for you to donate any amount of money you feel compelled to, knowing fully that we make zero profit from what you give. All proceeds are put directly back into the project so we can reach more cancer patients. However, we also sell hats. For every hat you buy:

• A hat will be donated to a local chemotherapy patient

• Any and all profit will be used to invest in more yarn for future donations

• Another personal will receive hope from your altruism.

 

The Impact

If we come together and make this work, the impact could be profound. Consider the implications of every dollar you donate. Your money is not going to be lost in the networks of a superorganization. We are simply a group of students with bigger dreams than ourselves. Any money we get will fuel Soul Threads, so that eventually every oncology unit, every homeless shelter, and every person in need in Stafford County would receive a hand-crafted beanie. We believe this can happen, and we hope you do too.

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize not everyone has the capability to help us out economically, and that's okay. Simply spreading the word, telling your friends, posting a link on your Facebook, whatever it may be, would help us immensely. In addition, we also accept yarn donations, so if you have any spare/scrap yarn from your last scarf, send it our way! Remember, Soul Threads is not about us; it is about the people we can benefit with your help.

story:
This campaign is to raise legal funds, so that we can continue to fight for the children, adults, and families who will have limited or no access to much needed mental health services.

Short Summary

Our mental health agency has served individuals in our community for 8 years. We provide therapy for children and adults of all ages and backgrounds. A considerable portion of our work is focused on working with children in the foster care system, children who have been abused, and those with developmental disabilities. We provide psychiatric medication management, parenting classes, social groups, and psychological evaluations. We employ more than 25 people, including a Psychiatrist, Psychologists, Counselors, Social Workers, a LMFT, support staff, and even a local high school intern. We are a group of highly skilled, dedicated clinicians who remain committed to serving individuals of all backgrounds and needs, including the Medicaid population ignored by many others. We are requesting your help to continue doing so.

 

As you have probably heard, there has been enormous scrutiny of the NC Medicaid program and mental health services over the past few years.  In a recent effort to revise and improve the system, a process was put into place that has disproportionately and adversely affected licensed independent providers such as at our Agency, and our ability to offer Medicaid services in the future

 

One such process involves the State requiring providers to submit all of their paperwork to a contracting agency called CCME that will then review and possibly approve payment to be made months after the client has been seen.   There is no surprise that CCME has many flaws, inaccuracies, and inefficiencies in their system for monitoring providers. Even worse, they have a financial advantage to rejecting the claims – they get to extend their contracts for saving money.   A CCME representative told us directly that they would be "working themselves out of a job" as they moved people off of prepayment reviews. A CCME representative told us directly that there are "tricks" that could ensure that we were taken off of prepayment.We have not tried any tricks as we naively believed that the system would work out!

 

Believe it or not, providers can not appeal this process.  Within the past few weeks, numerous small, large, and long term providers in the area have already either gone out of business completely or stopped taking Medicaid.  You will likely be hearing more and more about providers who have either gone out of business or who are no longer going to provide such Medicaid services. 

 

These are a few links that may be helpful for you to put the story into context and to understand that laws have been broken by the DMA/DHHS (the Agency that runs Medicaid), not the providers.

http://www.wral.com/audit-mismanagement-costs-nc-medicaid-system-millions/12048026/

http://medicaidlawnc.wordpress.com/

http://www.wral.com/nc-auditor-dhhs-improperly-paid-580k-in-overtime/12108305/

http://www.wral.com/providers-getting-squeezed-out-by-medicaid-rules/12085183/ 

 

The answer to these political problems should not be to cut Medicaid or to limit the number of providers.  If we do, there will be individuals in our schools, workplaces, and communities without needed mental health services.  They will likely face higher frequencies of academic, legal, and negative societal outcomes. 

 

I have filed several legal motions due to this being an unconstitutional action and the DMA/DHHS/the State not following policies and procedures to support providers and families needing these services.   Our Attorney, Knicole Allen Emmanuel has worked in the State Attorney General’s Office in the past and is now fighting on behalf of providers and small business. We need your help to raise $25,000 in legal funds to fight this process.   The outcome of this fight may help establish a precedent that could benefit others.   Any amount raised over this amount will be used to cover services for the many families who have already lost their therapy.  No amount is too small and we do appreciate your support. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not make a contribution, we understand.  But please share our campaign with others and spread the word about how these types of actions can and will impact the children and families in our schools, neighborhoods, and communities. 

 

.

http://www.wral.com/audit-mismanagement-costs-nc-medicaid-system-millions/12048026/

http://www.wral.com/nc-auditor-dhhs-improperly-paid-580k-in-overtime/12108305/
http://www.wral.com/providers-getting-squeezed-out-by-medicaid-rules/12085183/ 
 
The answer to these political problems should not be to cut Medicaid or to limit the number of providers.  If we do, there will be individuals in our schools, workplaces, and communities without needed mental health services.  They will likely face higher frequencies of academic, legal, and negative societal outcomes. 
 
I have filed several legal motions due to this being an unconstitutional action and the DMA/DHHS/the State not following policies and procedures to support providers and families needing these services.   Our Attorney, Knicole Allen Emmanuel has worked in the State Attorney General’s Office in the past and is now fighting on behalf of providers and small business. We need your help to raise $25,000 in legal funds to fight this process.   The outcome of this fight may help establish a precedent that could benefit others.   Any amount raised over this amount will be used to cover services for the many families who have already lost their therapy.  No amount is too small and we do appreciate your support. 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can not make a contribution, we understand.  But please share our campaign with others and spread the word about how these types of actions can and will impact the children and families in our schools, neighborhoods, and communities. 
 
.

story:
Summary

The island is a mobile event space created to make events unique and legendary. Bangkok is an ancient trading city, known for its many canals, but in recent years the  city center has moved inland to some soul less roads with malls as landmark. The island is born to dispute that and bring the river at the center of Bangkokians life starting with their cultural events. We have a 320 people self powered vessel.  In its natural state is will be one of Bangkok's jewels but it will also be capable of sailing upstream to Ayuthaya and the ancient temples, or south to the sea and its beautiful islands. 

The fact that the boat is mobile is essential to us, as Bangkok's gentrification has taken away lots of its charming neighborhoods, we want to have the choice to be where we see fit and to celebrate all of its diversity.  Our dream is not to create some elitist place but to give Bangkok a venue it can be proud of, a signature to the city wild dreams. 

And here is our wildest dream: while the boat is a great contribution to Bangkok's scene (where alternative artists have a hard time showcasing their art and getting paid for it. Most venue are the size of a shoebox and pay little if anything) our true ambition is to create regular festivals on the riverside, using the Island as a stage.  It will empower a new generation of artist and contribute to the dynamism of the local scene.

This type of project has never been done in Thailand or even in Asia, its has been insanely difficult to get the authorizations. But now, with the heavy job done, we are looking to cross the finish line by the 1 December and we need help to do so.

So what is there left? A lot but the easy part 

  • Interior design and construction all the walls are there, but we need money to bring the island to its true potential: wooden floor, spacious toilets and most important quality sound system.

We are determined to create a warm environment with a strong emphasis on modularity. Because we want to create a place that offers unique events daily, we need an innovative way to deal with lighting, fast decorating. Our style will be definitely modern with touches of 1920’s Da-da art and Bangkok's tradition will be represented.

  • Bringing the dream to the people : while creating a great experience like the island, we are in need in help creating the buzz, get in some magazines, build a brand, website, app... Our first concern is to get the Island finished but we are very aware of the difficulty of creating a new venue in Bangkok and every little help will do its miracle.

So even if you cannot financially help don’t feel bad and give us a share !

story:
PART OF THE SOLUTION


About our snapclarity app and project:

Terrace Wellness Group has 20 years experience in helping youth with mental health issues. We are committed to improving and revolutionizing the way mental health care is delivered. We want to fix the system, now and for good.

That's why we're launching this exciting new application. It is a mobile app, that makes therapy convenient and easily accessible when it is needed most.

Our “snapclarity™” app creates an all-in-one experience that will provide ongoing mental health services that you and your family deserve. Our experience with mental health care motivates us to build the kind of wellness system that we want for our family and friends.

Terrace Wellness Group (Kanata, ON) plans to use snapclarity™ to empower 100 kids in two at-risk Canadian communities making them part of our advisory team. This crowdfunding campaign will enable our ‘soft launch’ phase this summer.

The first is the aboriginal First Nation community in Cross Lake (Manitoba), the other is the community of Woodstock (Ontario). Both have sadly made national headlines due to a suicide crisis that has claimed the lives of many youth. Both youth and community leaders are asking for additional resources and support for mental health services in these communities.

Our Snapclarity™ app will be distributed via smartphone (with prepaid service for 3 months).

Phones will be distributed ASAP to 50 youth in Cross Lake First Nation community and 50 in Woodstock, Ontario. We’re already working with community leaders to ensure they are supported now and in the future.

We have 30 licensed counsellors from our Terrace Wellness team volunteering and ready to start helping these kids and communities ASAP.

We’ve taken this as far as we can… that’s why it’s time to launch this campaign!

They need your help now!

Together - we can reduce youth suicide rates in Canada

Every single dollar you donate helps us to get this app into their hands faster!

With this app we can give these young people the support and tools they need.

We will empower youth and help parents, families, and communities to heal.


Our solution:

Snapclarity™ will provide secure online support to these communities.

  • We are bringing 20 years of knowledge, experience, and compassion. This incredible new app connects kids with licensed counsellors who ‘get it’ and can help give them coping skills for their mental health needs.

Who is on board already?

Our own awesome highly skilled volunteers and some key corporate support!

We are in discussions with a major telecommunications company to receive the 100 phones we need (including data). This is huge!

How will it work?

A pre-loaded smartphone (with the app and data) will be given to 100 youth in two Canadian communities (Cross Lake and Woodstock). 50 smartphones will go to youth in Cross Lake, and 50 will go to youth in Woodstock. This is the start of our soft launch!  

Here’s what they will get:  

A prepaid/preloaded smartphone with the snapclarity™ app.

  1. The ability to have an online chat with one of our professional therapists at any time once matched

  2. Health care professionals in the community will have access to the Terrace Wellness experts. We will work closely with other mental health workers and community leaders to help ensure a smooth roll-out. We’ll also be staying involved for the long-haul.

Here’s what we’ll be doing:

We will be supervising our team of volunteers in-house. They will have free access to any additional training/support they need.

We’ll use the app to engage youth and their communities in a 3 month 'test drive' of the app before the full release, their feedback will make the full app even better!

Why we need your help:

Immediate access:

Access to this type of ‘on demand’ network supports existing mental health efforts in these vulnerable communities

We’re providing ‘on demand’ counselling and support when it is needed most.

Empowering:

Empowering youth to tell their story to someone they can trust who has the skills and training to begin helping them right away.

Ultimate goal:

Reduce suicide rates and provide faster interventions before a crisis.

With your support  we can all help reduce the stigma of mental health and get these kids the support they need when they need it most.


snapclarity™


What does it do?

  • Our platform creates the all-in one experience NEEDED for real-time support.

  • Immediate access to skilled staff backed by Terrace Wellness’ 20 years of experience in treating youth with mental health concerns.

  • Help community leaders build an accessible wellness system everyone wants and deserves, regardless of geographic location.

Part of the Terrace Wellness Group’s mission:

  • We are changing the way mental health is delivered. We are passionate about mental health and believe that you and your family deserve better.

How does it work?

  • We match individuals with our licensed therapists/counsellors.

  • Users get started by answering a few simple questions online and the platform matches you to a trained therapist.

  • Once matched, the person can chat with the therapist as much as he/she wants on any subject.

Get involved today:

  • Make an immediate impact

  • Empower youth

  • Show kids and their communities that they are not alone

  • Help lay a foundation for a stronger tomorrow for all youth across Canada

What snapclarity isn't:

  • Snapclarity™ isn't a gimic - it's a carefully designed tool backed by licensed mental health professionals

  • Snapclarity™ isn't a silver bullet  (It won't fix everything - but it is a great start!)

What we need from you

WITH YOUR HELP we can make big changes that have a positive lasting, ripple effect; these communities can start to heal and move forward.

  • They need your support and connections.

  • Please tell everyone you know on social media, at work,and/or at home to donate.

  • Your donation of $1 or more is gratefully accepted and makes an impact.

  • Your support will help decrease stigma, and allow these kids to turn their situations around.

THE SITUATION

Why these communities and youth first?

Many communities around Canada are in crisis. Several have declared a state emergency in recent months/years, related to serious and prolonged mental health concerns of their community members. Youth are often the most affected.

  • Aboriginal individuals have a 22% suicidal ideation.*

*Source: First Nations Regional Health Survey (2008-10)

Various issues contribute to the current situation. We have a viable solution.

The snapclarity™ app enables youth and community leaders to reach out and get tangible, meaningful support in minutes. A support that is currently very limited on the ground locally, and/or that may require several days travel to a different city to acquire.

  • Woodstock (Ontario): This community is approximately 2 hours from Toronto. It recently reported about 17 suicide attempts among youth. There is also rumour that there are suicide pacts in place. This community is acting, but they need our resources.

  • Cross Lake (Manitoba): this remote aboriginal community recently had 6 suicides (all youth) in the span of 3 months. Mental health workers and the chief are struggling to cope with over 100 kids currently on suicide watch. This community is acting, but they need our resources.

These situations break the hearts of families, friends, teachers and community leaders. People across Canada have reached out and are trying to find ways to help and show support.

Snapclarity™ is a powerful tool in the arsenal of support being launched. With your help communities will have these tools in their hands literally by this summer.

Call to action

Whether you are in Canada or elsewhere around the world, this is your chance to help!

We love that you are joining us on this journey. Every single dollar counts! 100% of donations will go straight to the release and distribution of this app to youth who need it most (as determined by community mental health/community leaders). This is your chance to help children, parents, and communities heal right now. Together we can create hope, teach coping skills, and lower the suicide numbers.

We believe

Change starts with an idea. Simple ideas can lead to big shifts. That’s what Terrace Wellness Group and snapclarity™ are all about.

We believe it’s time for Canada’s mental health system to evolve!

Our youth deserve a better world. Your children deserve better, and our communities need and deserve our help.

In the midst of crisis – they need a voice. They need a trained ear to listen to! Snapclarity will provide both in real-time.

One idea can transform into something bigger than yourself. Help us reach out and show these kids/communities that better is possible.


#BetterIsPossible


Links to media coverage on the issues

http://www.ctvnews.ca/health/suicide-among-canada-s-first-nations-key-numbers-1.2854899

http://www.theglobeandmail.com/opinion/behind-the-tragedy-of-cross-lake/article29282579/

http://www.am980.ca/2016/06/01/oxford-county-youth-suicides/


Media on snapclarity™

http://www.noeticmindset.com/blog/2016/6/28/3-reasons-why-the-snapclarity-app-might-be-the-next-big-startup-and-why-you-should-support-their-cause
http://www.ottawamediagroup.com/snapclarity/

STRETCH GOAL ($30,000)

If we hit our stretch goal, our biggest donors get even bigger perks !

Backers (individual or Corporate) who donated $500+ WILL RECEIVE THE FIRST FULL ITERATION OF THE APP (HARD RELEASE) - anticipated delivery Dec. 2016

story:
Short Summary

We are Ben & Guy, two friends from England with a passion for travel and the hospitality industry. We met 9 years ago at The University of Exeter and, having first travelled through this amazing country as only passing tourists, we fell in love with the place and returned to live and work here. We now want to encourage others to share with us our love of this country.

In 2015 we stumbled across a spectacular plot of land close to the Caribbean coast, next to the Buritaca river. 

If successful, we will be one step closer to realising our dream of sharing a slice of paradise with you all. We wish to create a safe and environmentally sustainable place in this beautiful part of Colombia. We believe we can begin to make the most of this pristine area for the benefit of local people and its visitors alike, without destroying its beauty. 

To achieve this we need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to raise £15,000 to aid with the construction of dorms, private rooms, a new septics system, bathrooms and the bar. The money raised will also help to furnish the new buildings as and when they are built! 
We are offering all sorts of perks, from exclusive El Rio Hostel stash to all-inclusive stays with us, even the opportunity to have a bed or room named after you.
We are on fixed funding, so unless we reach our target we won't receive any of the money. 

Local Impact

We are based outside of a small town called Buritaca on Colombia's Caribbean coast. Tourism in the area is ever increasing and small businesses like ours will provide jobs and opportunities to locals, as well as bringing more custom to existing businesses in the area. We already work with local builders and suppliers, which will only increase as our project grows. 

Risks & Challenges

Starting a business here in Colombia is not without its challenges. Over the past 15 months living and working here, we have learnt quickly how to overcome these difficulties. 

Unfortunately Colombia still suffers from a poor reputation in some countries as being violent and dangerous; we believe that projects like ours, promoting environmentally friendly and sustainable tourism, can change that image, which is now outdated. 

Between us we have over 20 years of collective experience working in hospitality. Thus, we will hit the ground running once we are fully constructed - we just need a little push to get us there!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't stretch to one of our perks, please share this anywhere you can to help us get the support we need!

Follow our progress on Facebook - Facebook.com/elriohostel & Instagram - instagram.com/elriohostel

story:
Our Story

Graze the Roof, GLIDE's (https://glide.org) rooftop garden, is located on the rooftop of GLIDE's main service building at 330 Ellis St. GTR was started in the summer/fall of 2008 by a group of volunteers passionate about sustainability, local food, building community and environmental justice.

Graze the Roof demonstrates a low-cost, innovative approach to container gardening, educates local youth on ecological systems by engaging in all aspects of gardening from seed planting, to stewardship, to harvest to celebration, and empowers community members by providing access and opportunities to teach, learn and engage with this vibrant example of urban agriculture.

Graze the Roof needs your help! We are reaching out near and far to help raise our annual budget for Autumn 2012 - Autumn 2013. Our fundraising campaign will run from September 4th - October 4th. 

 

The Impact

Graze the Roof strives to provide access and rich educational opportunities to the GLIDE community and the greater Bay Area community at-large. The garden is open to the public every Thursday from 10a-2p for a volunteer workday, where diverse members of the community show up to get their hands dirty as they help with the dynamic development of the garden. One Sunday a month, Graze the Roof project managers lead educational tours in the garden following GLIDE's celebration service (tours at 10:30 and 12:30) as well as a FREE afternoon workshop in the garden connected to different topics relating to Urban Agriculture, Sustainability, Culinary Art, and Community Building. Check our website for upcoming opportunities to visit and learn in the garden. (http://grazetheroof.blogspot.com)

In partnership with the Janice Mirikitani's Family, Youth and Childcare Center, Graze the Roof offers inner city children the opportunity to access a safe, beautiful and diverse food garden through after-school programming. 

The impact of this campaign will support all areas of Graze the Roof's programming. From operations to volunteer management, to materials, and honorariums to support our expert workshop presenters. The funding we raise from this campaign will support our annual budget to keep this project going. 

If we do not raise the necessary funds come October 2012, there will be limited funds to keep this project going through 2013. 

Thank you for your support, and your passion for urban agriculture, sustainability and environmental justice. Graze the Roof could not do it without YOU!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have calculated our needs and it comes out to $18,000 annually, that breaks down to $1,500/month. 

In the spirit of transparency, here's where it goes:

$1000/month pays two consultants to guide strategy/development of garden, manage volunteers, run community programs, document the project, and build partnerships across Bay Area organizations and corporations.

$400 covers all necessary materials to support the dynamic development 

$100 is offered as an honorarium supporting our expert workshop presenters, and ensures that these quality educational opportunities remain FREE and available to all members of our our diverse community

In exchange for supporting Graze the Roof we want to THANK YOU by sharing the abundance we are cultivating in the garden:

The Gift of Seeds we've saved over the last several seasons adapted to THRIVE in our Bay Area microclimate

The Gift of Participation, Education, Empowerment in monthly tours and workshops for YOU and your friends

The Gift of Harvest, a bag of our freshest, most flavorful heirloom salad greens and other seasonal goodies

The Gift of Community and Celebration, a seat for 1, 2 or 4 at a special Harvest Dinner celebrating our seasonal bounty. Hosted by Project Managers Lindsey Goldberg and Nikolaus Dyer and members of the GLIDE staff, you will be treated to delicious food, and live music amidst a very unique garden and the vibrant cityscape of San Francisco.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We welcome supporters of Graze the Roof to join us for our weekly Volunteer Workdays, every Thursday from 10a-2p or for any of our monthly tours and workshops. If you have any questions and/or want to get involved, email: grazetheroof@gmail.com.

It takes a community to GROW a Garden! Spread the word. Tell your friends, family members, colleagues, students, teachers, and mentors about this unique project and ways they can help! 

You can find Graze the Roof on Face Book, and make sure to check out our website for stories, and photos documenting the project and for upcoming tours/workshops in the garden!

THANK YOU!
story_txt:
Our Story
Graze the Roof, GLIDE's (https://glide.org) rooftop garden, is located on the rooftop of GLIDE's main service building at 330 Ellis St. GTR was started in the summer/fall of 2008 by a group of volunteers passionate about sustainability, local food, building community and environmental justice.
Graze the Roof demonstrates a low-cost, innovative approach to container gardening, educates local youth on ecological systems by engaging in all aspects of gardening from seed planting, to stewardship, to harvest to celebration, and empowers community members by providing access and opportunities to teach, learn and engage with this vibrant example of urban agriculture.
Graze the Roof needs your help! We are reaching out near and far to help raise our annual budget for Autumn 2012 - Autumn 2013. Our fundraising campaign will run from September 4th - October 4th. 
 


The Impact
Graze the Roof strives to provide access and rich educational opportunities to the GLIDE community and the greater Bay Area community at-large. The garden is open to the public every Thursday from 10a-2p for a volunteer workday, where diverse members of the community show up to get their hands dirty as they help with the dynamic development of the garden. One Sunday a month, Graze the Roof project managers lead educational tours in the garden following GLIDE's celebration service (tours at 10:30 and 12:30) as well as a FREE afternoon workshop in the garden connected to different topics relating to Urban Agriculture, Sustainability, Culinary Art, and Community Building. Check our website for upcoming opportunities to visit and learn in the garden. (http://grazetheroof.blogspot.com)
In partnership with the Janice Mirikitani's Family, Youth and Childcare Center, Graze the Roof offers inner city children the opportunity to access a safe, beautiful and diverse food garden through after-school programming. 
The impact of this campaign will support all areas of Graze the Roof's programming. From operations to volunteer management, to materials, and honorariums to support our expert workshop presenters. The funding we raise from this campaign will support our annual budget to keep this project going. 
If we do not raise the necessary funds come October 2012, there will be limited funds to keep this project going through 2013. 
Thank you for your support, and your passion for urban agriculture, sustainability and environmental justice. Graze the Roof could not do it without YOU!
 


What We Need & What You Get
We have calculated our needs and it comes out to $18,000 annually, that breaks down to $1,500/month. 
In the spirit of transparency, here's where it goes:
$1000/month pays two consultants to guide strategy/development of garden, manage volunteers, run community programs, document the project, and build partnerships across Bay Area organizations and corporations.
$400 covers all necessary materials to support the dynamic development 
$100 is offered as an honorarium supporting our expert workshop presenters, and ensures that these quality educational opportunities remain FREE and available to all members of our our diverse community
In exchange for supporting Graze the Roof we want to THANK YOU by sharing the abundance we are cultivating in the garden:
The Gift of Seeds we've saved over the last several seasons adapted to THRIVE in our Bay Area microclimate
The Gift of Participation, Education, Empowerment in monthly tours and workshops for YOU and your friends
The Gift of Harvest, a bag of our freshest, most flavorful heirloom salad greens and other seasonal goodies
The Gift of Community and Celebration, a seat for 1, 2 or 4 at a special Harvest Dinner celebrating our seasonal bounty. Hosted by Project Managers Lindsey Goldberg and Nikolaus Dyer and members of the GLIDE staff, you will be treated to delicious food, and live music amidst a very unique garden and the vibrant cityscape of San Francisco.
 


Other Ways You Can Help
We welcome supporters of Graze the Roof to join us for our weekly Volunteer Workdays, every Thursday from 10a-2p or for any of our monthly tours and workshops. If you have any questions and/or want to get involved, email: grazetheroof@gmail.com.
It takes a community to GROW a Garden! Spread the word. Tell your friends, family members, colleagues, students, teachers, and mentors about this unique project and ways they can help! 
You can find Graze the Roof on Face Book, and make sure to check out our website for stories, and photos documenting the project and for upcoming tours/workshops in the garden!
THANK YOU!

story:
New Healing System-BioMat and sound healing with Bali steel 

This is my video for Indiegogo...
I am launching a funding campaign to raise $3,000 to buy a Bio Mat and a Bali Steel Hand Pan. (each $1,500) My plan is to create a new healing paradigm combining crystal and light therapy (Bio Mat) with sound therapy (Hand Pan), energy healing and possibly aromatherapy as well. I want to help heal people and believe this will be a powerful healing modality.
I have been a yoga teacher, musician, energy healer, photographer, and dj for 15 years and I'm ready for a new career combining all of my talents and skills.
I will be giving great rewards for those who contribute and pledge to the campaign. :)
I hope you will share this with as many people as possible and that you feel compelled to contribute.

Funding needed -$3,000

The Bio Mat is an amazizing peice of healing equipment, filled with amethyst crystals and using far-infrared light.

www.biomat.com

Benefits of the BioMat:

  • Reduces stress and fatigue
  • Relieves anxiety and promotes relaxation
  • Improves sleep patterns
  • Reduces inflammation
  • Eases joint pain and stiffness
  • Provides warm, soothing pain relief
  • Eliminates toxins in the body
  • Increases blood circulation
  • Alleviates migraines and tension headaches
  • Reduces allergy symptoms
  • Improves immune system function
  • Improves cardiovascular health
  • Burns calories and controls weight
  • Improves muscle tone and skin quality

 The Bali Steel hand pan (similar to a hang) has a truly soothing sound when played and can bring the   listener to a blissful place. You'll see an example of this instrument in the video.

New career and new healing system

Your contributions will help me start a new career and do what I was meant to do in this world! I was meant to be a healer and everything I have ever done in my life leads up to this moment. I have been struggling for the last 2 years and this is my opportunnity to start anew. I am in grattitude for any help you can offer.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help contribute but want to help please pass the word and get people excited! This is your opportunnity to help out.

story:
* Each reservation will include a limited edition box. The box shown is a prototype, the final version will contain the bottle and batch number as well as our logo burned into both sides of the cover. 

LOON LIQUORS was started by two good high school friends Simeon Rossi (Chief Artisan), and Mark Schiller, (Chief Business Officer) who stumbled into their dream at a White Russian party

LOON LIQUORS' MISSION is to craft delicious, unique, organic liquors from ingredients and packaging sourced as local as possible while maintaining a positive impact on the environment

PLEDGES WILL GO TO: Purchasing equipment, obtaining distilled spirits plant license, and everything else to launch Loonshine

IF 200% FUNDED we will not need further funding and we will be on the shelves much faster. Therefore, if we are over 100%, please continue to contribute and make our daily dream become reality

A POSITIVE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT will be achieved by recycling, composting, or selling every material brought into the distillery. In other words, a trash can will not be needed. We're looking for strong environmental conservation partners wherever we do business

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP: Not everyone has money to contrbute, but if you would like to be a part - please spread the word how ever you can!

story:
Mayari is a mother of three young children, a birth doula, and a homeopath. Until recently, she was a stay-at-home mom who was slowly building her homeopathy practice so that she could jointly support her household. Due to recent unexpected events, Mayari is now a single mother and the sole support for her family.

Mayari is a skilled homeopath, and is in the process of launching her new practice. Once this practice is going strong, it will support her and her family. For a period of time as she builds this practice, however, she needs our assistance to make ends meet. She has helped many homeopathic clients reclaim their health and vitality.

In her job as a birth doula, Mayari is on call 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, and needs to be able to drop everything to be with her birthing mothers when they go into labor. Because of this schedule, Mayari has had difficulty finding a part time job. Additionally, because she is self-employed and until recently was part of a household that had a much higher income, she has been unable to receive even enough temporary government assistance to cover her family’s basic needs.

Mayari is a caring, nurturing, giving woman whose love and support have touched many in our community. When other families in the community have needed a helping hand, she has been there, offering food, financial assistance, childcare, and loving friendship. She has helped many mothers give birth to their babies in joy and strength, including our own. The gift of strength and support that she gave us and so many other women during the hours of our child’s birth touched our lives so deeply and now we want to help give back even a fraction of what she gave to us. By joining us to give help in the time when she is in need, you will help ensure that she will be able to continue giving that help and so much more to new mothers in the future. She is working hard to create a stable income from a standing start, and she needs help. Thank you for any help that you can provide.

story:
Hi! My name is Nick Laurence Kirchmar. I am a former theatre geek. I was an actor and then toured with several Broadway shows as the merchandising manager, You know? the T-Shirt dudes in the lobby? Anyway, I have always had a background in either theatre, marketing or retail.

In 2007 while attenting the University of Wisconsin to get a degree in Stage Management, I was diagnosed with bladder cancer. I was devasted but, I was not going to let this get me down, I remained in school and attended my classes as well as did volunteer work with my Fraternity, Tau Kappa Epsilon. 

I went through BCG treatment (Essentially BOVINE TB) and because of that, many things bothered my skin, so I began making organic soap as well as soy candles and skin care products to keep my skin soft and not dry and cracked. by 2010 I had a nice little company going but then the cancer came back. 

Because of the bladder cancer's return, I was no longer able to make soap and adhere to the soap making process as I constantly had to use the restroom. After another 3 months of BCG, I was told the cancer had metastasized and I had inoperable liver cancer and basically a year to live. I went thru 7 cycles of chemotherapy from Nov of 2011 to May of 2012 consiting of a 9 hour day, a 6 hour day 8 days later and a very painful shot, then a 14 day break.

In April I was told they could not see any tumors or lesions on my liver and my lymph system was no longer swollen. I have basically beaten cancer and I owe it to changing what I eat and put in my body. (only organic and all natural) A positive attitude, amazing friends around the world on Facebook, and using natural products. I was given a second chance and so far have been cancer free for 4 months. I did this all on my own, as my family did not think I was worth a phone call or even a get well card. Maybe because they don't approve of my lifestyle. 

I love making and creating Organic soaps and skin care products. They are allergen free and I use only the purest and most natural ingriedents and essential oils. The new skin care line I am creating will be amazing and will be called Joseph Nicolas. I am creating recipes that will be friendly for cancer patients and those with sensitive skin needs.

Because I am currently on disability and because I was a student for 4 years, I barely make enough to pay the monthly bills. So, I am now trying to revive the soap company and make it so that I can be self sufficiant, get off disability and create wholesome, green and natural products for the whole family!

What I Need & What You Get!

This is where you come in. I am going to offer some amazing perks for those who donate and help. Every little bit counts.

Most of the funds will be used to buy the oils and supplies needed to make the soaps. I have also figured in the new artwork and design fees as well as the website and shopping cart feature.

I will also need to purchase a small tent in order to do outdoor craft fairs and also a cpl tables. I will also need an iPad in order to maintain inventory, recipes and also to process payments through Square. A Point of Sale system would be over $4000 but now because of Apple, the Ipad and Square... POS is now obsolete!

The perks are pretty amazing! and now that I have decided to also create the skin care line, each donation will get an item from the new Joseph Nicolas line. I will have lip gloss, body butters, beard oil, skin cleanser and an amazing organic goats milk anti aging line especially created for women!

All funds will be used for initial start up, if I am able to purchase things at a discount or on sale, then any extra funds will be donated to The Trevor Project, Broadway Cares Equity Fights Aids and Broadway Barks.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know some of you may not be able to hep financially, but spreading the word is the next best thing and you shall have good karma and my eternal thanks!! And if I see you at a fair or show... you tell me you passed the link or made a contribution and I shall give you a big hug!

So tell everyone you know!! and be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools located on this page so people will know it is legit!

And that’s all there is... For now! :)

story:
The Company Market

Hello,

My name is Daniel Medina and I am the CEO of The Company Market. I have studied Business Management and Economics at Empire State University in 2003. I continue my education with business books as running a business is a passion I have. 

We are growing and looking to raise funds for a national marketing campaign. We have worked hard to align ourselves with key businesses that help us offer great products and services without creating higher cost for the client. We are confident we can dominate our industry and are very excited to implement our strategy.

With your contributions, one day we might be a household name and you can say "I contributed to that company when they were just a small operation". That is a great feeling and wish I had the opportunity to help companies like Apple, Microsoft and Facebook.

We are looking to raise $4,000 to help with a marketing campaign. Here is a list of what the funds will be used for:

  • Sales Letter
  • SEO
  • Lead Generation
  • Email marketing
  • Website Programming
  • Keywords
  • Monetizing
  • Google 1st page

These are just some of the items and we have teamed up with an amazing marketing company that has been producing results since 1970.

We would also like to offer discounts to our service for all contributions and we will create a page on our website giving thanks to every single person who helped our company grow. A dedication just for you.

In the event we don't reach our goal, we will still proceed with the marketing campaign with what can be done and add to it as we slowly grow. 

So now it's up to you and your help will be beyond appreciated. Even if you cannot contribute, spread the word and help us grow just by promoting what we do. 

Thank you very much for taking the time to read our pitch. 

 

Daniel Medina

CEO

The Company Market

story:
We all hit a time when we’ve lost hope and need someone to put their arms around us and say, “I’ve got you right now.  I won’t let you face this alone.”

My dear friend Debbie is going through one of those times right now.  She has been married for nine years and has two beautiful children.  In winter of 2010, weeks after her father died in a freak accident she found out that her husband had been having an affair.  She wanted to try and make the marriage work but her husband decided to move on.  Debbie lost her father and her husband all at once.  These are two of the biggest life stressors that a person can face.  Of course she felt helpless and devastated.

She is worn down in every way and is now in the middle of this contentious and unnecessary custody battle.  Her children mean everything to her and frankly she is one of the best mothers I have ever known.  I can’t imagine why he would want to do this but regardless, she needs help. 

You may not know her personally but I have known her for almost 20 years.  She is a true friend and a wonderful person.  She has raised money for numerous causes throughout her life and is now in a position where she needs others to come to her rescue. I know we can make a difference. 

According to her lawyer, she will need an additional $30,000 to complete 2 trials-one for custody and one for divorce. That number sounds incomprehensible but if anyone reading this can donate just a little, it is achievable.  Have you spent $100 on a nice meal or a pair of jeans?  Well you can spend the same $100 to change someone’s life.  Please help Debbie.  She is a warm, loving and special person who desperately needs help.  Being generous feels good.  Every penny she gets will go to her attorney and court fees.  She is embarrassed and humbled to be in a position to need help but she is truly desperate.  Thank you for having compassion.

story:
The Horsepower.com story

The average farmer takes home only $0.18 of every dollar of product grown. We want to change that. Instead of sending that money to brokers and middlemen, why not give some of it back to the hard-working small farmer?

And why can't the consumer buy fresh organic eggs and vegetables from their local farmer? 

Horsepower.com was built to connect local small farmers and buyers within our very own communities.

The founder's dream for Horsepower.com include:

  • knowing your local farmer and what his or her practices are (is he or she using pesticides?)
  • delivering food that taste better because it was grown locally and didn't travel 1000 miles
  • reducing the costs of food and increasing the profit for the small farmer. Remember- no middle man. 

What We Need & Why

The founders, being small farmers themselves, have a desire to keep Horsepower.com free. But to keep it this way, we need your support. We need funds to continue building the site and connecting each of us to our local farmer. Raised funds will go to:

Development: Our team is hard at work creating a tool that's exactly what farmers need to grow their business and reach more consumers. Your help will allow us to connect farmers and buyers in every possible way including:

  • Classifieds ads
  • Farmers Markets & Fairs
  • Backyard Vegetable Exchanges (when you have excess vegetables and fruit, why not trade with someone in your community!?)
  • Farm Store Fronts with a price list showing daily inventory
  • Allowing the agriculture youth such as FFA and 4H to sell their animals on our site
  • Creating a payment system to streamline farm to fork transactions. 
  • Building a Rating system so farmers and buyers are accountable to the community. 
  • Allow farmers to Broadcast their offers. Do you realize farmers are still faxing their offers one at a time? How about we allow farmers to broadcast 1 offer to hundreds of their customers with a click of a button?

These are just some of the great ideas we want to work on. We also want to hear from you about any ideas you have for our site.

User Education: Farmers are are a traditional group, and we want our site to work for them, not the other way around. Learning a new technology can be overwhelming, especially when farmers need to spend the majority of their time growing the food we eat! Your contributions will help us host workshops and send representatives right to the farmers to educate them and get them set up on Horsepower.com

Marketing: With your support, we can partner with Comminity Support Agriculture programs and farmer's markets and help farmers build relationships with their customers, restaurants and other farmers. 

The Impact

We believe in a food system that runs on Horsepower.com. The implications are huge: imagine just one family getting their weekly groceries not from a supermarket, but from a farmer down the street. This reduces transportation costs and time, allows the family to know what they're eating and where it came from, and helps the farmer create connections so that his business grows. On the flipside, backyard farmers can sell what they grow without having to pay farmer's market fees or spending too much time marketing their products. We also believe strongly in encouraging consumers to buy local when their budgets allow, to care about how their food is grown - whether that's conventionally or organically - and to meet and know their farmers. If you buy local, the money stays in your community. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We'd love it if you'd spread the word about what we're doing, give us your feedback on the site, or just help a local farmer out by buying local and direct. Come to horsepower.com and see for yourself what we have started or watch a tutorial on how to use the site. Sell what you grow and buy what you eat- locally and direct!
story_txt:
The Horsepower.com story
The average farmer takes home only $0.18 of every dollar of product grown. We want to change that. Instead of sending that money to brokers and middlemen, why not give some of it back to the hard-working small farmer? 
And why can't the consumer buy fresh organic eggs and vegetables from their local farmer? 
Horsepower.com was built to connect local small farmers and buyers within our very own communities.
The founder's dream for Horsepower.com include:

knowing your local farmer and what his or her practices are (is he or she using pesticides?)
delivering food that taste better because it was grown locally and didn't travel 1000 miles
reducing the costs of food and increasing the profit for the small farmer. Remember- no middle man. 



What We Need & Why
The founders, being small farmers themselves, have a desire to keep Horsepower.com free. But to keep it this way, we need your support. We need funds to continue building the site and connecting each of us to our local farmer. Raised funds will go to:
Development: Our team is hard at work creating a tool that's exactly what farmers need to grow their business and reach more consumers. Your help will allow us to connect farmers and buyers in every possible way including:

Classifieds ads
Farmers Markets & Fairs
Backyard Vegetable Exchanges (when you have excess vegetables and fruit, why not trade with someone in your community!?)
Farm Store Fronts with a price list showing daily inventory
Allowing the agriculture youth such as FFA and 4H to sell their animals on our site
Creating a payment system to streamline farm to fork transactions. 
Building a Rating system so farmers and buyers are accountable to the community. 
Allow farmers to Broadcast their offers. Do you realize farmers are still faxing their offers one at a time? How about we allow farmers to broadcast 1 offer to hundreds of their customers with a click of a button?

These are just some of the great ideas we want to work on. We also want to hear from you about any ideas you have for our site.

Learning a new technology can be overwhelming, especially when farmers need to spend the majority of their time growing the food we eat! Your contributions will help us host workshops and send representatives right to the farmers to educate them and get them set up on Horsepower.com
Marketing: With your support, we can partner with Comminity Support Agriculture programs and farmer's markets and help farmers build relationships with their customers, restaurants and other farmers. 
The Impact


We believe in a food system that runs on Horsepower.com. The implications are huge: imagine just one family getting their weekly groceries not from a supermarket, but from a farmer down the street. This reduces transportation costs and time, allows the family to know what they're eating and where it came from, and helps the farmer create connections so that his business grows. On the flipside, backyard farmers can sell what they grow without having to pay farmer's market fees or spending too much time marketing their products. We also believe strongly in encouraging consumers to buy local when their budgets allow, to care about how their food is grown - whether that's conventionally or organically - and to meet and know their farmers. If you buy local, the money stays in your community. 


Other Ways You Can Help
We'd love it if you'd spread the word about what we're doing, give us your feedback on the site, or just help a local farmer out by buying local and direct. Come to horsepower.com and see for yourself what we have started or watch a tutorial on how to use the site. Sell what you grow and buy what you eat- locally and direct!

story:
Dei gra·tia. \ˌde-ˌē-ˈgrä-tē-ˌä\. Definition of DEI GRATIA. : by the grace of God. Latin.

 

My name is Henry Jerome Mendoza, and I started the concept of Dei Gratia & Co. because I wanted to open a specialty shop in the heart of Dallas, Texas that provides men with a place that will help them become the best version of themselves. Along with offering barber & grooming services, the shop will offer other lifestyle services including menswear, shoe shines, and a small cocktail bar. The retail section of the shop will feature a selection of small, independent and homegrown companies curated by myself. The goal is to work with companies that share the spirit of what Dei Gratia is: old word aesthetics for modern man. The shop will feature a small craft  bar that will feature selections from small breweries and distilleries across the US and a craft cocktail menu created by local bartenders. There will be artwork and music featured in the shop made by local artists.

 

The actual shop itself will hopefully be made up of materials found at various flea markets, antique shops, and trade fairs around Texas. In the spirit of the shop concept, any materials purchased that need refinishing/reworking will be done by hand by myself, my family, and my friends.

 

This shop will be everything our father's fathers stood for. The American dream. Hard work, community, tradition, and putting forth the best version of who you are.

 

For a better & constantly updated visual idea of what Dei Gratia will be like, you can view my inspiration board here. Aside from an inspiration board, this blog will also chronicle the process of making Dei Gratia a reality and shortly become a full website for the shop.

What We Need & What You Get

In the spirit of what I hope Dei Gratia & Co. to be, the funding raised from this project will be direct start-up capital. I want the people who believe in this concept to be directly involved in creating it. If the goal is reached, it will do everything from securing other necessary sources of financing to purchasing all of the materials needed to renovate a space. All of the funds raised in this campaign (even if the campaign isn't fully funded) will go directly towards the start up capitol already raised, so know that every dollar will make a difference and this dream is on it's way to becoming a reality regardless of the campaign results.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're interested in private investments or live outside of the DFW area and would like to set up a custom package, email henryjerome@deigratiaco.com

Share this video with everyone you've ever met and let's bring a new concept to Dallas that has the spirit of tradition.
