story:
What is ReciProty?

Pronounced: Re-sip-row-tee

re: to bring back,

recip: two-way,

Pro: professionalism,

ty: community.

www.reciproty.com  is a new and unique community based website that harnesses & organizes global, national, and neighborhood resources on a local level. ReciProty is for all members of their community to build a supportive network for themselves and their loved ones. Members can connect to trusted relationships, seek support and financial opportunities, generate solutions and share reliable resources. ReciProty even helps businesses connect to new and existing customers. ReciProty was developed to strengthen your community support system and accelerate your networking and financial opportunities.

What makes ReciProty unique is that it brings people together so they can help each other whether it’s online or in person twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week. ReciProty gives you the perfect opportunity to:

  • Promote Your Business Instantly
  • Network with Members You Trust
  • Announce Events and Opportunities
  • Create or Join Local Networking Groups
  • Communicate Privately with Members
  • Generate Leads and Share Referrals 24/7
  • Seek Support for Loved Ones Across the Miles
  • Access and/or Offer Support in 1000+ Categories
  • Donate to Non-Profits and Support Their Causes
  • Share Personal and Business Resources to Stay Informed
  • Post Discounts and Connect to New and Existing Customers

ReciProty even supports domestic, artistic, or professional services that have limited resources to market themselves. Even the unemployed can look for work or generate money-making opportunities. There is great comfort in knowing support is there when you need it most. When individuals and businesses thrive, communities thrive.

How It All Began

People need help in so many ways. Some have an existing support system, while others don’t know who to turn to. Either way, most of the time, there is still not enough support.

My vision for ReciProty comes from my life-changing challenges and experiences with others. I created ReciProty to simplify and narrow the search for information and resources, so that people could find relief and the help they need so desperately. This website was customized to provide people with a place to connect with members of their own community, build a support system for themselves, and even find resources for their loved ones.

Despite lacking the prior knowledge of how to develop an online productive networking site, ReciProty was created from a web architecture and on a word document for my programmer to program. The Networking Members’ section alone was over 100 pages. It has been three years, but with focus, determination, huge financial risks, and a small, but talented team, ReciProty has finally become reality.

http://www.reciproty.com/news/12-04-29/A_Vision_Becoming_A_Reality.aspx

Why Support ReciProty?

We are all in need now and then, and nobody can succeed without the constructive support of others. When you support ReciProty, you are not only increasing support for yourself and people in your community, you are also supporting people who support you. Some people touch your heart, mind, and soul through their words. You have an opportunity to bring resources, answers, relief, and most importantly, hope in an instantto the people who need it most. If you believe ReciProty can help at least one person, that makes your contribution priceless.

ReciProty is currently online and actively building in the greater Portland, Oregon area. Create your profile in the 97205 zip code area to see how it has been helpful for many of its members. ReciProty also travels with you wherever you go. Whenever you create a profile in a particular zip code area, you will be able to network instantly with all of ReciProty’s members within that area.

Developing and marketing a website like ReciProty is very expensive. I have borrowed all funds thus far to bring ReciProty to reality. The goal amount is very minimal compared to all of the costs thus far. Your financial support will help with some of the costs for enhancements and marketing, all of which will give the site the momentum it needs to thrive.

What if we Exceed our Goal?

Your contribution will help ReciProty live up to its fullest potential. People will be able to get the help they need, when they need it most. If ReciProty exceeds it goal by a substantial amount, these additional funds would be available to hire the staff required to assist with the overall internal and external operations. Additionally, ReciProty’s innovative site would be able to:

  • Showcase members and businesses that make a difference
  • Showcase non-profit organizations and their contributions
  • Create enhancements to customize the evolving needs of its members
  • Establish a framework to notify members of the support available to them
  • Reach more people in need, more effectively, and much more quickly

When emergencies occur, or when in need, time, resources, and opportunities are priceless. ReciProty bridges the gap between needs and resources. It's that simple!

How Can I Support ReciProty?

Your Contribution Means So Much. No amount is too large or too small. Just select the perk that you would like to recieve to the right. You will then be led to a page that will guide you through the process. You will have the option to receive the specific perk or to offer a contribution. You can always contribute more than the stated amount for the perk reward that you would like to receive. For some, international shipping fees will apply.

Indiegogo is unlike most crowd funding websites! Not only do they accept creative projects from almost all categories, but they also allow campaigns to receive funds with their Flexible Funding Option. This option will make it possible for ReciProty to keep contributed funds, however, if ReciProty does not reach its goal, fees paid to Indiegogo are higher. Therefore, the goal is to reach or exceed its goal. With your help, we can surely do it! The more funds that ReciProty receives, the more people ReciProty can help.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Many people are unaware that ReciProty is now available to support them. If you have already visited ReciProty's site, you know how vital and vibrant this site is. Please ask your family members, friends, and colleagues to support ReciProty’s campaign. We need everyone to share the campaign with as many people as possible. If you and other people post ReciProty’s Indiegogo link on Facebook, Twitter or website pages and share ReciProty's campaign with others, ReciProty can strengthen our communities that much faster. My wish is for all of you to envision what I was guided to develop for all people.

Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/#!/ReciProty

Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/ReciProty

Just Imagine……

Imagine…Renewed hope and economic recovery

Imagine…New-found strength in our communities, our nation, and our world

Imagine…People taking the time to give support with whatever means they have to offer

Imagine…Neighbors helping neighbors for the greater good of others and their community

Imagine…People and businesses connecting to the resources and opportunities they need  

We no longer have to imagine with ReciProty.

ReciProty is here to make the world a better place and to advance our current way of finding and generating solutions to a whole new level, one neighborhood at a time.

I sincerely hope ReciProty benefits you and those in your community either personally or professionally. I want to express my sincere gratitude to everyone who has helped bring my vision to reality, to all of you for supporting www.reciproty.com, and to Indiegogo for allowing me to share my God-Given Mission.

-Renee Wilbur, Creator of www.reciproty.com

---FAQs---

How do I add $5.00 for Shipping outside the U.S.?

Select the perk that you would like to receive. At the bottom of Step 1, enter the total contribution amount and include the additional $5.00.

How do we contact you?

You can contact Reciproty’s creator directly at renee@reciproty.com. She checks it and will get back to you.

How do I submit my name, logo, a link to my website, and a personal introduction or business description?

All you have to do is email your website link and description. Then, attach your logo to the email. All information must be provided by you. Posted content must be appropriate; without derogatory information or vulgar language. ReciProty reserves the right to reject submitted content at its sole discretion. You will be able to resubmit your information for approval. Once approved, we can upload your information to the specific sponsor page.

What restrictions apply to website links submitted for posting on ReciProty?

Linked website content cannot relate to any illegal or other inappropriate activities or information. ReciProty reserves the right to reject any website link at its sole discretion.

If I contribute, when will I receive me selected perk incentive?

Each perk incentive has an available delivery date depending on the perk incentive you select. There is an approximate wait of two weeks after the end of the project. It will be our priority to send and/or coordinate the perk incentive as soon as possible. You will surely hear from us.

Who coordinates the coaching call for the contribution amount of $500.00?

A member of ReciProty will call ahead to schedule a date and time that will mutually work for all parties involved. If you would like a guided tour of ReciProty, please register on www.reciproty.com and validate your information prior to the coaching call.  

Who coordinates the coaching call or online session for contribution amount of $1000.00?

A member of ReciProty will call ahead to schedule a date and time that will mutually work for all parties involved. If you or your team would like a guided tour of ReciProty and assistance with establishing profiles and business groups, please have them register on www.reciproty.com and validate their information prior to the online session.  

Where do we meet for lunch for the contribution amount of $1000.00?

Glad you asked! You choose any public place in the metro area of Portland, Oregon. We will pick up the tab. We can also provide suggestions.

Why would I want to meet ReciProty's creator?

ReciProty is a reflection of its creator. ReciProty’s creator has over 20 years of productive networking and sales experience encompassing both retail and direct sales environments. Strengths include a stellar background of teaching consultative sales and networking techniques, instruction on how to engage key decision makers, and how to promote your product or service through networking and referrals. ReciProty's creator has strong organizational skills with attention to detail and is self-motivated, imaginative, ambitious, dedicated, and committed to excellent customer care.

For the past twelve years, she has been responsible for all day-to-day operations of a small business which includes contract negotiations, client relations, marketing, management, employee recruitment and retention. For the past three years, she has remained dedicated to develop ReciProty in order to help others. Additionally, ReciProty’s creator is wife, mother, friend, and colleague who is very considerate of the personal and business needs of others. Depending on how many people select to meet the creator of ReciProty, all travel arrangements should be completed before or by the end of 2013.

What will I receive if ReciProty’s creator visits my location?

You and/or your team will receive a guided tour of ReciProty, assistance with creating profiles, business groups, and/or discounts with someone who has high energy and excels at increasing morale and productivity. They will also receive an overview of how www.reciproty.com can assist all your members to acquire the support they need or increase their financial position. If your team members would like assistance creating profiles, business groups and/or discounts, please have them register on www.reciproty.com and validate their information prior to arrival.

Who coordinates the travel itinerary, accommodations, and transportation arrangements for the contribution amount $3,000.00?

Since all expenses are paid, you or your team can coordinate all arrangements, which must be agreed upon. A member from ReciProty’s team will call to schedule a date and time that will mutually work for all parties involved. All ground transportation must be provided by a reputable transportation company. The meeting location must be a public place of business, no private homes. According to wikitravel, a good business hotel is 4-star or greater; see: http://wikitravel.org/en/Hotels which states that “your boss will probably not faint when they see the bill”. Therefore, please schedule ReciProty’s creator at a 4-star or greater hotel. If you or your team would like a guided tour of ReciProty and assistance with establishing profiles and business groups, please have them register on www.reciproty.com and validate their information prior to the event.  

Who coordinates the hotel accommodations and transportation arrangements for the contribution amount of $5,000.00?

Hotel accommodations and all ground transportation would be coordinated by you or your team. A member from ReciProty’s team will call ahead to schedule a date and time that will mutually work for all involved, and all arrangements must be agreed upon. Reciproty’s creator will personally schedule airfare arrangements. All ground transportation must be provided by a reputable transportation company. The meeting location must be a public place of business, no private homes. According to wikitravel, a good business hotel is 4-star or greater; see: http://wikitravel.org/en/Hotels  which states that “your boss will probably not faint when they see the bill”. Therefore, please schedule Reciproty’s creator at a 4-star or greater hotel. If you or your team would like a guided tour of ReciProty and assistance with establishing profiles and business groups, please have them register on www.reciproty.com and validate their information prior to the event.  

How do I get a refund for my airfare if I select the Leader With Another Option Perk for the contribution amount of $5000.00?

You make all arrangements and choose a restaurant in the metro area of Portland, Oregon and we will meet you there. After lunch, submit your airfare receipt. We will pick up the lunch tab and write a check to cover your U.S. Domestic Airfare costs.

Who coordinates the arrangements to travel to my location for the contribution amount of $10,000.00?

A member from ReciProty’s team will coordinate all arrangements. You will receive a call ahead of time to schedule a date and time that will mutually work for all parties involved. If you or your team would like a guided tour of ReciProty and assistance with establishing profiles and business groups, please have them register on www.reciproty.com and validate their information prior to the event.  

How do I get a refund for my airfare, lunch, and overnight accommodations if I select the Visionary With Another Option Perk for the contribution amount of $10000.00?

You make all arrangements, choose a hotel and a restaurant in the metro area of Portland, Oregon and we will meet you there. After lunch, submit your receipts for your U.S. Domestic regular airfare costs and overnight accommodations. We will pick up the lunch tab and write you a check.

Can I Gift A Perk Incentive?

Yes! What an awesome idea. ReciProty’s creator specializes in and really enjoys networking. To donate a perk incentive to someone as a gift, claim the perk that you would like to receive. You will then be led to the Pick a Perk page. Step 4 will allow you to gift the contribution to someone else.  

Can I increase my pledge once it’s been made?

YES! Just claim the perk that you would like to receive. You will then be led to the Pick a Perk page. At the bottom of Step 1 enter your total contribution amount.

What happens if ReciProty does not reach its goal?

Indiegogo is different than a lot of other crowd funding websites! Not only do they accept creative projects from almost every category, but they also allow campaigns to receive funds with their Flexible Funding Option. ReciProty will be able to keep contributed funds but if ReciProty does not reach its goal, fees paid to Indiegogo are higher. The goal is for ReciProty to reach or exceed its goal. The more funds that ReciProty receives, the better chance ReciProty has to reach more people in need of resources and support.   

Who does the money go to?

Every penny (minus Indiegogo fees) will go directly to ReciProty in order to support its purpose.

$22,500.00 seems like a very low amount for a community website like ReciProty.com?

You are correct. This amount will help ReciProty reach some people in need. The longer it takes to reach one person, could lead to a missed opportunity, unanswered prayer and lost hope.

Can we exceed the goal?

YES! What an awesome idea! Indiegogo will allow people to contribute as much money as possible before the deadline date.

Is ReciProty a 501(c)-(3) non-profit organization?

No. When you support ReciProty, you are supporting a small business owner and entrepreneur whose purpose is to help as many people in need as possible. Many small business owners and entrepreneurs have made our country great!

Ask a question /Have a question?

If the information above doesn’t answer your question, you can ask the project creator directly via email at: renee@reciproty.com.

Therefore, the goal is to reach or exceed its goal. With your help, we can surely do it! The more funds that ReciProty receives, the more people ReciProty can help.  
Other Ways You Can Help
Many people are unaware that ReciProty is now available to support them. If you have already visited ReciProty's site, you know how vital and vibrant this site is. Please ask your family members, friends, and colleagues to support ReciProty’s campaign. We need everyone to share the campaign with as many people as possible. If you and other people post ReciProty’s Indiegogo link on Facebook, Twitter or website pages and share ReciProty's campaign with others, ReciProty can strengthen our communities that much faster. My wish is for all of you to envision what I was guided to develop for all people.
Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/#!/ReciProty
Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/ReciProty
Just Imagine……
Imagine…Renewed hope and economic recovery
Imagine…New-found strength in our communities, our nation, and our world
Imagine…People taking the time to give support with whatever means they have to offer
Imagine…Neighbors helping neighbors for the greater good of others and their community
Imagine…People and businesses connecting to the resources and opportunities they need  
We no longer have to imagine with ReciProty.
ReciProty is here to make the world a better place and to advance our current way of finding and generating solutions to a whole new level, one neighborhood at a time.
I sincerely hope ReciProty benefits you and those in your community either personally or professionally. I want to express my sincere gratitude to everyone who has helped bring my vision to reality, to all of you for supporting www.reciproty.com, and to Indiegogo for allowing me to share my God-Given Mission. 
-Renee Wilbur, Creator of www.reciproty.com
---FAQs---
How do I add $5.00 for Shipping outside the U.S.?
Select the perk that you would like to receive. At the bottom of Step 1, enter the total contribution amount and include the additional $5.00.
How do we contact you?
You can contact Reciproty’s creator directly at renee@reciproty.com. She checks it and will get back to you.
How do I submit my name, logo, a link to my website, and a personal introduction or business description? 
All you have to do is email your website link and description. Then, attach your logo to the email. All information must be provided by you. Posted content must be appropriate; without derogatory information or vulgar language. ReciProty reserves the right to reject submitted content at its sole discretion. You will be able to resubmit your information for approval. Once approved, we can upload your information to the specific sponsor page.
What restrictions apply to website links submitted for posting on ReciProty?
Linked website content cannot relate to any illegal or other inappropriate activities or information. ReciProty reserves the right to reject any website link at its sole discretion.
If I contribute, when will I receive me selected perk incentive?
Each perk incentive has an available delivery date depending on the perk incentive you select. There is an approximate wait of two weeks after the end of the project. It will be our priority to send and/or coordinate the perk incentive as soon as possible. You will surely hear from us.
Who coordinates the coaching call for the contribution amount of $500.00? 
A member of ReciProty will call ahead to schedule a date and time that will mutually work for all parties involved. If you would like a guided tour of ReciProty, please register on www.reciproty.com and validate your information prior to the coaching call.  
Who coordinates the coaching call or online session for contribution amount of $1000.00?
A member of ReciProty will call ahead to schedule a date and time that will mutually work for all parties involved. If you or your team would like a guided tour of ReciProty and assistance with establishing profiles and business groups, please have them register on www.reciproty.com and validate their information prior to the online session.  
Where do we meet for lunch for the contribution amount of $1000.00?
Glad you asked! You choose any public place in the metro area of Portland, Oregon. We will pick up the tab. We can also provide suggestions.
Why would I want to meet ReciProty's creator? 
ReciProty is a reflection of its creator. ReciProty’s creator has over 20 years of productive networking and sales experience encompassing both retail and direct sales environments. Strengths include a stellar background of teaching consultative sales and networking techniques, instruction on how to engage key decision makers, and how to promote your product or service through networking and referrals. ReciProty's creator has strong organizational skills with attention to detail and is self-motivated, imaginative, ambitious, dedicated, and committed to excellent customer care.
For the past twelve years, she has been responsible for all day-to-day operations of a small business which includes contract negotiations, client relations, marketing, management, employee recruitment and retention. For the past three years, she has remained dedicated to develop ReciProty in order to help others. Additionally, ReciProty’s creator is wife, mother, friend, and colleague who is very considerate of the personal and business needs of others. Depending on how many people select to meet the creator of ReciProty, all travel arrangements should be completed before or by the end of 2013.
What will I receive if ReciProty’s creator visits my location?
You and/or your team will receive a guided tour of ReciProty, assistance with creating profiles, business groups, and/or discounts with someone who has high energy and excels at increasing morale and productivity. They will also receive an overview of how www.reciproty.com can assist all your members to acquire the support they need or increase their financial position. If your team members would like assistance creating profiles, business groups and/or discounts, please have them register on www.reciproty.com and validate their information prior to arrival.
Who coordinates the travel itinerary, accommodations, and transportation arrangements for the contribution amount $3,000.00?
Since all expenses are paid, you or your team can coordinate all arrangements, which must be agreed upon. A member from ReciProty’s team will call to schedule a date and time that will mutually work for all parties involved. All ground transportation must be provided by a reputable transportation company. The meeting location must be a public place of business, no private homes. According to wikitravel, a good business hotel is 4-star or greater; see: http://wikitravel.org/en/Hotels which states that “your boss will probably not faint when they see the bill”. Therefore, please schedule ReciProty’s creator at a 4-star or greater hotel. If you or your team would like a guided tour of ReciProty and assistance with establishing profiles and business groups, please have them register on www.reciproty.com and validate their information prior to the event.  
Who coordinates the hotel accommodations and transportation arrangements for the contribution amount of $5,000.00?
Hotel accommodations and all ground transportation would be coordinated by you or your team. A member from ReciProty’s team will call ahead to schedule a date and time that will mutually work for all involved, and all arrangements must be agreed upon. Reciproty’s creator will personally schedule airfare arrangements. All ground transportation must be provided by a reputable transportation company. The meeting location must be a public place of business, no private homes. According to wikitravel, a good business hotel is 4-star or greater; see: http://wikitravel.org/en/Hotels  which states that “your boss will probably not faint when they see the bill”. Therefore, please schedule Reciproty’s creator at a 4-star or greater hotel. If you or your team would like a guided tour of ReciProty and assistance with establishing profiles and business groups, please have them register on www.reciproty.com and validate their information prior to the event.  
How do I get a refund for my airfare if I select the Leader With Another Option Perk for the contribution amount of $5000.00?
You make all arrangements and choose a restaurant in the metro area of Portland, Oregon and we will meet you there. After lunch, submit your airfare receipt. We will pick up the lunch tab and write a check to cover your U.S. Domestic Airfare costs.
Who coordinates the arrangements to travel to my location for the contribution amount of $10,000.00? 
A member from ReciProty’s team will coordinate all arrangements. You will receive a call ahead of time to schedule a date and time that will mutually work for all parties involved. If you or your team would like a guided tour of ReciProty and assistance with establishing profiles and business groups, please have them register on www.reciproty.com and validate their information prior to the event.  
How do I get a refund for my airfare, lunch, and overnight accommodations if I select the Visionary With Another Option Perk for the contribution amount of $10000.00?
You make all arrangements, choose a hotel and a restaurant in the metro area of Portland, Oregon and we will meet you there. After lunch, submit your receipts for your U.S. Domestic regular airfare costs and overnight accommodations. We will pick up the lunch tab and write you a check.
Can I Gift A Perk Incentive?
Yes! What an awesome idea. ReciProty’s creator specializes in and really enjoys networking. To donate a perk incentive to someone as a gift, claim the perk that you would like to receive. You will then be led to the Pick a Perk page. Step 4 will allow you to gift the contribution to someone else.  
Can I increase my pledge once it’s been made?
YES! Just claim the perk that you would like to receive. You will then be led to the Pick a Perk page. At the bottom of Step 1 enter your total contribution amount.
What happens if ReciProty does not reach its goal?
Indiegogo is different than a lot of other crowd funding websites! Not only do they accept creative projects from almost every category, but they also allow campaigns to receive funds with their Flexible Funding Option. ReciProty will be able to keep contributed funds but if ReciProty does not reach its goal, fees paid to Indiegogo are higher. The goal is for ReciProty to reach or exceed its goal. The more funds that ReciProty receives, the better chance ReciProty has to reach more people in need of resources and support.   
Who does the money go to?
Every penny (minus Indiegogo fees) will go directly to ReciProty in order to support its purpose.
$22,500.00 seems like a very low amount for a community website like ReciProty.com?
You are correct. This amount will help ReciProty reach some people in need. The longer it takes to reach one person, could lead to a missed opportunity, unanswered prayer and lost hope.
Can we exceed the goal?
YES! What an awesome idea! Indiegogo will allow people to contribute as much money as possible before the deadline date.
Is ReciProty a 501(c)-(3) non-profit organization?
No. When you support ReciProty, you are supporting a small business owner and entrepreneur whose purpose is to help as many people in need as possible. Many small business owners and entrepreneurs have made our country great!
Ask a question /Have a question?
If the information above doesn’t answer your question, you can ask the project creator directly via email at: renee@reciproty.com.

story:
Goal: take back America's food system, step by step.

Safe, nutritious, responsible food choices should be affordable and accessible to all Americans, not a luxury for a privileged few. Our food and agriculture system is a giant, tangled mess, and only we the people can change the system.  A more transparent, less skewed food market would benefit everybody.

Step 1: Vote to Label Genetically Engineered Food (Prop 37)

.... aka "mutant asses" (see video)

This is only the first step in a marathon movement to reshape America's food system into one that serves consumers, farmers, and food producers on a level playing field. (See section below, What happens in California Doesn't Stay in California.)

I'm running an unparalleled ad campaign on Facebook, and your funds will help reach more people.

The money raised will go to the Prop 37 campaign, and I'm personally helping manage how it's spent: on one of the most successful ad campaigns of all time.  (Click into this slideshow to see details -- our ads have been stunningly, mind-blowingly successful already!).  

CLICK HERE >> Prop 37 on Facebook from Ali Partovi

 

After two weeks, our mesage has reached millions of people, and it's on track to reach everybody in California multiple times if we reach the funding goal.

Who am I, and what was I thinking?

I'm Ali Partovi, internet entrepreneur, startup advisor, and wannabe musician.   I was among the first investors in Dropbox and Zappos, two companies I love. My own startups, LinkExchange, Garageband.com, and iLike, were all based on empowering the little guy and successfully leveraging the Internet's grass-roots power. I've also done my share of stupid stuff.

A few weeks ago I realized there's something different about this vote than other political races. I realized this is not just about transparency, but also about the balance of power in America. I realized this vote is the culmination of an extraordinary movement started by a California mom and carried forward by millions of ordinary people. So I decided to add my voice. I hope you'll add yours!

$50,000 MATCHING FUND

$1 from you + $1 from me = $2 to the campaign

I care about this cause passionately and I'm putting my money where my mouth is. I'm personally pledging $50k in matching funds, so every dollar you contribute will have double the impact.

Do you have the right to know what's in your food?

On Nov 6, California voters will be asked to decide if genetically engineered food should be labeled. Join us in support of Prop 37, the basic right to know what's in our food!

  • Some foods are genetically-engineered. ie, plants or animals invented in a lab by splicing genes. For example, salmon that's part eel. Yes, really.
  • In the USA, these frankenfoods aren't labeled. They don't tell you when your food contains mutant ingredients.
  • It's time we caught up to Russia, India, & China's food standards. WTF! 60 other countries, incl all of Europe, Japan, Brazil, Russia, India, and even China require genetically engineered foods to be labeled. Russia has banned them because of studies showing they caused massive tumors in rats.
  • We don't need no politicians or corporations. This Nov 6, the people decide. All we gotta do is stand together and spread the word. Please donate money to spread the word faster and win this.

David vs. Goliath

The big food and chemical corporations like Monsanto, Pepsi, and Kelloggs are spending millions on deceptive commercials to confuse voters. They've been caught red-handed lying, even forced to pull their ads.

Please donate $$ to help prove that the power of crowdfunding can beat corporate bankrolls. The voice of ordinary people coming together on the internet is stronger than the voice of deceptive TV commercials. This campaign is our chance to stand together and start taking back the system in America. 

My goal is to run ads on Facebook, where you can't fool people with deceptive ads, because the community's opinions speak louder.

$50,000 goal, and where it's going

I've previously donated $50,000 to support Prop 37, and I've pledged $50,000 more in "matching funds" to motivate you to contribute too.

This is a big investment for me so I'm making sure it's spent carefully. It will go towards a Facebook ad campaign that I'm personally managing, leveraging my unique background in social marketing and internet advertising. The money will be spent wisely and purposefully to maximize impact.

  • If we reach the goal, our Facebook ads will reach every single voter in California twice.  And some of them will click "Like" and spread the word further.
  • Even if we don't reach the goal, we'll use whatever we raise to run ads. If we raise more, we can reach more people, or we can expand to advertise on other platforms besides Facebook.

Perks :)

Major props to the "Yes on 37" campaign: even though this page is not affiliated with them, they're eager to see what we can do here, and they offered up some neat perks.

Other Ways You Can Help / Show Us Your Wits!

I hope you'll contribute $$, but don't stop there!

  • Get the word out about labeling genetically engineered foods. Tell your parents. Tell a friend. Don't be shy: speak to people about it. Join the campaign on Facebook. When you see one of our ads on Facebook, "like" it. When this baby goes viral, it will be thanks to you.
  • Get others to donate. Use Indiegogo's "share" tools to spread awareness.
  • "Show us your wits." Go on Facebook and post something about labeling genetically engineered foods. The campaign is running a contest calling on people like you to post creative messages and photos. You win by getting the most "Likes." A new Facebook feature also lets you pay $7 to boost your post's visibility.
  • Don't stand by quiety. It's easy to sit on the sidelines. But this is not somebody else's problem. This is OUR problem. This campaign was started and built up by ordinary people, and we're going to win because people like you are not just watching but acting.

What happens in California doesn't stay in California

This is just the start. If passed, Prop 37 will benefit not just California but all Americans. To cite Michael Pollan's brilliant NY Times essay, this is the moment of truth for a much larger nationwide movement. 

This vote is also symbolic, because it is not Democrat vs Republican, but people against big corporations. Voters from all points of view care about what they feed their families, and Prop 37 has strong support from both ends of the political spectrum.

What hinges on the outcome is whether the people in this country can take back control of the system. I'm using Indiegogo, the open, global crowd-funding platform, because even outside America, watchful eyes are waiting to see what happens.

We are California. We are the pioneers. We are the creatives and the risk-takers. If anybody can figure out how to win this, we can. Prop 37 FTW!

story:
Welcome to the Peninsula BevCo Fundraising page and thank you for reading our campaign. We are a community of local entrepreneurs and craft beverage lovers looking to relocate & expand our business. Thanks to what we refer to as “the golden eviction letter” we are moving our business to a premier location in downtown Port Orchard, Washington.

 

Our company 1st started on the other side of town, in the community of Manchester, Washington. We had big dreams to structure, build, and foster a business unlike any other in our area. Our mission was to build a community watering hole that everyone could enjoy. A true public house that engaged, uplifted, and inspired everyone towards a better future. After one year in our 185 sq. foot Manchester location (it was really small!) we seized an opportunity to move to downtown Port Orchard. Renovating the old building was a struggle, and after 9 long months, Peninsula BevCo opened in January 2019 with great success.

 

From the beginning we wanted to feel different from other restaurants and businesses. We really wanted it to be a community and we wanted our team to have a vested interest in the business’s success. We wanted customers to be able to participate and feel like their dollars were going towards something that was theirs. We wanted to partner with local businesses and investors that believed in this project and its impact on the community.

 

After just three short months of being open at our 639 bay street location, we received a (90 day) letter of eviction. The new owners had decided to tear down our building that had been standing for over 115 years. While we understood the reasons why they chose to tear down the building, the timing could not have been worse. Things are challenging enough for a new small business and costs of relocating are large. In those first few days, we were unsure if we could stay in business.

 

Luckily a new opportunity arose. A premier location opened up for lease just down the street. After some stressful negotiations, we signed the lease for two adjoining spaces just down the street at 100 & 110 Harrison Ave, Port Orchard. The space is about 3 times larger, with a full kitchen and an outdoor patio.

 

Our company has 4 pillars to restaurant success, great customer service, great beverages, great food, and a great atmosphere. It's simple but we stay true to our promise and goals. By slightly overstaffing, we ensure our staff is happy to be there and able to have authentic engagement with our customers. We encourage our staff to be creative in the kitchen, featuring awesome new menu items almost everyday. (Ask about our secret menu!) We hand pick all of our beverages, and allow customers to vote on new beers we carry. Our standard is to offer the best tap-list & bottle-shop inventory possible. At our old location we had a selection of 24 draft brews and 150+ bottles & cans. Our selection will double to 48 taps and 300 bottles & cans with your help in this campaign.

 

After operating our 1st 6 months as an LLC we’ve decided to make the switch to a cooperative corporation. Washington state is enacting a new bill this year that allows for investor members of a cooperative. We are excited to be one of the 1st businesses to use this structure and we hope to inspire other entrepreneurs to research it and see if it makes sense for their business.

 

Since the beginning of May we’ve been cleaning up the new spaces, grinding floors, pressure washing, painting, and doing carpentry. During this time we have realized that we need help. We need our community, our customers, and our friend's help to raise the money we need to finish the new restaurant.

 

To facilitate this we are running this fundraising campaign, as well as switching to the aforementioned cooperative. The money raised from this campaign will go directly to the cost building out a larger cold room for our beer and food, a Crowler machine, fixing the bathroom situation, additional tap handles (giving us the largest selection of draft beverages in our community), and general restaurant renovations such as; paint, wood, furnishings, and labor.

All your donations will help us in completing our renovations by our planned grand opening in the Fall. Please consider contributing to our cause! 

Why should you donate? Unlike other crowdfunding site, such as "gofundme" or "kick starter" Indiegogo allows us to offer you perks for your donation! We worked really hard to offer some great perks for you all, but if none of them really spark your interest you can still do a general donation . without receiving a perk :) 

A note about Shipping and Handling: Indiegogo automatically charges you shipping and handling. If you notice a higher rate than just the donation level you chose, it factors in the cost of shipping and handling in automatically :) If you would like to pick up your items we will happily write you a gift certificate for the cost of shipping and handling. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause you. 

If your unable to contribute financially please consider sharing our Indiegogo campaign on social media or with those you think might be interested. Everything Helps.

 

Thank you,

The PBC Crew

#PBC   #Collected We Rise  #Dream Big

Washington state is enacting a new bill this year that allows for investor members of a cooperative. We are excited to be one of the 1st businesses to use this structure and we hope to inspire other entrepreneurs to research it and see if it makes sense for their business. Since the beginning of May we’ve been cleaning up the new spaces, grinding floors, pressure washing, painting, and doing carpentry. During this time we have realized that we need help. We need our community, our customers, and our friend's help to raise the money we need to finish the new restaurant. To facilitate this we are running this fundraising campaign, as well as switching to the aforementioned cooperative. The money raised from this campaign will go directly to the cost building out a larger cold room for our beer and food, a Crowler machine, fixing the bathroom situation, additional tap handles (giving us the largest selection of draft beverages in our community), and general restaurant renovations such as; paint, wood, furnishings, and labor.All your donations will help us in completing our renovations by our planned grand opening in the Fall. Please consider contributing to our cause! Why should you donate? Unlike other crowdfunding site, such as "gofundme" or "kick starter" Indiegogo allows us to offer you perks for your donation! We worked really hard to offer some great perks for you all, but if none of them really spark your interest you can still do a general donation . without receiving a perk :) A note about Shipping and Handling: Indiegogo automatically charges you shipping and handling. If you notice a higher rate than just the donation level you chose, it factors in the cost of shipping and handling in automatically :) If you would like to pick up your items we will happily write you a gift certificate for the cost of shipping and handling. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause you. If your unable to contribute financially please consider sharing our Indiegogo campaign on social media or with those you think might be interested. Everything Helps. Thank you,The PBC Crew#PBC   #Collected We Rise  #Dream Big

story:
We are a small team of health and wellness enthusiasts, founded by John Kearns in Vermont. Our passion is for good healthy food. We love organically raised food and encourage organic farming practices. We strive to support our local eateries and family run green grocers. All of us have a strong belief in all things local, not only when we are at home but when we travel to new communities.

We are people who believe in social equality and environmental responsibility. We care deeply for all people and our planet. We are people who help out in our communities. Together we have a strong desire to be a driving force promoting businesses who care. We are creating a business which is a force for good!

  • Friendly Fork is a mission-driven, community oriented and socially responsible, online food and wellness hub. 
  • Our beta website is just the seedling we have planted; we will be growing all across Canada & the US, and then the world.
  • A one stop shop to source the best local food and wellness businesses; farms, farmers'markets, grocers, food & wellness product creators, restaurants, wellness providers who are socially & environmentally conscious, care for you, and community as a whole!
  • Our Enhanced Menus for restaurants identify the 8 FDA or Health Canada 11 food allergens plus gluten if contained in any dish served, while also highlighting sourcing of ingredients, raising & harvesting practices, as well as other dietary restrictions concerning the food being served.
  • We have created Friendly Fork Local Maps to promote the local connections and visually highlight how interconnected our local food systems are on the community level.
  • It is our goal to connect people with the best local businesses run by real people who are actively involved in their community, have socially and environmentally responsible business practices, and give back to our communities through our special business model. 



Together, we can build a community of like-minded businesses with a common purpose that truly helps people!


  • build the Friendly Fork phone app.
  • develop & improve the website.
  • add a daily menu change feature for restaurants.
  • purchase hardware & software upgrades for improved efficiency.
  • create jobs with livable wages and benefits.
  • organize community outreach to non-profit organizations.
  • acquire 3rd party verification of our giving back programs; transparency!
  • create a very useful online hub of great community minded businesses with the common goal of making our world a better place to be!

Please contribute to our communal cause, collect a perk, and share this campaign with your friends and family. Thank you for helping the Friendly Fork Community of Communities mission grow, we are very grateful!

Below the Perks, a more in depth description of Friendly Fork is available to learn more about our socially responsible mission, see examples of our Local Maps and Enhanced Menu, meet the Friendly Fork Team, and much more!


Some perks have limited quantities available. Perks may change daily during the campaign. If you would like to contribute some perks or have any questions please email us at support@friendlyfork.com. Our unique perks include ways to instantly give back to your communities, while supporting our mission!

Everyone who supports our campaign will be thanked on our Thank You Wall!

Colors available for Aprons, Caps, & Tees can be seen in our Picture Gallery!

Chef Cards are lower in contribution section!

Special pricing in contribution section!

Special pricing in contribution section!

Special pricing in contribution section!

Special pricing in contribution section!

Special pricing in contribution section!

Special pricing in contribution section!

Special pricing in contribution section!


Special pricing in contribution section!


               

Please share our campaign with your friends and family using the Indiegogo share tools. Follow us on twitter, facebook, and instagram to stay up to date on our progress.


                

Check out our beta website and social media to recommend and review your favorite farms, farmers markets, grocers, producers, restaurants, wellness providers, and non-profit organizations who will compliment the Friendly Fork mission. You may even find you can be rewarded for your input! 


                

Friendly Fork is building a community of communities! Our goal is to take the local movement global. We are a mission-driven, community-oriented, socially responsible online food and wellness hub in our infancy.

Our user-friendly website highlights the best local farms, farmers’ markets, grocers, producers, restaurants, holistic wellness providers, and non-profit organizations, who together are the heartbeat of our communities. Friendly Fork maps show local connections within a 100-mile radius of our members. Our maps show restaurants, farms, and producers with visual connections between farmers and their local diners, markets and their food supply, and more to show where your goods and services are coming from and what they are made of.

Knowledge of source and production methods is the key to making informed decisions about how we treat our bodies and our world. We are on a mission to introduce you to real people, their great businesses, their social and environmental concern, and how they give back to their communities.  Whether helping you to connect more with your own community or introducing your neighbors both near and far, Friendly Fork strives to help you feel at home in every community!


                

Friendly Fork is creating a business model in which success is not measured by the large profits of a few people but by the benefits of our services to our members, communities, and planet. Friendly Fork has committed to social and environmental responsibility as a pending B-Corp Certified Corporation. Friendly Fork staff can also be found volunteering in their communities, collecting produce for their local food banks, helping coach youth sports, or tutoring in their community schools.


                

While promoting great food is part of our core, we feel the need to share with those in need of food security and also to help find solutions to food allergy issues.

  • 5% of profits will go toward food assistance programs. 
  • 5% of profits will be put toward food allergy research. 

                

                

We're building a company which believes in our employees and the communities who support our mission. We are happy to reward them for their encouragement! 

  • 5% of profits will go back to organizations in our Friendly Fork communities.
  • A 5% profit sharing plan, progressive benefit programs, and pay above livable wages will be provided to all employees.

                

                

Friendly Fork is grateful to the many non-profit organizations who provide great services to all our communities. We promote non-profits on our site at no cost. Our hope is you may find and support these organizations in your own way, thanks!

Each community page hosts a community spirit section highlighting non-profit community organizations.

Non-profit organizations are profiled as farms, wellness providers and more.

Within their Community Spirit section, our member profiles highlight their own dedication to giving back.


                


At Friendly Fork this is just the start. As we grow, the percentages and benefits provided will continue to increase as well. We strive to be the change we seek!


                

  • Each Friendly Fork Community has its own page.
  • Each Community Page also includes a Community Spirit section, a Community Map, and a Community Events Calendar.
  • Each member's profile includes a logo, a description, a local connections map, social media & website links, reviews & ratings, and an individualized community spirit section.
  • Enhanced Menus have also been developed for restaurants. 
  • An Enhanced Menu identifies locally sourced ingredients from area farmers and producers in individual dishes.
  • They also identify the FDA 8 most common food allergens and gluten when contained within a menu item.
  • Social, religious, and other concerns including vegetarian, vegan, humanely raised, Halal, or Kosher are identified when possible.
  • This knowledge makes ordering a meal much easier for both you and restaurant staff.
  • Extremely reasonable membership fees help members recoup costs with an average of only 1-5 new clients per year.
  • Our website promotes community members and non-profit organizations without external ads.
  • A navigational tutorial video on the live site is provided to help you get started.
  • Friendly Fork is free for folks seeking the best community connections! 
  • Amazing offers for new members are available during our crowdfunding campaign!

                

                

At Friendly Fork we provide you with the knowledge of where your food is coming from and where it is being sourced to. The map below from our Premier Member Rogues' Harbor Restaurant of Lansing, NY shows how they source food from 11 farms and 7 food producers all within their 100 mile local radius. On our live website you can click on any of the icons to find out more about other farms and producers! 

                

                

                      

                

                

Friendly Fork's Enhanced Menus are here to help you make informed decisions when dining out and to help make the dining experience extremely easy for you and restaurant staff. Our Premier Member, Hearth and Candle Restaurant of Jeffersonville, VT clearly identifies what allergens are contained in their menu items below. Notice that the organic grass fed beef used in the Beef Burger comes from Old Homestead Farm, which is less than 7 miles from the restaurant.

                

                

                

I am a citizen of the world. I feel together we need to share what we can for the greater good of our neighbors and our planet. I believe that deep down all people desire good health and safe food. As a community of equals we have the ability to provide healthy food for all people so no-one goes hungry, ever.

I have been an organic farmer, a chef, and a restaurant owner. I have been a regular volunteer in all the communities I have lived. I am grateful for help and support I have received from community, family and friends and believe in giving back wherever I am able.  

I love to hike, bike, ski, snowshoe, and enjoy the beauty our planet provides us. Hockey is my passion! I love to create great meals from locally sourced ingredients.

I am a single dad who raised two wonderful daughters, Erin and Gwenn. My kids are my pride and joy and mean the world to me! They are my source of inspiration!

Together we can build a better world! Thank you for your support.

Peace,

John

                

I’m an entertainer and a poet, infatuated with the concept of community spirit and dedicated to living to serve. I have extensive food industry experience, appreciation for efficiency and sustainability, and a desire to develop my social networks. These events and feelings formed after acquiring a bachelor degree in Applied Economics & Management at Cornell University. Shortly after graduating I returned to Ithaca, NY, falling in love with its gorges, nature centers, and inhabitants. I wish to strengthen my community by bringing people together through food, wellness, and performance.

Best wishes,

Rem

                

Before graduating from the University of Vermont with a degree in business, my desire to play a role in the local food revolution was born from my own search for personal health and wellness. Driven to connect people to their local food systems, I was introduced to founder John Kearns by the UVM Sustainable Food Systems Initiative. I grew up in Massachusetts, embracing the outdoors while hunting, fishing, skiing & hiking or just walking in the woods. I enjoy cooking all that I gather from the land, the sea, or nearest farm.

Cheers to good health,

Harry               


Friendly Fork is for people seeking great food and wellness providers. We are for folks who want to know the source of their food and how it is raised. We are for people who believe in sustainability, social & environmental responsibility, and community spirit. We provide you with the knowledge to seek out businesses who truly care.

                

                

  • Like to know what is in the food they eat and where it comes from.
  • Aim to eat mostly organically grown fruits and vegetables and or humanely raised livestock. 
  • Seek out the local farms who truly care for the environment.
  • Seek to support small businesses run by kind folk whose interest is the overall well-being of the community.
  • Strive to eat local foods whether at home or on the road.
  • Have dietary concerns for social or health reasons and need to know ingredients of menu items when they dine out.
  • Have a holistic approach to their health and seek professionals concerned with whole health - mind, body, and spirit.
  • Are socially & environmentally conscious and seek like-minded businesses.
  • Care deeply for their community and have a strong desire to give back.
  • ARE JUST PLAIN AWESOME!


                

The creation of Friendly Fork has been done on a shoestring budget. We have scraped up every penny so we could bring you a new way to look for the local food and wellness providers you seek, while supporting the non-profit organizations who make our communities whole. With no formal experience in web design, our team has built our Beta website to show you our concept. We have been fueled by passion to create this mission driven company. Now it is time to expand.


                

We have compiled an incredible data base of like-minded businesses we feel would make great additions to the Friendly Fork family. We need to hire a team of representatives to reach out to these businesses all across the United States, Canada, and the world.


                

We need to hire support staff to complete our team of professionals. By hiring programmers, coders and IT professionals for the Friendly Fork team, we will be able to build a more user friendly website and phone application. This is a costly yet worthwhile venture which will streamline our process and help things run efficiently.


                

What we have created so far has been done on aging PCs and laptops. We need to upgrade to more up-to-date equipment and software to improve our efficiency and capabilities.


                

It is our goal to be able to multiply ten-fold in donations the support you generously give to help Friendly Fork create our Community of Communities. With your support in helping us build a talented team of professionals and purchasing efficient IT infrastructure, growth will happen quickly. We will provide you with a great, socially responsible food and wellness hub you can be proud to have helped get started. Your support, encouragement, and ideas will help make the Friendly Fork community of communities a driving force for change in the business world! Thank you for any help you can share! 


                

$40,000-50,000 IT Department

  • Web Development

  • App Development

  • CRM management software

  • Server development

                

$40,000-50,000 Sales and Support Teams

  • Strategy & Community Spirit

  • PR & Outreach

  • Member Recruitment

  • Customer Service

  • Provide Third Party Transparency Verification of our Giving Back Mission. 

                

$5,000-$15,000 Marketing Costs

  • Brand development

  • Localized Ads

  • Promotion through various media outlets

                

$15,000 - $20,000 Tech and Office Upgrade

  • Hardware

  • Software

  • Office Equipment and Supplies


                

Single farm per offer only. Farmers must be certified organic or utilize organic farming practices.

When you choose this perk please try to include the Farm name or at least your contact information (include email) so we may get in touch to get further information. We will attempt to contact you within 2-4 business days, hopefully sooner for the basic details.

We will announce that your farm will is becoming a new member of the Friendly Fork family. Farms will be required to fill out our profile form in a timely manner to ensure we can publish your profile by the perk fulfillment date.

What Farms get on Friendly Fork:

*Profile on your Community Page.(We will build new community pages as needed!)

*Dedicated Farm Description Page:

  a. certifications, farm practices, farm stand hours, contact info, directions, more

  b. seasonal list of what you grow and raise - veggies, herbs, fruit, livestock

  c. local connections map - your 100 mile map of restaurants & producers who use your products, the community organizations you support  and where you sell your products (add map to your site, too!)

  d. community spirit section - links to the organizations you support.

  e. social & environmental responsibility section - focus on your concerns.

*Review hosting and Yums Up rating.

*Social media and website links.

*Limited free community calendar events.

*Limited changes allowed.

Your two years on Friendly Fork begins the date your full profile is published. We will be sure to be in touch if there are any delays on our part. Thanks!

                

Local grocers or specialty food stores support  any combination of at least 10 local farmers & food & wellness product creators.

When you choose this perk, please try to include the name of the grocer, or at least your contact information and include your email address so we may get in touch with you to finalize any details. You can expect to hear from us within 2-4 business days.

We will announce via social media that your grocer is becoming a new member of the Friendly Fork family. Grocers will be required to fill out our profile form in a timely manner to ensure we can publish your profile by the perk fulfillment date.

What Local Grocers receive on Friendly Fork

*Profile on your Community Page; location, description, rating, pictures

*Dedicated Grocery/Specialty Food Store Description Page:

  a. hours, contact info, website and social media links

  b. local connections map - your 100 mile map of farms & producers who supply your products & the community organizations you support  (add map to your site, too!)

  c. community spirit section - links to the organizations you support.

  d. social & environmental responsibility section - focus on your concerns, product sourcing and more.

*Review hosting and Yums Up rating.

*Limited free community calendar events.

*Limited changes allowed.

Your two years on Friendly Fork begins the date your full profile is published. We will be sure to be in touch if there are any delays on our part. Thanks!

                

One restaurant location per offer. Restaurant must not have more than five locations of the same brand.

When you choose this perk, please try to include the name of the restaurant, or at least your contact information and include your email address so we may get in touch with you to finalize any details. You can expect to hear from us within 2-4 business days.

We will announce via social media that your grocer is becoming a new member of the Friendly Fork family. Restaurants will be required to fill out our profile and Enhanced Menu ID forms in a timely manner to ensure we can publish your profile by the perk fulfillment date.

*Dedicated Enhanced Menu Page including:

  a. photo gallery (5 pics),

  b. full menu - item descriptions, local connections, dietary concerns identification, FDA 8 or Health Canada 11 most common allergens & gluten identification.

  c. local connections map - your 100 mile map of the farmers, producers & community organizations you support (add map to your site, too!)

  d. community spirit section - links to the organizations you support

  e. social & environmental responsibility section - focus on your concerns

*Review hosting and Yums Up rating.

*Limited free community calendar events.

*Limited menu changes every four months

Your two years on Friendly Fork begins the date your full profile is published. We will be sure to be in touch if there are any delays on our part. Thanks!

                

One locations per offer only. Must not have more than 5 locations of the same practice name.

When you choose this perk, please try to include the name of the practice, or at least your contact information and include your email address so we may get in touch with you to finalize any details. You can expect to hear from us within 2-4 business days.

We will announce via social media that your wellness provider is becoming a new member of the Friendly Fork family. Wellness providers will be required to fill out our profile form in a timely manner to ensure we can publish your profile by the perk fulfillment date.

*Dedicated Wellness Provider Description Page:

  a. services you supply, certifications

  b. hours, contact info, website and social media links

  c. list & description of local wellness products you carry (and or make yourself).

  d. local connections map - your 100 mile map of farms & producers who supply ingredients if you make your own products & the community organizations you support  (add map to your site, too!)

  e. community spirit section - links to the organizations you support.

  f. social & environmental responsibility section - focus on your concerns, product sourcing and more.

*Review hosting and Feel Good rating.

*Limited free community calendar events.

*Limited changes allowed.

Your two years on Friendly Fork begins the date your full profile is published. We will be sure to be in touch if there are any delays on our part. Thanks!
