I love to hike, bike, ski, snowshoe, and enjoy the beauty our planet provides us. Hockey is my passion! I love to create great meals from locally sourced ingredients.
I am a single dad who raised two wonderful daughters, Erin and Gwenn. My kids are my pride and joy and mean the world to me! They are my source of inspiration!
Together we can build a better world! Thank you for your support.
Peace,
John
                
I’m an entertainer and a poet, infatuated with the concept of community spirit and dedicated to living to serve. I have extensive food industry experience, appreciation for efficiency and sustainability, and a desire to develop my social networks. These events and feelings formed after acquiring a bachelor degree in Applied Economics & Management at Cornell University. Shortly after graduating I returned to Ithaca, NY, falling in love with its gorges, nature centers, and inhabitants. I wish to strengthen my community by bringing people together through food, wellness, and performance.
Best wishes,
Rem


                

Before graduating from the University of Vermont with a degree in business, my desire to play a role in the local food revolution was born from my own search for personal health and wellness. Driven to connect people to their local food systems, I was introduced to founder John Kearns by the UVM Sustainable Food Systems Initiative. I grew up in Massachusetts, embracing the outdoors while hunting, fishing, skiing & hiking or just walking in the woods. I enjoy cooking all that I gather from the land, the sea, or nearest farm.
Cheers to good health,
Harry               



Friendly Fork is for people seeking great food and wellness
providers. We are for folks who want to know the source of their food and how it
is raised. We are for people who believe in sustainability, social &
environmental responsibility, and community spirit. We provide you with the
knowledge to seek out businesses who truly care.

                
                


Like to know what is in the food they eat and where it comes
from.


Aim to eat mostly organically grown fruits and vegetables
and or humanely raised livestock. 


Seek out the local farms who truly care for the environment.


Seek to support small businesses run by kind folk whose
interest is the overall well-being of the community.


Strive to eat local foods whether at home or on the road.


Have dietary concerns for social or health reasons and need
to know ingredients of menu items when they dine out.


Have a holistic approach to their health and seek professionals
concerned with whole health - mind, body, and spirit.


Are socially & environmentally conscious and seek
like-minded businesses.


Care deeply for their community and have a strong desire to
give back.

ARE JUST PLAIN AWESOME!







                
The creation of
Friendly Fork has been done on a shoestring budget. We have scraped up every
penny so we could bring you a new way to look for the local food and wellness
providers you seek, while supporting the non-profit organizations who make our communities
whole. With no formal experience in web design, our team has built our Beta
website to show you our concept. We have been fueled by passion to create this
mission driven company. Now it is time to
expand.



                
We have compiled an
incredible data base of like-minded businesses we feel would make great
additions to the Friendly Fork family. We need to hire a team of
representatives to reach out to these businesses all across the United States,
Canada, and the world.



                
We need to hire
support staff to complete our team of professionals. By hiring programmers,
coders and IT professionals for the Friendly Fork team, we will be able to
build a more user friendly website and phone application. This is a costly yet
worthwhile venture which will streamline our process and help things run
efficiently.


                
What we have created so
far has been done on aging PCs and laptops. We need to upgrade to more up-to-date equipment and software to improve our efficiency and capabilities.


                
It is our goal to be able to multiply ten-fold in donations the support you generously give to help Friendly Fork create our Community of Communities. With your support in helping us build a talented team of professionals and purchasing efficient IT infrastructure, growth will happen quickly. We will provide you with a great, socially responsible food and wellness hub you can be proud to have helped get started. Your support, encouragement, and ideas will help make the Friendly Fork community of communities a driving force for change in the business world! Thank you for any help you can share! 





                
$40,000-50,000 IT Department

Web Development
App Development
CRM management software
Server development


                
$40,000-50,000 Sales and Support Teams

Strategy & Community Spirit
PR & Outreach
Member Recruitment
Customer Service
Provide Third Party Transparency Verification of our Giving Back Mission. 


                
$5,000-$15,000 Marketing Costs

Brand development
Localized Ads
Promotion through various media outlets


                
$15,000 - $20,000 Tech and Office Upgrade

Hardware
Software
Office Equipment and Supplies








                


Single farm per offer only. Farmers must be certified organic or utilize organic farming practices.
When you choose this
perk please try to include the Farm name or at least your contact information
(include email) so we may get in touch to get further information. We will
attempt to contact you within 2-4 business days, hopefully sooner for the basic
details.
We will announce that
your farm will is becoming a new member of the Friendly Fork family. Farms will
be required to fill out our profile form in a timely manner to ensure we can
publish your profile by the perk fulfillment date.

What Farms get on
Friendly Fork:
*Profile on your
Community Page.(We will build new community pages as needed!)
*Dedicated Farm
Description Page:
  a. certifications, farm practices, farm stand
hours, contact info, directions, more
  b. seasonal list of what you grow and raise -
veggies, herbs, fruit, livestock
  c. local connections map - your 100 mile map
of restaurants & producers who use your products, the community
organizations you support  and where you
sell your products (add map to your site, too!)
  d. community spirit section - links to the
organizations you support.
  e. social & environmental responsibility
section - focus on your concerns.
*Review hosting and
Yums Up rating.
*Social media and
website links.
*Limited free community calendar events.
*Limited changes
allowed.

Your two years on
Friendly Fork begins the date your full profile is published. We will be sure
to be in touch if there are any delays on our part. Thanks!


                

Local grocers or specialty food stores support  any combination of at least 10 local farmers
& food & wellness product creators.
When you choose this perk, please try to include the name of
the grocer, or at least your contact information and include your email address
so we may get in touch with you to finalize any details. You can expect to hear
from us within 2-4 business days.
We will announce via social media that your grocer is
becoming a new member of the Friendly Fork family. Grocers will be required to
fill out our profile form in a timely manner to ensure we can publish your
profile by the perk fulfillment date.
What Local Grocers receive on Friendly Fork 
*Profile on your Community Page; location, description,
rating, pictures
*Dedicated Grocery/Specialty Food Store Description Page:
  a. hours, contact
info, website and social media links
  b. local connections
map - your 100 mile map of farms & producers who supply your products &
the community organizations you support 
(add map to your site, too!)
  c. community spirit
section - links to the organizations you support.
  d. social &
environmental responsibility section - focus on your concerns, product sourcing
and more.
*Review hosting and Yums Up rating.
*Limited free community calendar events.
*Limited changes allowed.Your two years on Friendly Fork begins the date your full profile is published. We will be sure to be in touch if there are any delays on our part. Thanks!
                

One restaurant location per offer. Restaurant must not have more than
five locations of the same brand. 

When you choose this perk, please try to include the name of the restaurant, or at least your contact information and include your email address so we may get in touch with you to finalize any details. You can expect to hear from us within 2-4 business days.
We will announce via social media that your grocer is becoming a new member of the Friendly Fork family. Restaurants will be required to fill out our profile and Enhanced Menu ID forms in a timely manner to ensure we can publish your profile by the perk fulfillment date.

*Dedicated Enhanced Menu Page including:
  a. photo gallery
(5 pics),
  b. full menu -
item descriptions, local connections, dietary concerns identification, FDA 8 or Health Canada 11 most common allergens & gluten identification.
  c. local
connections map - your 100 mile map of the farmers, producers & community
organizations you support (add map to your site, too!)
  d. community
spirit section - links to the organizations you support
  e. social &
environmental responsibility section - focus on your concerns
*Review hosting and Yums Up rating.
*Limited free community calendar events.
*Limited menu changes every four monthsYour two years on Friendly Fork begins the date your full profile is published. We will be sure to be in touch if there are any delays on our part. Thanks!
                
One locations per offer only. Must not have more than 5 locations of the
same practice name.

When you choose this perk, please try to include the name of the practice, or at least your contact information and include your email address so we may get in touch with you to finalize any details. You can expect to hear from us within 2-4 business days.
We will announce via social media that your wellness provider is becoming a new member of the Friendly Fork family. Wellness providers will be required to fill out our profile form in a timely manner to ensure we can publish your profile by the perk fulfillment date.

*Dedicated Wellness Provider Description Page:
  a. services you
supply, certifications
  b. hours, contact
info, website and social media links
  c. list &
description of local wellness products you carry (and or make yourself).
  d. local
connections map - your 100 mile map of farms & producers who supply
ingredients if you make your own products & the community organizations you
support  (add map to your site, too!)
  e. community
spirit section - links to the organizations you support.
  f. social &
environmental responsibility section - focus on your concerns, product sourcing
and more.
*Review hosting and Feel Good rating.
*Limited free community calendar events.
*Limited changes allowed.Your two years on Friendly Fork begins the date your full profile is published. We will be sure to be in touch if there are any delays on our part. Thanks!

story:
If you know a little one and sleep time is the most difficult part of the day - then Dream Wonderland is for you!

Abigail Hatherley and Tracey Savage are launching the Dream Wonderland album and merchandise HERE via Indiegogo. Support us by making a contribution or buying one of our gift packs so that we reach our goal and release our products online. Be part of the magic!

The Concept

Dream Wonderland was created by a mother for her young children. It is a magical world of soothing music and illustrations specifically crafted to help parents calm and settle their children before sleep time. It gives carers much-needed relief, reducing the daily anxiety and stress that arises from coping with tired children at this often challenging time of the day. 

While initially crafted for babies and toddlers, its imaginative, calming music has also proved a relaxing influence on children up to 13 years of age. And parents too, can benefit from these meditative melodies. 

Abigail with Maddie and Callum in 2009

“The plan was for my two children, Maddie and Callum, to look forward to their pre-sleep routine. So I devised an imaginary world that they could travel to when they fell asleep - Dream Wonderland - somewhere magical, full of wonder,” says composer and creator Abigail Hatherley.

"I also wanted to create something that was not only musically rich and restful, but that would also stimulate their imagination, their vocabulary and their understanding of the world around them.” Studies show that bedtime routines including restful music can be beneficial for children. Listening to music from an early age activates neural pathways in the brain, inspiring creativity, while boosting intellectual and emotional abilities. 

Initially the album started as a handful of songs that Abigail played in her home. But after seeing the calming results with her own children and their enjoyment of the music Abigail began sharing it with family and friends. “My friends with children were interested to hear about what I was creating, and once I had written the first few tracks I felt Dream Wonderland was ready for its first real test. All of them came back to me with such beautiful, positive stories of how they and their kids loved the music, and that their children were soothed to sleep.”


Testimonials

Two year-old Neasa has been listening to Dream Wonderland twice a day for nearly a year. "We started playing Dream Wonderland for Neasa when she was 18 months old," says her Mum, Michelle, "It quickly became a really important part of our bedtime routine for day and night sleep times. She actively asks for 'lullabies' (as she calls it) and presses the on-button herself. And it is great that our very imaginative 6 year-old also loves the ethereal melodies and lyrics as much as Neasa does!".

Dream Wonderland's No. 1 Fan, Neasa (age 2)

“A delightful, soothing original song collection: my baby boy knows it’s time for bed when we put the CD on at night and it makes for a peaceful time for the whole family." - Sophie, mother of three.

"For my pre-school daughter the melodies, a mix of delicate lullabies and gentle adventures, are mesmerising and soothing." - April, mother of one.

"I loved it. The songs are original and yet so familiar - very comfortable and comforting. The CD has a beautifully dreamy quality to it - perfect for sleep time." - Cath, mother of one.

But before we tell you any more take a trip into the enchanting world of Dream Wonderland with the title track video accompanied by our illustrations...




We want to bring Dream Wonderland to the world and you can help

After the initial feedback Abigail was convinced that children and parents could benefit from an entire Dream Wonderland album, helping not only with sleep time but also to introduce young children to quality music from a young age.  

She then spent the next two years writing and editing the final album of 9 tracks. "Each song tells a story and all are linked into one continuous soundscape, so there are no pauses between tracks that can so easily bring a child back from the brink of a restful sleep. As the album progresses the songs become calmer and calmer until the final track, a 10-minute instrumental, leads them off to sleep; to their very own Dream Wonderland.”

"Since the very first lullaby was written nearly 4 years ago, my children still fall asleep to these songs and Dream Wonderland has grown into something I’m very proud of. Now I hope it will delight and inspire children (and parents) everywhere.”

Whether for home, pre-school, the car or at Gran’s house Dream Wonderland is a must have for parents and carers, and you can own a 1st edition signed copy or buy one of our beautiful gift packs for Christmas today. 


Buy a copy today & help us bring Dream Wonderland to life!

But we don’t want your money for nothing – we want your support to help get Dream Wonderland up and running, to make for happier children and parents around the world. In return you’ll receive first edition copies of a selection from our handcrafted range, including a CD signed by our composer, Dream Maker and Creator, Abigail. These funds will cover the first run of 1000 CDs, boxes of t-shirts, posters, pillows and tote bags to sell on to local stores and distributors, a quality website to showcase and sell our merchandise, plus a little bit of PR to spread the word.

But this album is JUST THE BEGINNING! We envisage a Dream Wonderland brand featuring a wide range of products, each sharing high quality and integrity, for children's sleep time - more music, picture books, bed sheets and covers, hanging mobiles, sleepwear, night lights - all featuring our two characters Dreamer and toy elephant Diddy that will sit easily among family treasures such as books by Enid Blyton, A.A. Milne, and Beatrix Potter.

By supporting us today you will be helping us set up business to build our vision and make these future projects possible.


Start your Dream Wonderland Collection now

All perks include free postage within Australia.

 

 
 
 
 


Other Ways You Can Help

Tell everyone you know about Dream Wonderland - friends, family, new mums, mums-to-be, mothers groups, preschool and school communities, plus sports parents (dance, soccer, swimming, rugby, AFL). Help us make some noise about our campaign.
Like our Facebook Page and our website. And remember to use the Indiegogo share tools.

The Dream Wonderland Team


Whilst writing the album and working as a freelance music composer Abigail met documentary maker Tracey Savage. She introduced the album to Tracey and a promising collaboration was born. "I heard this album and I knew I wanted it. Not only did I want it - I wanted to help Abigail get it out to the people who don't know that they want it yet! In fact they NEED it," Tracey says of the album. "It's a must have for any discerning lover of the classics whether it's grandparents who want to hear something soothing with their grandchildren, parents who want a family soundtrack for the home, car, before bedtime, during relaxation or time out."

Tracey with Audrey and husband James

Now accompanied by the evocative illustrations of Darren Pryce and Abigail. Dream Wonderland has become not just an album, it’s a place, a sleep-time world where a child and favourite toy elephant embark on an enchanting adventure, flying on magic carpets, sliding down rainbows, sailing over seas, through seasons and up into space.



Risks & Challenges

 The last five years has already seen plenty of hard work put into creating the concept, music and our initial range of merchandise. Now we've got something beautiful to share that we are truly happy with, our challenge is to get it out there - into people's homes and nurseries soothing their children to sleep.

Our major challenge is to sell the first run of 1000 albums. That is going to take plenty of calls to retailers and distributors, sending out many samples and then convincing them that their customers want and need Dream Wonderland. We'll also be developing our website, where customers can buy our wares direct, and also working on our PR.

A second challenge will be the wide variety of roles we'll have to cover to get Dream Wonderland off the ground. To save money at first we will both be tipping our hats into various elements of the project covering the launch, marketing, promotion, sales, business development, image development, brand development, further compositions, illustrations, writing and plans for world domination. And that's not including raising our own children! 


More about us

Abigail Hatherley - Dream Maker and Creator

Born in the UK and classically trained with a BA(Hons) in Music, and a Masters in Electro-Acoustic Music for Film and TV, Abigail Hatherley has been working as a freelance composer and music editor in Sydney, Australia since 2001 after winning a Women in Film and Television mentorship for emerging female screen composers. She has composed, produced and recorded music for many projects, most notably writing the original score for the feature film The Finished People. She has also composed for a range of documentaries, TV series, short films, promotional videos and advertisements, including the ABC documentaries Searching 4 Sandeep and series Family Confidential, plus the SBS documentaries Bush School and Gough Whitlam: In His Own Words. Mother of two, Abigail is the founder and composer for Dream Wonderland. For more details see her LinkedIn profile and website.

Tracey Savage - Dream Catcher and Hatcher

Tracey was raised in a small New Zealand town and spent many years in Wellington as a broadcaster and performer. After spending the last 12 years travelling and working mostly out of Sydney as a documentary maker Tracey has returned to the NZ coast with her family and is enjoying donning her old acting boots in children’s theatre. As well as working on various children’s entertainment and education products she continues her work in the documentary field and her transcription business across Australia and NZ. Mother to two-year-old Audrey, Tracey is managing the sales and marketing for Dream Wonderland. For more details see Savage Autonomy Transcriptions and her LinkedIn profile.


Thank You to...

Kathy Naunton

Once Abigail had written, performed and produced the tracks in her home-studio, she and Tracey hired the ‘ears and experience’ of Kathy Naunton, at DB Mastering, to master the album and help it reach it’s full potential, ready for distribution. For more details see www.dbmastering.com.au

Darren Pryce

Abigail and Tracey scoured the world (yes, the world) for the best fit in terms of an illustrator and were pleased to acquire the expert skills of Darren Pryce. Darren was commissioned to set about conjuring some of the beautiful imagery used to print the album booklet and images for promotion, marketing and fundraising. You can find more of Darren's beautiful work at www.illustration.net.au

story:
THE STORY OF OUR PROJECT

“Do you ever think about traveling the world?  Do you want to visit places far away?  Do you believe travel could enrich your life? If you answered, “Yes” to any of these questions, you want to know what we're all about.

Our popular culture reinforces the idea that travel planning is difficult and time consuming. We're out to change that fallacious idea one Byva Travel plan at a time!

Whether it’s a small group of travelers looking for an adventure package or an executive in New York looking for a private charter plane hire. A beach vacation somewhere exotic or a city break for the weekend. A visit to the south of France or the heart of Cape Town.  Byva Travel will cover all needs in relation to any travel services needed. Help us establish a travel service that will serve you wherever you may be.

One well planned trip can change a person’s ideas about what he or she can accomplish for the rest of their lives. Empower us to make this vision a reality with a contribution to our project today!

 


MORE ABOUT THE PROJECT 

Travel planning is a major sore point for 49% of travelers as you spend on average 29 days visiting 20+ websites during the research and planning phase of your trip.

While the Internet has changed the way travelers think about their travel needs and in particular how they go about their travel activities, this is a time consuming process because resources for trip-planning are scattered. While you can find information about specific destinations with a limited service offering, it's hard to find a fully baked itinerary that connects the dots and provides you with all the information needed right away.

One of the pioneers of this service is discount air fare brokers that took advantage of the Internet by offering tickets online at discounted rates, but this is all that they offer and where their service ends. Similar service providers have increased price competition and computerized reservation systems have increased the speed and efficiency between the agency to customer transaction, there are also increased start-up costs for other service providers who wish to be competitive and still these providers are not offering a full service. 

Moreover, industry competition and the increased number of travel options available have made it necessary for smaller service providers to establish themselves as being able to offer one type of travel service. Those that may offer more than one service, outsource the rest and still do not have a full service offering to give their clientele. There are currently no providers who specialize solely on providing travelers with a once stop solution that enables them to deal with a company that acts directly on their behalf without having to outsource services needed to multiple suppliers.

These facts prompted us to dig deeper into finding a solution, where travelers can get their information from professionals and really see what they want to see. This is where we started to envision Byva Travel and all the possible benefits it could offer.

At Byva Travel we understand that you are driven by the need to discover, the quest to know more about the world you live in and the people you share your world with and we aim to bring you a complete direct service offering that will cover all your travel needs while at the same time being customizable to your specific interests for a brand new travel experience.

Byva Travel's own website's platform will take you through a journey of discovery through authentic services that are based on real experiences. Our website's platform will allow you to not only discover these experiences but also book them to enable you to live them in real life, allowing you to discover the uniqueness of our service and thus experience destinations in a new way.

Our website's platform will not only be unique in that it will provide you with all the information that you need to make an informed decision about your chosen destination and give you all the services needed. It will also be fully customizable to provide you with additional services that you might like to book.

Our website's platform will also serve as a portal to not only our own experiences, but one where travelers such as yourself are talking, sharing ideas and shaping new realms of travel services to break through the traditional concepts and create a world in which collaboration and you are king.

             


ABOUT US - THE BYVA TRAVEL DREAM TEAM

Byva Travel members are experienced travel industry professionals with too many years to count in the travel industry allowing us to have acquired a versatile experience in all areas of this industry.

We are obsessed with creating memorable travel experiences that are created to suit your needs as more often than not when companies design new programs they contain preliminary flaws and don’t offer you an all in one solution. Our goal is to stay dedicated to quality because we know your travel needs are at stake and have designed a unique plan that is second to none for your traveling needs.

Want to know a bit more about the dream team, read on:

Ed – The Mastermind

Ed is where this venture started. While on one of his numerous travels the idea started forming and he spent the next few years not only perfecting every part of it, but also sourcing the best of the best. The future of the travel industry and the next generation of consultants who will discover new places to go and new ways to connect with travelers. A team with the same ideas that would contribute in their own right and make this dream come true. 

There has never been a time in his life where he was not involved in some aspect of the travel industry coming from a family background of travel consultants and tour guides that made sure travel ran in his blood.

After completing his Diplomas in Hotel Management and Advanced Hotel Management, the tourism bug finally got the better of him and he embarked in the travel industry on a full time basis and been involved in it ever since. He has had the opportunity to work for some of the biggest operators in the industry and working his way up ever since while working in numerous areas of the travel industry.

Ed loves his chosen career and could not imagine doing anything else. The diversity of being in the travel industry is an opportunity like no other and one that he is most passionate about. His strongest belief is in working with a hands-on approach, mixed with old fashion values and attention to details which to him is a winning recipe.

Mary – The Rose Among The Thorns

Mary is another veteran of the travel industry, starting her career in 1999 and venturing into various avenues of the industry over the years. She has experience in the airline industry as well as in inbound and outbound travel where she was given the opportunity to travel extensively and gain not only a professional experience, but to develop into an innovative and effective leader, excellent mentor and teacher that thrives on what she does.

Mary is a proficient, diverse and people orientated person that has a passion for travel and working in this exciting industry has given her the opportunity to fulfill her dreams of learning about a variety of cultures as well as meeting people from all over the globe.

Juggling both work and motherhood, she thrives on exceeding all expectations of her life and ensuring that her clients receive the best possible service to create and maintain those special relationships that she has created along her years in the tourism industry.

James – The Accomplished Traveler

James is the newest and youngest member of the Byva Travel family and a consultant who blows expectations out of the water. From the moment he started working in the travel industry he exuded a remarkable desire to learn everything about the industry, and that he did. James has developed a knack for managing both personal and online connections to help stay ahead of the game and his rule is to experience a destination first-hand before he is able to pass along personalized experiences and recommendations to evaluate client’s interests, offer insight on destinations and recommend a  customized travel experience.

After several very successful years, he realized he could make a stronger impact on people’s lives and develop stronger personal relationships with clients by being a part of the Byva Travel family and being able to offer his uniqueness to the brand without being held back.

Julie – The Number Cruncher

Julie’s background is in the finance sector with numerous years of articles in a medium sized Chartered Accountants firm as well as having her B.Com (Accounts) degree from the University of Johannesburg. Julie has done several contract based bookkeeping assignments in the last 12 years making her a key member of the financial expertise that Byva Travel will require.

Her skills and personal competences include extensive communication skills, a strong academic background, self-starter, definiteness of purpose, strong computer skills, excellent analytical skills, people's skills and a great team player, outstanding presentation skills, interpersonal and communication skills, report writing skills, analysis and research as well as the obvious financial skills.

We hope you liked this little introduction and it gave you a bit more depth into who we are.

We exist in a 24/7 world of nonstop information, and communicate with each other, other industry professionals and with our clients through multiple platforms. We aim to bring travel to you in ways that would have been unimaginable just a few years ago and while we feel truly fortunate to have enjoyed so many travel opportunities, this is for you. Our legacy that we hope you are as enthusiastic about as we are.

Help us make this project a reality and let’s get traveling!!

       


HOW YOU CAN HELP

For us to bring Byva Travel to life, we need your support!

Your generous contributions will help us get things started in order to realize not only our dreams but yours as well. It will assist us with the funding that we need to get started and more importantly you get the chance to be one of the first users of Byva Travel.

Byva Travel needs pledging, but above all it needs your attention and interest! If you love this product as much as we do then please take a moment to click on one of our social media icons below and on this page and help us spread the word about Byva Travel and get things started!

Help us make people notice and lets show the world how the internet can be used to bring people together and achieve incredible things. Use those share buttons until your fingers are raw so that we are able to reach as many people as possible and        make this amazing project come to life!

                     
                     Facebook             Twitter                 Google+             You Tube


HOW WE'LL USE THE CONTRIBUTIONS

Alas, what will we be using your hard earned contributions on? Well its quite simple.

We are aiming to raise $ 34,500 to fund our project. We already have  $ 6,500 of our own in place through our own contributions so our campaign goal is to raise $ 28,000 with IndieGoGo and you in turn.

When we reach that goal, we will be able to be fully operational and the dream begins, but if we do not reach the goal, any contributions raised will be a huge step forward in the future to be fully operational.

Below is what the contributions will be used for and our planned schedule:

WHAT DO YOU GET YOU ASK? PERKS TO THE RIGHT 
Based on our vision, we wanted to offer you something that truly gave back to you what you will be giving us, so to reward each and every one of you supporting this venture you’ll see on the right hand side of this page the assortment of unique perks to you as a contributor.

        


FINAL THANK YOU AND LINKS

Only together, can we make this happen and we feel so grateful to everyone who has taken the time to read our campaign and for those who contributed what they could to make a difference in helping us spread the word. 

We have spent the last few years planning and working hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and it was worth every minute thanks to all our generous supporters. Please know your efforts, even the smallest, don’t go unnoticed.  We will continue to keep you posted on what your contribution helped us achieve as you are now part of our Byva Travel family.

If for whatever reason you can’t contribute to our campaign, no hard feelings, and all we ask in return is that you please help us spread the word by any means possible. You are able to contribute in so many other ways and that’s all we ask of you. Use the IndieGoGo tools at the top of this page to recommend us via e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, Google+, word of mouth, smoke signals or if you really feel like it, climb the nearest mountain and shout it for the world to hear.

If there is anything you want to discuss with us directly, we would love to hear from you. Think we are awesome and the best thing since sliced bread? Think we suck and we're not going to make a difference? (in which case we have some bad news for you…) please feel free to contact us at info@byvatravel.com leave us your thoughts under the comments section or keep track of us and our progress here on our IndieGoGo page or on our Social Media pages.

HAPPY TRAVELS FROM ALL OF US AT BYVA TRAVEL

SMART TRAVEL SOLUTIONS MADE EASY

story:
The Stroopie Co. was established in 2008 in  Lancaster, PA.    Since the founding our business, we have had two main goals: 

 1) To support refugees who are starting over in Lancaster by providing meaningful employment.

2) To make high quality Stroopies to sell in Lancaster and all over the US.

Currently, there are 60 million refugees world wide who have been forced to flee their countries due to war, natural disasters, and drought.   Each year our beautiful city of Lancaster, invites approx. 1,000 of these dear folks to get re-established in our area.   In addition to the turbulent and often-traumatic path to come to the United States, many refugees face a difficult time finding employment once they are resettled in Lancaster due to language and cultural barriers.        

The Stroopie Co., was founded with the goal of producing top notch Stroopies, while make a difference to the refugee population that is resettling in Lancaster.  

So what is a Stroopie?  A Stroopie is a Dutch stroopwafel, that is made here locally.   It is a cinnamon cookie, made with a waffle iron with a layer of homemade caramel in the inside.   Traditionally, the Stroopie is placed on top of your hot beverage to rewarm.  It is also great with ice cream!   Some of our Stroopies are half-dipped in Wilbur Chocolate.  Other varieties include specialty dipped chocolate with pecan and espresso and a gluten-free line.   Stroopies are hand-made with local ingredients from companies that are committed to being socially responsible.   See more at our website:  www.stroopies.com or like us at our facebook page:  https://www.facebook.com/pages/Lancaster-County...

Would you help us move our Stroopie Co. to Lancaster City?  

Currently, we are sub-leasing space and renting equipment to make our Stroopies at Groff's Candies, in Millersville, PA.

In January 2015, doors opened for us to purchase a store-front at 141 North Duke St., in Lancaster City.   We couldn't be more thrilled to be moving our Stroopie Co. into the city!   This will help us have a stronger market in downtown Lancaster and also be a more accessible location for the refugees that we are hiring.

We are proud to present, "The Lancaster Sweet Shoppe" where we will make and feature our Stroopies, along with Groff's Candies, and Pine View Dairy Ice Cream.   Partnering with these other businesses will allow us to offer a delightful array of treats and at the same time give us a boost in our goal  of hiring refugees for full-time positions, giving them the tools they need to successfully acclimate to the community as well as become successful in their future ventures. 

                      (Representation of future sight at 141 N Duke St)


How can you help? 

By partnering with us in this campaign, you can pre-order Stroopies and help us buy the equipment that we will need at our new Shoppe at the same time.   

We need approx. $20,000 dollars to buy mixers, irons, and equipment to get us in production in our new Shoppe on Duke St..

For every $1.00 that is given, The Stroopie Co. will send you a gift certificate of the same amount to be redeemed for Stroopies at the Lancaster Sweet Shoppe, opening summer 2016.    You will also be able to redeem the gift certificate as soon as you get it at our current location at Groff's Candies at 3587 Blue Rock Rd, Lancaster, 17603.

For example, if you give a $50 dollar donation to our campaign, we will in return send you via e-mail a $50 printable gift certificate that you can redeem for Stroopies at The Lancaster Sweet Shoppe next summer or at Groff's Candies.

The Impact:

 Currently, we are making approx. 62,000 Stroopies a year to cover our fixed and variable costs.   We wholesale our Stroopies to over 50 stores in the US.

 To date we have been able to hire 12 refugees to work seasonally at our company.   The Stroopie Co's dream is to scale and grow the business so that meaningful full-time employment can be provided to refugees resettling in Lancaster year round.   

Right now we make 1,200 Stroopies each week.   In three years we hope to be making  6,000 additional Stroopies a week, and have four refugees working full-time with the Stroopie Co.   We view it as success for our employees to either move up in leadership positions in our company, or equal success if they use our company as a spring board to leap into other occupations.    

Vision of Success:  Refugees finding meaningful employment in our Stroopie Co., while producing great product in a growing business!

We are Jonathan and Jennie Groff,  part owners of the Stroopie Co. based out of Lancaster, PA.   We are thrilled to be a part of the Pitch 2015, representing the Stroopie Co.   We are a husband and wife team...married 15 wonderful years and have 4 beautiful children.   Our home is on Old Dorwart St., Lancaster City.   We have enjoyed living in this diverse neighborhood where we have the nations of the world as our neighbors.   It has been our delight as a family to host different international students through the years and to have friends from around the world. Our passion in life is to do everything we do as worship to God and to love our neighbor well!

                                                  

The Stroopie Co. thanks you so much for your support and your encouragement as we have worked tirelessly to get our social enterprise off the ground and running.   We understand that not everyone can contribute to our business...but PLEASE spread our story and help us get the word out about our vision and our product.   Also, think about who might appreciate a Stroopie Gift Pack this holiday season....they make great gifts!!!  

  For sure, come visit us in our new location, "The Lancaster Sweet Shoppe," next summer!   We look forward to giving you a tour, introducing you to some of our wonderful refugee employees, and sending you home with warm, fresh Stroopies to enjoy with your hot beverage!  


This crowdfunding campaign is part of The Great Social Enterprise Pitch, a friendly competition facilitated by ASSETS and the Lancaster County Community Foundation. The Pitch consists of social enterprise ideas based in Central Pennsylvania. A Social Enterprise is a market-based, income-generating enterprise that aims to solve a social and/or environmental problem through its business activities.  Social enterprises focus on a trip bottom line:  people, planet, and profit.  Upon completion of the Crowdfunding phase of the competition, 5 ideas will be chosen to move on to the Live Pitch, during which the contestants will present their ideas to a panel of judges, with winners receiving a package of cash and pro-bono prizes. In 2014, winners received nearly $40,000 in cash and pro-bono prizes.
Please visit www.lancasterpitch.com for more information.  To access to the crowdfunding sites of all participating social enterprise ideas, click here:  https://www.indiegogo.com/partners/SocialEnterprisePitch.

successfully acclimate to the community as well as become successful in their
future ventures. 


                      (Representation of future sight at 141 N Duke St)

How can you help? 
By partnering with us in this campaign, you can pre-order Stroopies and help us buy the equipment that we will need at our new Shoppe at the same time.   
We need approx. $20,000 dollars to buy mixers, irons, and equipment to get us in production in our new Shoppe on Duke St..


For every $1.00 that is given, The Stroopie Co. will send you a gift certificate of the same amount to be redeemed for Stroopies at the Lancaster Sweet Shoppe, opening summer 2016.    You will also be able to redeem the gift certificate as soon as you get it at our current location at Groff's Candies at 3587 Blue Rock Rd, Lancaster, 17603.
For example, if you give a $50 dollar donation to our campaign, we will in return send you via e-mail a $50 printable gift certificate that you can redeem for Stroopies at The Lancaster Sweet Shoppe next summer or at Groff's Candies.
The Impact:
 Currently, we are making approx. 62,000 Stroopies a year to cover our fixed and variable costs.   We wholesale our Stroopies to over 50 stores in the US. 
 To date we have been able to hire 12 refugees to work seasonally at our company.   The Stroopie Co's dream is to scale and grow the business so that meaningful full-time employment can be provided to refugees resettling in Lancaster year round.   

Right now we make 1,200 Stroopies each week.   In three years we hope to be making  6,000 additional Stroopies a week, and have four refugees working full-time with the Stroopie Co.   We view it as success for our employees to either move up in leadership positions in our company, or equal success if they use our company as a spring board to leap into other occupations.    
Vision of Success:  Refugees finding meaningful employment in our Stroopie Co., while producing great product in a growing business!
We are Jonathan and Jennie Groff,  part owners of the Stroopie Co. based out of Lancaster, PA.   We are thrilled to be a part of the Pitch 2015, representing the Stroopie Co.   We are a husband and wife team...married 15 wonderful years and have 4 beautiful children.   Our home is on Old Dorwart St., Lancaster City.   We have enjoyed living in this diverse neighborhood where we have the nations of the world as our neighbors.   It has been our delight as a family to host different international students through the years and to have friends from around the world. Our passion in life is to do everything we do as worship to God and to love our neighbor well!
                                                  

The Stroopie Co. thanks you so much for your support and your encouragement as we have worked tirelessly to get our social enterprise off the ground and running.   We understand that not everyone can contribute to our business...but PLEASE spread our story and help us get the word out about our vision and our product.   Also, think about who might appreciate a Stroopie Gift Pack this holiday season....they make great gifts!!!  
  For sure, come visit us in our new location, "The Lancaster Sweet Shoppe," next summer!   We look forward to giving you a tour, introducing you to some of our wonderful refugee employees, and sending you home with warm, fresh Stroopies to enjoy with your hot beverage!  

This
crowdfunding campaign is part of The Great Social Enterprise Pitch,
a friendly competition facilitated by ASSETS and the Lancaster County
Community Foundation. The Pitch consists of social enterprise
ideas based in Central Pennsylvania. A Social Enterprise is a
market-based, income-generating enterprise that aims to solve a social and/or
environmental problem through its business activities.  Social enterprises
focus on a trip bottom line:  people, planet, and profit.  Upon
completion of the Crowdfunding phase of the competition, 5 ideas will be chosen
to move on to the Live Pitch, during which the contestants will present their
ideas to a panel of judges, with winners receiving a package of cash and
pro-bono prizes. In 2014, winners received nearly $40,000 in cash and pro-bono
prizes.
Please visit www.lancasterpitch.com for more information.  To
access to the crowdfunding sites of all participating social enterprise
ideas, click here:  https://www.indiegogo.com/partners/SocialEnterprisePitch.

story:
Join a Pirate

I am a software engineer working in the industry for the last 20 years. I wish to see some things change for the better and not for the worse as is the case with the efforts of backward politicians. 

I believe that the advancements in computing are held back by the same corrupt system of patents and copyrights that has held progress back for more than 300 years.

Elections 2015, round 2 

Help me help the Pirate Party of Greece take part in the 2015 elections, hashtag #elections2015_round2

By donating you will enable us to print and distribute ballots and run the ad campaigns we need to  get the message out.

Politicians misleading Greeks
Politicians in Greece are misleading the people by making the agreement sound as the problem or the solution to Greeces problem, when infact the agreement is the result of the mounting problems. Inequality, injustice and beaurocracy prevail in our system. The Pirate Party seeks to change that with our help. 
Accept the challenge

Pirate Parties, although small in numbers and political power have made a difference in the past because the causes we took upon ourselves were causes that released peoples creativity. We seek intellectual profit more than anything else. 

Why not donate to the Pirate Party directly?

You can, if you want to give your information to a bank. This is the ISBN  number for the Pirate Party of Greece: GR33 0171 0170 0060 1704 0060 750
However, Greek law prohibits the Pirate Party from accepting large anonymous donations even in the form of crowd-funding. It is made up in such a way that only parties that have a large number of members and usually are already financed by the state can get large anonymous donations. This crowd-funding will enable me to bypass those laws and donate the money collected here as an individual. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by signing up as a member of a Pirate Party in your country. If there is none, create one. Greece welcomes members here. Most Pirate Parties also have Forums and Twitter accounts you can follow.  You can also help by putting any of these links on your site or blog.

story:
SUPPORT US AND GET FIT!

Help us spread wellness with online video workouts fusing the best of yoga, pilates,  and barre.   Core Lotus Cardio is a subscription-based service offering streaming workouts online,  inspiring people to gain wellness and fitness through a BALANCED, LOVING APPROACH TO FITNESS.

A Safe AND Effective Workout You Can Do From Home

Hello!  My name is Sarah.  As a certified teacher of all 3 major disciplines, and after working with a variety of clients in Los Angeles and abroad, they inspired me to create a workout that felt effective and challenging, but also felt centering and expansive.  I love teaching people how to change their lives by connecting with their mind, body, and spirit through yoga, pilates, and barre.  

My goal was to create a workout to promote true VIBRANT BALANCE.  

And Core Lotus Cardio was born.  

  • Our mission is to give busy moms, hard-working corporate employees, baby-boomers, and anyone looking to improve their health and well-being the opportunity to increase vitality, strength, flexibility, cardio fitness with a balanced workout and the convenience of always-available streaming videos.

I feel extremely honored and excited to share this with the world.  More explanation in this video...


An explanation of Core Lotus Cardio in Japanese.

Below are video highlights from various shoots during the creation phase of CLC.  The location is our home studio, but the majority if CLC library classes will be filmed in a large studio location.

Here are highlights of a "CLC Lite" class.


OUR GOAL

By the end of 2015, we plan on building a library of over 500 video workouts - available to our subscribers on any device through streaming.  We will also be building into the site a lifestyle community - think recipes, tips & info, and opportunities to connect and support like-minded people.


Core Lotus Cardio is a sustainable, life-long movement method that provides results, but doesn't "crank" just for the sake of feeling the burn.  

                          

We have seen incredible results and excitement for a fusion class like CLC.  

                            


The last 18 months have been devoted to refining and writing the 100-page manual.   We recently held our first teacher training here in Los Angeles, and have 5 beautifully talented teachers ready to start creating workouts for you!

We are asking for you to generously bring our dream to reality - we need to raise money for the production, marketing, and technology costs.  


What We Need & What You Get

We have set a goal of $10,000 to cover our startup and production costs.  

WE ONLY NEED 100 GENEROUS PEOPLE TO BUY THE $100 PERK (1-year all-access pass) TO REACH OUR GOAL!

  • Marketing Costs - we will use a portion of funds to GET THE WORD OUT - we will start with Facebook, and move into additional online / social media based marketing campaigns.
  • Developing & integrating technology to deliver the streaming workouts.  We are working with very talented 3rd party providers to create an amazing user experience for CLC subscribers.  Technology includes: library hosting, video streaming, library user interface, & user membership administration
  • Production Equipment : We own a camera, and audio equipment, and we will purchase additional equipment to reduce monthly production costs from rentals - two light sources, large diffusion, headset microphone, ear-monitor for music playback, Recorder/Monitor combo.
  • Production Crew:  we have a team of all-star Los Angeles crew-folk that are donating their time during our development stage.  We'd like to pay them. 
  • Studio space rental


The PERKS

As a thank you for your part in helping us reach our goal, we have created a number of great perks to offer.  Along with our undying gratitude:
  •  we are offering pre-sales of our 6-month and yearly passes, so as soon as we launch you can begin to enjoy the benefits of Core Lotus Cardio!  
  • T-shirts!
  • Signature CLC moves
  • Custom workouts created just for you and your personal goals
  • Private sessions with creator Sarah Skaer!
 

                  


The Impact

  • When we achieve our goal, we will be able to provide online streaming workouts that provide inspirational, loving, balanced approach to movement, health, and personal fitness - with the added convenience and affordability of doing it at home or on the go.
  • I am an entrepreneur at heart, having been an independent business owner since I started in the fitness industry as an instructor.   My partner in all of this is my husband who started his first business in college and has built a successful media services company.  


Risks & Challenges

With our limited budget we have challenges with the cost of production & technology development, as we are planning to shoot several videos a month.  Crew  / human hours are a challenge as we need to run a tight production process to keep  up with our deliveries.  Also - getting the word out and rising above the noise can be a challenge.
Our team of dedicated and professional artists and working to meet our deadlines. We have some very creative and capable people involved and I am confident they are up for the task of accomplishing our goals in a highly successful manner.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are STILL reading this and you are unable to contribute financially at this time, please SHARE this campaign with as many people as you can - like us on FB, share a link on Twitter, or get in your bi-plane and write our website address in the sky (preferable over a baseball game of 40,000 screaming fans)

Sarah Skaer & Mike Felbinger - we thank you!

Our team of dedicated and professional artists and working to meet our deadlines. story:
En breve

Buscamos construir una plataforma de colaboración y conexión laboral para aquellos profesionistas de las industrias de la comunicación:

  • Comunicación
  • Marketing
  • Publicidad
  • Relaciones Públicas
  • Periodismo
  • T.I.C.
  • Diseño
  • Web

Capital Social no sólo te conecta con profesionistas similares a ti, sino también con empresas solicitantes que necesitan de tu gran creatividad y dedicación. Además, Capital Social te permite gestionar proyectos a través de nuestra plataforma y organización, evitando los miles de pasos fiscales y protocolarios para entrar a proyectos con empresas grandes, protegiéndote además en cuestiones de capital intelectual.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Necesitamos generar un fondo para arrancar nuestras acciones de promoción, en base a tu cooperación puedes obtener descuentos en:

  • La suscripción cómo usuario premium dentro de la plataforma una vez que se encuentre activa.
  • Asistencias a eventos, foros, webinars y capacitaciones.

 

¡Impacto!

Capital Social te va a permitir conectarte con toda esta gran industria de creativos que muchas veces se encuentra desprotegida, posicionarte y conectarte para proyectos e ir trazando tu camino profesional acompañado de una gran red.

 

¡Y eso es todo!

story:
The Event

Santa Claus is coming to town!... for most Americans, the holidays are a major cause for celebration, but for the victims of Hurricane Sandy, things are not as rosy…

These people need our help, and that's why we’re here: to raise money, to help them out and to brighten up New York with crowds of running Santas!

Hundreds of runners from various world universities, cities and institutions are rapidly gathering... we want you to join us! On Sunday December 2 2012 at 1pm, hundreds of Santas will descend upon the streets of New York to raise money for the victims of Hurricane Sandy.

The jog/walk will start at the Sundial, College Walk at Columbia University (116th St. between Broadway and Amsterdam). There will be many stops along the way, which will be great photo opportunities for you and your fellow Santas!

  1. Cathedral of St. John the Divine on 110th and Amsterdam
  2. Central Park East Drive
  3. Rockefeller Center Christmas Tree at 5th Ave between 49th and 50th
  4. Times Square at 42nd and Broadway
  5. Union Square

What You Can Do

There are many ways you can support this event:

  • Be a runner! Get a Santa costume, grab the $10 Race Registration perk, and show up on Sunday, December 2!
  • Make a donation - every penny will help to rebuild New York
  • Support the runners! Hundreds of people are going to get together to create a spectacle on the streets of New York. Come to watch and cheer them on!
  • Join the Facebook event (link below)
  • Spread the news! Share this page with all of your friends and family so we can raise more money than the other participating cities

The Impact

All donations will go to the Mayor's Fund to Advance New York City to support Hurricane Relief. More details on this charity can be found here: http://www.nyc.gov/html/fund/html/home/home.shtml 

Race Details

Detailed route map: http://s10.postimage.org/r7u4st2d3/Santa_Dash_Map.jpg

  • Starting at the Sundial, head east on College Walk
  • Turn right on Amsterdam
  • Turn left on 110th Street
  • Turn right into Central Park and head all the way down East Drive
  • Go down 5th Avenue and stop at Rockefeller Center to see the Christmas Tree
  • Turn right on 42nd Street and head to Times Square
  • Turn left on Broadway and head all the way down to finish at Union Square
  • Extended happy hour until closing at Brad's

story:
Short Summary

On May 24, 2013 my van was stolen was from outside a gig. The van was recovered a few days later, but my equipment that was in the van was not. While the police have a list of what was stolen, and I have spoken with several pawn shops, I am told that the chances of my gear being recovered are minimal. 

The dollar amount of the gear is not excessive, but with costs from getting the van back and repaired as well as school costs, I cannot afford to replace it.

I am asking only for enough to get back what was lost.  

What We Need & What You Get

Best estimates are I lost about $2500 work of equipment. Nothing uber-fancy. This was my backup system that I take to my weekly trivia gigs around Atlanta. 

Since I am a dj, my perks are food and fun. Should you live too far for us to meet for lunch or dinner, I will send you a gift card. Should you live too far away for me to dj a party, we can figure out what to do. 

For $10 I will thank you on my website/facebook/twitter/ etc.

For $25 I will take you out to lunch or dinner on a date TBD. Nothing fancy, but a way to spend time with you and give you proper thanks. As well as thank you on my website and all social media. 

For $100 I will buy you lunch or dinner at a date TBD, as well as I will dj your party for 1 hour. Plus thanks on my website and social media. Distance from Atlanta 25 miles. 

For $500 you will get lunch or dinner, I will DJ your party for 4 hours. As well as thanks on my website and social media. Distance from Atlanta 50 miles. 

For $1000 you will get lunch or dinner, I will DJ your party for 7 hours. As well as thanks on my website and all social media. And I will name my van after you. Distance from Atlanta 100 miles

If you live too far for us to meet for lunch or dinner, I will send you a gift card. 

 

If I dont reach my goal, I will make good to those who funded and replace what I can with the available funds. 

If I go over my goal, I will make good on all perks, replace my missing gear, and use the extra to complete repairs on my van. ungrade my insurance and pay down debt I have incurred from this experience.    

The Impact

I am a grad student as well as a DJ and Outreach Coordinator at a nonprofit. The van was bought with what little savings I had and support from family to help me grow my business. Your support will help a (very) small business owner get back on track. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant help, please share this on social media and boost the signal. 

 

Thank you

story:
MaxaMom has been working since October 2012 to help single parents and kids realize their everyday heroism. 

We draw distinct parallels between heroes and single parents by spending time with career heroes such as police officers, firefighters, and military personnel in the winter and having outdoor activities and adventures in the summertime! Our slogan, “fighting the mombie apocalypse,” refers to our mission against becoming parents who are so overwhelmed by their responsibility that they fall into rote automation. 

Single parenting is considered a social deficit. However, single parents are raising our next world leaders! MaxaMom does three main things to empower single parents and fight the “social deficit” stigma:

  1. We have an extremely comprehensive listing of Twin Cities area events to help busy parents plan on-the-fly.
  2. We have a number of discounts available from businesses and institutions for  MaxaMoms, from the MN Historical Society to Westside Skydive!
  3. We throw monthly events to network, support one another, and have fun.

Money would definitely help us achieve MaxaMom’s goals of registering as an official nonprofit, getting a great website up, and producing quality monthly events.

MaxaMom is requesting cash donations because:

  • Each event since October 2012 has been personally funded by one single mother at an average of $100 per event.
  • Copies of event promotions alone have cost hundreds of dollars.
  • Have you ever bought hundreds of yards of ribbon? That’s expensive, too!
  • The last $90 of filing fees to become an official nonprofit has set MaxaMom back. With the attendance of recent events, we need insurance that official “not-for-profit” status would give us! $500+
  • A developer has been hired to get our currently disastrous website in order within the next month. $500+

 

MAXAMOM’s success depends on you spreading the word about our events and mission to empower single parents! 

We ask that you promote MaxaMom’s activities to the single parents in your life. It’s all for fun and for free.

We also ask that you reach out to local businesses that may wish to provide awesome discounts to MaxaMoms!

THANK YOU!

story:
Our Story

I recently heard that some seniors in my area are on a wait list to get meals. Can you imagine not having food in your kitchen and not knowing where your next meal is coming from? Can you imagine being 70+yrs old, on a fixed income and have to pay for housing, medications, doctors visits, hospital visits, insurance and still have enough money to buy yourself healthy food for the month? If you can imagine that!

We go out to eat, and many times our leftovers get thrown away. Think about how much food gets thrown away everyday, in every city in the world. Think about the amount of food that is thrown out daily, that people who are starving would love to have. We take so many things for granted. I can't imagine being 80 years old with illnesses, having to buy medications to stay alive and keep a roof over my head with no food in my pantry. Something has to give. Right? If you only get 700.00 a month to live on, and medications alone cost 400.00 a month, how would you survive? I see this everyday in my line of work. Robbing Peter to pay Paul is no way for a senior to live.  Everyday I'm touched by a senior who is in need. Help me, Help them.


The Impact

There are 15 senior citizens in my area who are going hungry. By donating to my cause, you will be helping feed a senior citizen for a whole year. I know 15 people doesnt sound like much of an impact, but think about it this way, 15 seniors are hoping that they will get fed this week. So next time you sit down to enjoy a meal, think about how you helped those 15 enjoy a hot meal as well.

What We Need & What You Get

By donating to my cause, you will be helping raise money for the 15 seniors who are on the wait list for meals. For every $200, a senior gets meals for a year. My goal is $3,000 but anything after that will go towards other seniors in need of food or services. 

Take a moment and think...If your neighbor was starving, would you offer them a crumb or give them a loaf of bread? Better yet, If you were starving, would you want someone to help you?  
For every person who donates to my cause, you get the satisfaction of knowing you helped a senior citizen enjoy a hot meal for a whole year. You can hold your head up high, knowing that you made someones life easier. And maybe someday when you become a senior yourself, someone will be as kind to you.

Other Ways You Can Help

(Unleash the DIWO! Do-it-with-others. If you have a facebook, myspace, twitter page...PLEASE share my link with others. The more people know about my cause, the better chances I have to reach my goal!!! So if you can't donate, please pass it along to others. THANK YOU SO MUCH!)

story:
IMPORTANT:

For tracking success/failure or simply share your experiment with your mini hyena I intend to create some form of communication channel. What do you guys think, which one suit us the best?:

  • mailing list (google groups)
  • forum
  • facebook :)
  • >insert your idea here<

Just put in the comments what you prefer!

 

Short Summary

This is a drive gear mainly for pushing filament in a 3D printer which works from a spool of filament, like reprap, makerbot, ultimaker and many others.

About me

I've been in DIY 3D printing for a long time, I started around 2007 with a water pipe based machine, then it followed a Rapman and after a Reprap Mendel. Now I have an aluminium profile based machine which resembles a MendelMax printer.

Once the machine worked properly mechanically, I was struck by the lack of reliable hotend, so I've been developing hotends and related gears since then.

This drive gear is yet another step forward. Maybe it seems like a small step, but could turn out to be a big leap forward for the 3D printer enthusiasts!

 

Outline of manufacturing

All of the price at the left is basically calculated of manufacturing 100 mini hyenas in mind at costs. Once this campaign is over, the hyenas will be available on my webstore at a slightly higher price.

History

  1. Hobbed bolts

 

All started with lack of reliable hobbed bolt manufacturing. I never could make the failure rate less then 20%.

  2. Hyena, the new generation

To solve this issue, I started to work on bar with sharp teeth, where each tooth cut invidually.

I named it hyena because hyenas have the strongest jaw of all mammals.

 

  3. New family members: Mini hyenas

This is what this campaign is about. To have a full range of drive gears:

 

We can produce the hobbing to fit 5mm or 8mm shafts.

Installation

Just put onto a motor's shaft of 5 or 8mm. Here is an example:

The drive gear will come with an M3 grubscrew. On the above photo there is an M3x3 grubscrew, but we will ship M3x4 because it looks better.

Shipping fee

Its 1.5USD for everyone, everywhere.

(Once you get a confirmation email, its ready to ship, you are asked to send another 1.5USD in plus of your donation/contribution. If I started the campaign now, I would list the perks 13.5USD (with free shipping) instead 12USD (without shipping) to avoid confusion.)

Drawings

You want to adjust your machine in advance? Or just curious? Here we go:

Compatible planetary stepper motors

Be warned, it may work or may not work (ie. untested). But these are our best bets:

  • Kysan 42BYGH243-14 (8mm shaft)
  • Phidgets Inc. 42BYGH40(M)-160-4A (8mm shaft)
  • PG35L-D48 (5mm shaft)
  • High torque nema17 stepper motor (may be not working!)

Update:

The new 8x5 mini hyena prototype is ready!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Just spread the word.

story:
THANK YOU FOR YOUR PLEDGES. PLEASE HELP US HOW YOU CAN....
EVERY DOLLAR HELPS US GET CLOSER TO MAKING THIS FACILITY A REALITY.

...but if you can't help monetarily, or if you already have, you can still help us by...

SPREADING THE WORD!
Besides giving, the best way to help is to share this pledge drive with everyone you know. Please share our story with your family and friends by sending them to this page, as well as posting on Facebook or Twitter.

______________________________________________________________

WHO WE ARE

We are working on creating a new facility for the Twin Cities and surrounding communities.  My 27 years of aviation experience, and 15 years in the event and museum industry, has shown me there is a strong demand for a location to educate visitors about aviation (current and historic) and have the ability to host a wide variety of events.  According to the Air & Space Smithsonian, our airport is one of the most unique airports in the country.  It hosts a wide variety of aircraft, such as 1920s vintage and 1940s WWII, all the way to modern corporate jets.  Yet, the community has little ability to view, learn about, and experience these aircraft and this industry because of a poor airport design.  Because of this, I formed an experienced team that consists of Board Members, Contractor, Lawyer, Accountant, Bankers, and Airport staff that have been working hard to see this project become a success.

 

HERE'S THE PROJECT

We propose to build a 50,000 square foot facility housing three entities. On one side is an Event Center for corporate events, trade shows, special events, wedding receptions and private parties with seating for almost 1,000 people. Word of this project has spread quickly, already resulting in hundreds of requests for event space from groups large and small.  The other side of the facility will be divided between an aviation theme Gift Shop and Restaurant with seating for 300 guests. Also planned is an added exterior deck and atrium seating to overlook the airport for viewing departing and arriving aircraft year round. The facility will be located in the southwest corner of the Anoka County Airport in Blaine, Minnesota.

This new facility will allow visitors to view these aircraft operating on a regular basis in a very unique venue.  It will also provide a place to create events with limitless possibilities.  For example, the facility will have the ability to host educational events with veterans or icons from many industries.

 

WHERE THE FUNDS GO

We are seeking immediate funding to complete site development.  We are working with a bank to finance the majority of the project, but those funds are solely dedicated for building construction.  Prior to any construction, we are required to complete all site development tasks.  Tasks such as site surveying, engineering drawings, and driveway access (to name just a few) are costly, but are essential steps in moving this project forward.

- Without immediate funding, these tasks cannot be completed.

- Your pledge dollars will go directly to these type costs.

 

THE GOAL

Aviation is my passion and it's my goal to share the many aspects of history and modern technology that surround it with as many people as possible. In the past, when someone needed help building something useful, such as a barn, the local community came together and built it. Once built, everyone would celebrate by sharing a meal under the new roof. I seek to build Flight Line Cafe` & Event Center in the same manner. Help us Raise Our Barn!

Thank you for your consideration,

       ~ Craig Schiller ~

______________________________________________________________

How Indiegogo Works

It really simple!  It only takes $1 or more to support our efforts to raise funds. We have some exciting perks for almost all levels of giving. Find them on the right-hand side of the page. In order to pledge your support, you only need a credit card or PayPal account. It's that easy and only takes a few minutes!

    

Watch a three minute CG video of the proposed facility design.

 

 

                   ~ Here are Your Perks ~

 

PLEDGE of $25 or More:

You will receive packet of 6 assorted colors Aero Props. They are the high flying, hand propelled plastic copter of the very best quality! The newest model of the original wooden flying copter. Aero Prop propeller toys are a safe toy that will provide hours of fun. With practice you can control their height, angle, speed and direction. The super fun sport flyer that soars up to 35 feet! The propeller is 3/4" wide X 8" long, with a 7” detachable shaft for mixing and matching. 

 

 

PLEDGE of $100 or More:

You will receive your choice of any one BOOK from our online gift shop. We have a number of aviation historical and educational items to choose from.

 

 

PLEDGE of $250 or More:

You will receive a complementary entrée for you and your guest in our café. Once open, you'll be able to dine in the atrium seating or on our outdoor deck for viewing the unique aircraft departing and landing at this great airport.  You will also receive a $25 voucher for our Gift Shop that can be used on a current online purchase or in store, once open.

     

 

PLEDGE of $500 or More:

You will receive 1 of 3 different Bob Hoover signed prints by artist Sam Lyons, and a complementary entrée for you and your guest in our café (see $250 pledge for entrée gift). This print is one of the three 18” x 22.5” unframed prints. All three are signed and numbered. In addition to the print, you will receive the 5 ½” X  8 ½” Certificate of Authenticity.  If you bought any of the other Hoover-based prints, this rounds out the collection.

    

 

PLEDGE of $1,250 or More:

You will receive a 30 minute flight for two people in an open cockpit biplane. From the moment you first see the beautiful blue and silver Travelair looking as if it has just been waiting to fly again, you will know you are about to do something unique and adventurous.

You are about to experience something that few people in our modern world will ever have a chance to do. You will be seeing and sensing the world as only the aviation pioneers of a time long past had experienced. You will be surprised that you can smell the fresh cut grass and how exhilarating the wind feels in your face behind the powerful radial engine.

Most modern aircraft are like sitting in your living room chair. You haven't truly tasted flight until you do something like this. You will never regret it and always cherish the adventure. (This is a certificate and the ride is to be held in the Twin Cities area.)

 

     

 

PLEDGE $2,500 or more:

You will receive a flight in a World War II T-6 Trainer to be given at the Anoka County Airport in Blaine, Minnesota, by a member of the "T-6 Thunder"  group. The North American Aviation T-6 Texan was a single-engine advanced trainer aircraft used to train pilots of the United States Army Air Forces, United States Navy, Royal Air Force and other air forces of the British Commonwealth during World War II and into the 1950s. The rider will also receive an autographed 8X10 photo of aircraft. (Please contact us regarding age and physical requirements.)

   

 

 

PLEDGE of $5,000 or More:

You will receive a full membership in our VIP Prop Club that includes incredible benefits in the Gift Shop and Restaurant, along with your name inscribed on a propeller mounted in the entrance.You will also receive complementary entrées for you and three guests in our café.

  1. The Club member's name inscribed on a propeller that will be displayed on the wall of the main entrance to the proposed facility.
  2. A 15% off purchases made by the member at our gift shop or proposed restaurant.
  3. VIP Club Table reservations for the member with a maximum seating of four at our proposed restaurant.
  4. A desk-set prop-shaped letter opener inscribed with “Prop Club Member” on the tray.

 

    

    

PLEDGE of $6,500 or More:

You will receive a full membership in our VIP Prop Club, plus a flight in a World War II T-6 Trainer to be given at the Anoka County Airport in Blaine, Minnesota, by a member of the "T-6 Thunder"  group. (Please contact us regarding age and physical requirements for the T-6 ride. The rider will also receive an autographed 8X10 photo of aircraft.) See Pledge $2,500 and Pledge $5,000 for more details.
