story:
Concept/Idea

We will start the sender.fm "version 2.0" in 3-4 months. Specially for members there are a lot of new features available. We refresh the site completely with a new technic and design.

sender.fm is a costfree online- service, that allows all members to upload selfmade audio- and videofiles, radioshows, podcasts, photos and textfiles. This service is used by more than 2300 people around the world in 2013.

''Listeners/users'' -  can

·  pick and choose their styles of music

·  put together their own playlist & listen to music

·  review the artists and the songs or programs with comments according to their musical tastes.

Only positively valued tracks are played in the main player.

''Members'' – you can make your own profil without advertisement.

Also you can make a link to your private & company websites. It is also possible to link to other social media platforms and html programmers can make their sites personalised.

'In the ' Download area '' – you find tons of music!

Since 2006 musicians can easily upload selfmade musicfiles for free!

2013 are 9300 Tracks available. feel free  to download!

sender.fm is not a dj platform.

sender.fm is a producer platform.

·  You can register privately, as an producer, artist or totally anonymous, set up a separate " profile " ,

·  download music

·  find events

·  make your own player design

·  set up photo categories

·  get to know about other people

·  open discussion forums

·  upload your audios & video files

·  design web radio or tv-shows.

History

sender.fm was founded in December 2005 by the Austrians Heimo Rauter.

Originally it was made to be a commercialfree Multimedia&Communicationplatform.

After four years of further development sender.fm was grown in the summer of 2009 to a remarkable community throughout Europe.

Especially in the electronic music scene,  sender.fm became a reference.

It developed at this time to one of the largest European platforms for electronic music. Sectors are:

Techno, electro, ambient, trance music, experimental music and hardcore techno

These are the ranges of sender.fm.

The number of offered directions of music has been continuously expanded.

The music database grow to considerable 9300 titles until autumn 2013 due to the large number of contributors.

Since autumn 2009, sender.fm created great interest outside of Europe.

The producers and music lovers come to 29% from countries outside of the EU.

About Money

Until Today, all costings are paid by private sponsors and donations.

Streaming

sender.fm offers a web radio channel, which can be listened free of charge and free of advertising.

Registered producers have the option on their server self-produced music through audio streaming on the network to spread around the world.

By a special selection where the rights are assigned.

The following stream bandwidth is offered: 128 kbit MP3 44.1 Khz

Board

Under the menu item " Board " it is possible to open an own thread or take part in ongoing conversations.

It is the ideal place for communication in each direction.

Here are questions to be answered:

Technical problems and offer assistance.

Percentage allocation of listeners and Viewers 2013 are

46 % Austria, 80% of Vienna

25 % EU, 13% of CZ

29 % rest of the world - 1.5 % US

Official Website

http://sender.fm

New App for iPhone & Android

We are not offering private informations to third parties.!!!

story:
Bring the Internet to Kochkor Village, Kyrgyzstan.

The Altyn Kol Handicrafts Cooperative would like to put an internet cafe and cultural heritage museum in their Kyrgyz Village. They need your support.


The Altyn Kol Handicrafts Cooperative consists of about 80 local women who make and sell Shyrdak Felt Rugs (Kyrgyzstan's national art). They have a modest office and shop in their small village which serves as the primary sales outlet for the entire cooperative's production. 

Currently, there is no public way to access the internet in Kochkor Village, and many tourists are interested in both email and traditional Kyrgyz crafts. By building an internet cafe and heritage museum at their local shop, Altyn Kol hopes to attract more foreign visitors and increase their shyrdak sales -- which are a vital source of income for the families of the village. 

Your contributions will fund their cafe and museum startup costs.

Altyn Kol will hand-make each Thank You Gift. They will make felt smartphone cases for $25, laptop and tablet sleeves for $65 and your very own shyrdak rug for $165 and up. All prices include shipping from their village in Kyrgyzstan. See details below.

Kyrgyzstan is a small, extremely-mountainous country bordering western China.

This is what it looks like.

This is who lives there.

This is what they make.

This is how they make it. 


This is how you can make an impact.

(All incentives include shipping from Kyrgyzstan. Please note, you can also opt out of the incentives, and 100% of your end donation amount will go directly to Altyn Kol.)

$8 Donation buys you a Lifetime Unlimited Internet Access Pass to the Altyn Kol Internet Kafe in Kochkor, Kyrgyzstan. Not to mention, your visit will solicit warm smiles, welcome hugs and endless cups of tea.

$25 Donation buys you a felted cell phone case. 

$65 Donation buys you a size-appropriate sleeve for your notebook or pad-type device.

$165 Donation buys you a small, beautiful shyrdak (3' 11" x 2' 4").

$600 Donation buys you a large shyrdak floor rug (8" x 4").

Rugs (and all items) ship directly from Kochkor, Kyrgyzstan.

Pattern and colors customized to suit. Please inquire for other sizes and dimensions; we can make a one-of-a-kind artisan rug that will make your living room look out of this world.

Any Contribution makes you a member of the GlobeIn Impact Team. Receive special Artisan Updates about Altyn Kol and other Kyrgyz artisans, and learn how to impact artisans from around the world.

This is who you're supporting.

-Kafe Kygyyzstan is a kollaborative project between the Altyn Kol Women's Handicrafts Cooperative in Kochkor and GlobeIn's artisan marketplace based in San Francisco. See altyn-kol.com and globein.com.


Project Details

The Altyn Kol Cooperative will place an open-access internet cafe, WiFi hotspot and small, cultural history exhibit in their retail shop.

Kyrgyzstan receives a low, but vital volume of tourists each year. Because Kochkor Village is a staging ground for yurt expeditions into the surrounding mountains and high alpine lakes, proportional to other places in the country, it receives a relatively high number of visitors each year.

Since 1996, Altyn Kol has been collectively selling shyrdak rugs (Kyrgyzstan's national art) for foreign visitors. Typically in village life, family members will emigrate from the village in search of better-paid work; however the extra income through one or two shyrdak sales can offset an entire year's salary, allowing more family members to stay at home to help the family cope with the harshness of day-to-day life in the villages.

Aside from the much-needed income, the selling of shyrdaks also places tangible value on cultural traditions that are threatened by the shiny draw of urbanization and modernization.

The public open-WiFi, internet cafe and crafts museum will provide a place to access the internet and serve as a point of cultural exchange for locals and tourists.

Altyn Kol has been in operation for 17 years (which is 16 years longer than most business in Kyrgyzstan); they are stable, and know what they're doing. Your contribution (large or small) will make a huge impact on the women and families of Kochkor Village. Thank you.

story:
FORCEFIELDS FUNDING


As you will all be aware, Forcefields is a private party that I am hosting on my farm in Kent on 14th September 2013. There's no ticketing, no compulsory donation required, BUT if you are able to contribute a donation, £35 would be the perfect amount to ease, and hopefully remove, the financial burden from myself and my wife in putting on this fine event :)

The key things that the money will be used to pay for ..

Soundsystem

Generator & Fuel

Toilet Provision (luxury toilet block!)

Additional Lighting Costs

Inflatables

Food and BBQ rental (everyone will be fed on Saturday evening and also at Breakfast on Sunday)

Alcohol (there will be an open bar which you will help stock and staff - we will provide some basics to be decided)

Outdoor Lighting


Any surplus cash generated from the event will go into infrastructure improvements for the following year (assuming there is a subsequent event). If there is no subsequent event, we will donate any excess donations to the McMillan Cancer Charity.

Many thanks in advance for being a participant in this exciting little experiement :)

Simon

story:
FERAL is moving to 3936 Tennyson St., the historic Flesher-Hinton building. It's beautiful, it has soul, and it has been an anchor in the neighborhood since the early 1900's. We're creating a world class independent outdoor shop AND preserving a part of the Berkeley neighborhood's history at the same time. 100% of the funds raised from this campaign will go towards build out costs.

As a result of the quick turnaround for this move, and the increased space and overhead, we have a funding gap to make this move happen. As we considered all options, we realized that we've always built FERAL through collaborative engagement with our community. Why would we do this any differently?

We're excited to release the design of the Limited Edition FERAL t-shirt! Only available here, never to be sold in-store. The shirt itself will be our buttery-soft tri-blend shirt that we've always used for our FERAL shirts. You'll want to wear this thing to bed. Hope you love it!

4,400 sq. ft of open air space filled with vintage touches and a design that harkens back to a different era. The building operated as a theater and has been home to several businesses over the past century. Exposed brick walls, an open truss ceiling, a large mezzanine, and just the right amount of space to build a beautiful and thoughtfully-designed shop.

The new store will offer:

  • 5X more retail space than the original FERAL. More brands, more categories, more adventure. No more "sorry, we don't have room for that..."
  • Dedicated rental gear counter. You'll be able to pick up and drop off your rentals quicker than ever in the new shop. 
  • Cottage Industry Lab. We will have a space dedicated to highlighting the industry's up and coming brands. Small batch brands are woefully underrepresented in the chain stores and we want to give you the opportunity to touch and feel homegrown products from the small guys.

  • More events and collaborations. With the increased space we will be hosting more events, classes, and unique partnerships with other Denver-based organizations. More parties!
  • Private community meeting space. The upstairs mezzanine will be available for corporate meetings, birthday parties, and your unique gatherings (*See perk opportunity). Admit it, everyone is tired of traditional conference rooms. 
  • Bringing the neon sign back to life! The Flesher-Hinton neon sign is an iconic feature of the neighborhood. With this move we want to refurbish the sign with our branding and light that baby back up again.
  • Hints and touches of the old FERAL shop. You will find subtle features throughout the space that you will recognize from the original FERAL location.

 

In short, we are a local and independent outdoor gear shop in Denver, CO.

We want to be a hub for adventure junkies of all types in the greatest adventure city in America. Not only because we carry great gear, but because we are building an inclusive and collaborative community that people want to be a part of.

We are quirky. We are irreverent. We are retail renegades. 

Read more about FERAL:

  • People Magazine Feature
  • The Innovation Project - SNEWS
  • 2018 Best Outdoor Startup in the Rockies - Elevation Outdoors
  • 2018 Best Denver Outdoor Gear Store - Westword
  • Best Outdoor Gear Shops in the USA - GearJunkie

 

We're hoping to raise $95,000 to pay for the build out costs. Sure it's a lot, but we're offering big incentives for your support. 

Can I get more than one perk? Yes! Want a lifetime discount, but also want to pick up a shirt and discounted gift card? You can support more than once!

We want to show that locally-grown independent businesses can prosper in Denver. We want to show that we can push back against the corporatization of retail. We want to show that as the buildings on our street get taller, the little guy is still the bedrock of what makes Tennyson St. great. And we can't do this without your support.

Our community has been amazing since Day 1, and now we want to reward your support by building the best damn independent outdoor gear shop in Colorado. We live here, we eat here, we shop here. We are a truly hyper-local company, and this is your opportunity to support one of your own. We started here, and with your support we can make the Berkeley neighborhood our forever home.

The #1 risk is that our crowdfunding campaign falls short. In the event that happens we will explore traditional  funding options. Our preference is to build this project in partnership with our community, but all options will always be explored to ensure FERAL's long-term success.

We have our contractors lined up and ready to go, our design is 95% complete, and we're ready to start swinging hammers. All we need is your support. 

Not everyone can contribute financially, but EVERYONE can help! Here are a few very simple ways that you can give us a big assist.

  • Share on social media! There is a share button at the top of our campaign page. We can't tell you how much your share helps.
  • Word of mouth. Tell someone about us. Even if you hate us. As it turns out, the person you share with just might like us more than you do.
  • Support local in the Berkeley neighborhood. Every business on Tennyson St. is the manifestation of someone's dream to build something for this community. This neighborhood has a tremendous opportunity to be unique, and each local business is an important part of what makes it a beautifully uncommon place to live, work, and play.

story:
My name is Marcel Owino. I was born and raised in Kenya until high school when I left to attend University in the USA. I studied Political Science and Public health and returned to Kenya last year where I now work in healthcare.                                                              

Agrarian

  A Kenyan enterprise run by Kenyans that partners with smallholder farmers to provide both freight and market facilitation of fresh fruits and vegetables.

Figure 1: Roadside fruit market along the Thika highway-approximately 1.5 hours from Nairobi. All the vendors are selling the same exact fruits acquired from nearby farms.

Why Agrarian

  Kenya’s economy is heavily dependent on agriculture. In fact, 75% of Kenyans make their living from farming, producing both for local consumption and for export. Agricultural investments-made mostly by the hundreds of NGOs operating in the country, focus on finding ways to increase crop and animals production. Often times, this approach proves unsustainable because farmers become dependent on service providers- usually NGOs using short-term project funding. Short-term success in raising production without complementary support to transport produce to major markets can result in oversupplying local markets, which translates into reduced income for farmers.

  Agrarian is Kenyan enterprise run by Kenyans that partners with smallholder farmers to provide both freight and market facilitation of fresh fruits and vegetables. Specifically, Agrarian deals in postharvest handling, transportation, and selling of fresh fruits and vegetables from smallholder rural farmers to nearby cities. By organizing farmers into cooperatives, Agrarian ensures an easy and reliable transport system that allows for consistent year round delivery in larger volumes. In doing this, Agrarian creates competitive, sustainable services that enrich farmer’s lives while providing fresh fruits and vegetables to consumers at competitive prices.

Figure 2: Tomatoes and onions seller along the Mombasa/Nairobi highway-approx. 2 hours from Nairobi city. Onions in the big bags in the back are awaiting transport/sale to Nairobi. The rest have to be sold individually to motorists.

 Why Now

  I often wondered why roadside vendors in different parts of Kenya sold similar farm produce. It turns out that while smallholder farmers can get access to training that helps improve production, finding access to major markets still remains out of their reach due to the lack of affordable transportation. High transportation cost is usually attributed to poor road conditions. Oversupply coupled with produce perishability forces farmers to sell their produce at below market rates.

 However, Kenya has recently experienced an expansive road rehabilitation program that has brought many dilapidated rural roads to maintainable standards. As a result, it has become increasingly affordable to transport farm produce from rural areas to cities around the country. Moreover, there is a steady, albeit underreported, growth of the middle class in Kenyan cities with a much higher purchasing power. All these factors translate into numerous opportunities for self-sustainability and income generation, which could easily be replicated across the country.

Figure 3: Farmers rushing cars on highway 104 to try and sell freshly harvested carrots and tomatoes from farms just along the highway. Because all the farmers are selling the same perishable product, motorists often buy at below market rates.

Figure 4: All six vendors are trying to sell bananas to one motorist.

Vision

Realize an efficient and reliable transport system that allows smallholder farmers to easily deliver larger volumes of fresh produce to cities around the country.

Goals

·  Create competitive, sustainable transport services that enrich farmers lives

·  Provide fresh fruits and vegetables to consumers at competitive prices.

How Agrarian Works

Partnerships

It would be great if small-scale farmers didn’t have to think of transportation and marketing of their perishable products after having grown and harvested them. Agrarian organizes small-scale farmers into cooperatives for the purpose of transporting their produce in bulk to major markets. By working as one unit, farmers gain a better bargaining power and are also able to transport their produce affordably.

Transport Coordination

Agrarian will develop a map of convenient transportation corridors throughout the country. Standardized pickup points designed to minimize cost of produce transportation will be established. Farmers will then form or utilize existing cooperatives to pool together their produce for greater efficiency during transportation.

Three-pronged approach

Agrarian is the only transport/delivery system in Kenya with a three-pronged approach of providing produce in the cities. These include:

o  Transport/hauling produce to major open air markets

o  Transport to green grocers and hotels around the cities

o  Transport/delivery to individual homes and restaurants in the cities

Why is Agrarian Unique?

Currently, most smallholder farmers who manage to transport their produce to the cities usually have to go through middlemen. The burden of perishability constrains farmers; they often have to sell their produce at below market rate just so they can get some return out of their investment. Agrarian bypasses middlemen and deals directly with farmers through cooperatives. This system ensures that farmers enjoy higher prices through collective bargaining while consumers get fresher produce at competitive prices.

Moreover, with its three-pronged approach, Agrarian ensures that fresh produce is not only limited to upmarket neighborhoods in the cities. With its low cost approach, Agrarian can easily haul fresh produce to lower income neighborhoods and sell them directly from the trucks.

Agrarian is not a charity

  Despite decades of foreign aid, poverty levels in Kenya continue to escalate and millions of people continue to suffer. We believe in the need to assume full control of the many economic opportunities available to help improve the quality of life for Kenyan people. We believe that providing transport and market facilitation for smallholder farmers will lead to job creation, enhanced socio-economic stability, and greater purchasing power, which buys necessities like quality education and healthcare.

Agrarian is specifically tailored for small-scale Kenyan farmers

  Agrarian will handle all postharvest handling, transportation, and distribution of fresh fruits and vegetables therefore allaying the risk factor that farmers would otherwise have to endure. By organizing farmers into cooperatives, Agrarian will ensure an easy and reliable transport system that allows for consistent year round delivery in larger volumes.

We need your help

Agrarian cannot happen without you. Please help us launch this program that will help small-scale farmers transport their produce to larger markets in an efficient and affordable way. The cooperative steered efficiency and low cost transport models will allow Agrarian to eventually become self-sufficient.

Share our campaign

  Tell your friends. Please share this campaign with your friends through email.

Become a partner

  If you have any special skills related to this campaign that you think you can contribute, please get in touch with us. We would love to have you on our team.

  For more information about Agrarian, please contact marcandrew199@gmail.com

Tipping Point Goal: $15,000

Total Funding Goal: $50,000

Tipping Point Goal: $15,000

If we raise our minimum goal of  $15,000 we will be able to officially launch our operations by the end of June this year. Specifically, the $15,000 will pay for a down payment on a midsize truck and salary for the truck driver for the first six months.

Total Funding Goal: $50,000

If we raise our ultimate goal of $50,000 then we will be able to cover all of our expenses. These expenses include:

·  Total cost for a midsize truck

·  Driver salary

·  Insurance

·  Business registration fees

·  Training workshops on farming cooperatives.

For a more comprehensive budget, please email us at marcandrew199@gmail.com

What if we raise more than $50,000?

Any additional funds raised will go into expanding Agrarians operations past the beginning stage. This will include buying more trucks and hiring more drivers. Agrarian has the potential to make a huge impact on the lives of smallholder farmers around Kenya. Please stay tuned and we will keep you updated on what is happening on the ground.
story_txt:
My name is Marcel Owino. I was born and raised in Kenya until high school when I left to attend University in the USA. I studied Political Science and Public health and returned to Kenya last year where I now work in healthcare.                                                              Agrarian
  A Kenyan enterprise
run by Kenyans that partners with smallholder farmers to provide both freight
and market facilitation of fresh fruits and vegetables.

Figure 1: Roadside fruit market
along the Thika highway-approximately 1.5 hours from Nairobi. All the vendors
are selling the same exact fruits acquired from nearby farms.


Why
Agrarian
  Kenya’s
economy is heavily dependent on agriculture. In fact, 75% of Kenyans make their
living from farming, producing both for local consumption and for export. Agricultural
investments-made mostly by the hundreds of NGOs operating in the country, focus
on finding ways to increase crop and animals production. Often times, this
approach proves unsustainable because farmers become dependent on service providers-
usually NGOs using short-term project funding. Short-term success in raising
production without complementary support to transport produce to major markets
can result in oversupplying local markets, which translates into reduced income
for farmers.
  Agrarian is
Kenyan enterprise run by Kenyans that partners with smallholder farmers to
provide both freight and market facilitation of fresh fruits and vegetables.
Specifically, Agrarian deals in postharvest handling, transportation, and
selling of fresh fruits and vegetables from smallholder rural farmers to nearby
cities. By organizing farmers into cooperatives, Agrarian ensures an easy and
reliable transport system that allows for consistent year round delivery in
larger volumes. In doing this, Agrarian creates competitive, sustainable
services that enrich farmer’s lives while providing fresh fruits and vegetables
to consumers at competitive prices.


Figure 2: Tomatoes and onions seller
along the Mombasa/Nairobi highway-approx. 2 hours from Nairobi city. Onions in the big bags in the back are awaiting transport/sale to Nairobi. The rest have to be sold individually to motorists. Why
Now
  I often
wondered why roadside vendors in different parts of Kenya sold similar farm produce.
It turns out that while smallholder farmers can get access to training that
helps improve production, finding access to major markets still remains out of
their reach due to the lack of affordable transportation. High transportation
cost is usually attributed to poor road conditions. Oversupply coupled with
produce perishability forces farmers to sell their produce at below market
rates.
 However, Kenya has
recently experienced an expansive road rehabilitation program that has brought
many dilapidated rural roads to maintainable standards. As a result, it has
become increasingly affordable to transport farm produce from rural areas to
cities around the country. Moreover, there is a steady, albeit underreported,
growth of the middle class in Kenyan cities with a much higher purchasing
power. All these factors translate into numerous opportunities for
self-sustainability and income generation, which could easily be replicated
across the country.
Figure 3: Farmers rushing cars on highway 104 to try
and sell freshly harvested carrots and tomatoes from farms just along the highway. Because
all the farmers are selling the same perishable product, motorists often buy at
below market rates.Figure 4: All six vendors are trying to sell bananas to one motorist.Vision
Realize an efficient and reliable transport system that
allows smallholder farmers to easily deliver larger volumes of fresh produce to
cities around the country.


Goals
· 
Create competitive, sustainable
transport services that enrich farmers lives
· 
Provide fresh fruits and vegetables to
consumers at competitive prices.
How
Agrarian Works

Partnerships
It would be great if
small-scale farmers didn’t have to think of transportation and marketing of
their perishable products after having grown and harvested them. Agrarian
organizes small-scale farmers into cooperatives for the purpose of transporting
their produce in bulk to major markets. By working as one unit, farmers gain a
better bargaining power and are also able to transport their produce
affordably. 
Transport Coordination
Agrarian will develop a map of convenient transportation
corridors throughout the country. Standardized pickup points designed to
minimize cost of produce transportation will be established. Farmers will then
form or utilize existing cooperatives to pool together their produce for
greater efficiency during transportation. 
Three-pronged approach
Agrarian is the only
transport/delivery system in Kenya with a three-pronged approach of providing
produce in the cities. These include:
o  Transport/hauling
produce to major open air markets
o  Transport
to green grocers and hotels around the cities
o  Transport/delivery
to individual homes and restaurants in the cities

Why
is Agrarian Unique?
Currently, most smallholder farmers who
manage to transport their produce to the cities usually have to go through
middlemen. The burden of perishability constrains farmers; they often have to
sell their produce at below market rate just so they can get some return out of
their investment. Agrarian bypasses middlemen and deals directly with farmers
through cooperatives. This system ensures that farmers enjoy higher prices
through collective bargaining while consumers get fresher produce at
competitive prices.
Moreover, with its three-pronged approach, Agrarian ensures
that fresh produce is not only limited to upmarket neighborhoods in the cities.
With its low cost approach, Agrarian can easily haul fresh produce to lower
income neighborhoods and sell them directly from the trucks.
Agrarian
is not a charity
  Despite
decades of foreign aid, poverty levels in Kenya continue to escalate and
millions of people continue to suffer. We believe in the need to assume full
control of the many economic opportunities available to help improve the
quality of life for Kenyan people. We believe that providing transport and
market facilitation for smallholder farmers will lead to job creation, enhanced
socio-economic stability, and greater purchasing power, which buys necessities
like quality education and healthcare.


Agrarian
is specifically tailored for small-scale Kenyan farmers
  Agrarian
will handle all postharvest handling, transportation, and distribution of fresh
fruits and vegetables therefore allaying the risk factor that farmers would
otherwise have to endure. By organizing farmers into cooperatives, Agrarian
will ensure an easy and reliable transport system that allows for consistent
year round delivery in larger volumes.

We
need your help
Agrarian cannot happen without you.
Please help us launch this program that will help small-scale farmers transport
their produce to larger markets in an efficient and affordable way. The
cooperative steered efficiency and low cost transport models will allow
Agrarian to eventually become self-sufficient.
Share
our campaign
  Tell your
friends. Please share this campaign with your friends through email.
Become
a partner
  If you have
any special skills related to this campaign that you think you can contribute,
please get in touch with us. We would love to have you on our team.
  For more
information about Agrarian, please contact marcandrew199@gmail.com

truck driver for the first six months.

Total Funding Goal: $50,000

registration fees

What

story:
The Sunlight Cafe: Our Past, Our Future

In 1976, our little cafe opened in Seattle's Roosevelt neighborhood with a goal of serving tasty vegetarian food to this then sleepy corner of town. From the beginning, the Sunlight was passionate about serving our community nourishing food at reasonable prices and we continue that tradition today as Seattle's longest running vegetarian restaurant. But, we're not immune to change - the building we've been renting for decades will soon be sold and its time for us to be proactive about the next 40 years. We're asking for your help to make that happen.

We are Cheryl Richards and Adrian Noone. We literally grew up at the Sunlight Cafe - Sunday mornings munching on sesame waffles and Tuesday nights slurping down tahini dressing. We took over the business last year from Adrian's parents, Margaret & Joe, who were part of the Sunlight's founding in 1976. 

In March of next year, the Sunlight will move to NE 64th St. and 9th Ave NE - yep, it's just around the corner from our current spot. This new spot is roughly equal in size, inlcuding an outdoor patio, and we'll be customizing the space so it serves our staff better while also feeling warm and familiar to our regulars.

Your contributions will help build the new Sunlight Cafe. Each dollar you give will go straight toward either construction costs or equipment that will keep us grilling, sautéing, and chopping your favorite vegetarian comfort food. Think of it as a taste of old Seattle in the heart of new Seattle.

Thanks for 40 great years - here's to 40 more!

       - Cheryl & Adrian

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $75,000. Yeah, that's a lot of money, though it won't even cover a quarter of our build-out costs. What it will cover is the purchase of some pretty crucial equipment for our new space. Here are just a few of the items the money will go toward:

  • $7,000-10,000 for a new dishwasher
  • $7,000-10,000 for a walk-in cooler
  • $30,000 for a range hood system

Not to mention countertops, sinks, refrigeration, plumbing, electrical, restrooms, &c...

Don't worry, your gift won't leave you empty-handed! To the right you can check out some of the nifty perks we've put together for everyone who donates.

The Impact

We move into our new building in Spring of 2018, and our hope is to hit the ground running (or hit the kitchen cooking...). We love what we do and can't wait to be settled into our new space. We are working with the SBA to secure a small business loan. But building a restaurant is expensive! Construction costs are coming in much higher than we expected - and we are trying to find creative ways to bridge that gap. We could use a little push up this financial mountain. We can't wait until we are over the hump, settled into our new digs, and can focus on the food & people!

The changes we've made over the years haven't changed the essence of who we are. And neither will this move change us at our core. We know how to cook and we know how to hustle - 40 years in the restaurant industry will teach you that. The money we raise won't be wasted; it will go toward nourishing our community one meal at a time

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't give to our campaign? No problem! Here's some ways you can still help:

  • Spread the word about our campaign! The more people who know, the better our chances of reaching our goal! Please share this campaign with your friends and family (especially those with fond memories of the Sunlight).
  • Have a meal with us! We're still open at our current location until March 2018 so there's time to sit, eat, and reminisce before the big move.

story:
CleanShakes

Hi, we are CleanShakes and we make and bottle superfood shakes mixed with almond milk, that nourish so our Shakers can flourish. Our shakes are healthy, packed full of nutrition, clean and free from any nasties; you can really taste the benefits with each mouthful.

CleanShakes is a North East England based business, run by an all female team. This business began as a multitude of ideas but it was our shakers, that helped us refine, redesign, evolve and launch in October 2015.

Our shakes are available to buy across a range of stockists, directly from us or we create pop ups at events and festivals. They have a 72hr shelf life; the innovation of our product stems from working with nutritionists, microbiologists and food scientists, to develop flavour profiles that are not only yummy, top quality, but the  natural properties of the ingredients are used to make the shakes behave in particular ways. The same shake if made at home, would last 2hours.

We love what we do, what we've built so far but this is just the beginning; we want to grow our business further, but we need your help. We don't want to go down the investment route at this stage, we want to grow our business incrementally with our growing community of shakers.

It is our shakers that made us and it will be our shakers that enable us to move forward.

The Campaign

This crowd funding project is asking for £3,000 and is for growth and business model development. This £3,000 will give us a capital injection that we need to over come current barriers that will enable us to pursue our vision; to empower our shakers to make small lifestyle changes with big positive impact, one shake at a time.

The £3000 project can be broken down to-

  • £1250 for website development and design.
  • £500 for IP and trademark registration.
  • £450 for exhibition and events registration across the rest of 2016.
  • £300 for exhibition/trade stand development.
  • £300 for new equipment.
  • £200 for new marketing materials.

The Impact

This project will enable CleanShakes to grow and thrive. CleanShakes supports through our work and growth many other North East Businesses; in fact we only use local suppliers and business services; so an investment in us, is an investment into the North East.

We also promote a healthy version of self and seek to enable, our shakers to become the best versions of themselves, whatever that may be.  We want to push forward a healthy, positive body image, advocating self love. Our shakers are our top priority; every time you invest in us, you invest in yourself.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for reading.

If you wish to purchase a shake directly or to place as order, as opposed to donating  - drop us an email at CleanShakes@outlook.com and we would love to talk more.

Not everyone can contribute and our mission and business, may not strike a cord in you; but if you know someone who it may, then please share this campaign. 

#tastethebenefits

story:
Pitch video: A glimpse of the power of performance from the documentary  film Performing The World 2007 by independent filmmaker Joe Spirito.

On October 10-12, 2014, 450 creative activists from all over the world will come together in New York for the 8th Performing The World (PTW) conference to celebrate and develop the power of performance as a means of individual, community and world transformation. 

We want the conference to be radically inclusive - to make it possible for people from very different disciplines, countries and circumstances to meet - and this is why we need your help. We’ve minimized the costs of the conference, organized hundreds of local New Yorkers to volunteer or to open their doors and offer free housing, and we offer scholarships to pay for the registration fee - but people still need to get here! Your donation will go towards paying airplane tickets for the people who are struggling to get to Performing The World. Please give generously to support their travel to New York City in October!


Giving in a Culture of Getting

In Juarez, Mexico, in the crossfire of the drug cartels, these 7 creative activists are working in NGOs, universities and through their community center to bring performance and development to the people of the city. 2 years ago they managed to raise enough money to get to PTW and according to them, the experience helped them go way beyond what they thought they were capable of. Raising $10,000 through this campaign will allow 8 social innovators like them to travel from Africa, Asia, South America, and other areas to this important conference. Raising $15,000 will allow 12 people to come. Raising $20,000 will allow 16 people to come. And a lot of people are hoping that we will be able to support them.

Right now, creative activists in South America, Asia, and Africa are working hard to raise funds to get to PTW and any donation to this campaign will go towards paying their airplane tickets. Your donation will make a huge difference to them! 


The Impact of Your Donation

A growing number of political and social activists, community and youth organizers, educators and therapists around the globe have been turning to performance as a way of engaging social problems, activating communities, and experimenting with new social and political possibilities. The performance turn is allowing social change activists in all cultures to organize not around a set of ideas, an ideology, but to create, through performance, something new with what exists. Since 2001, PTW has provided a unique opportunity for these practitioners, scholars and activists to share and showcase their work in order to create a better world. Your donation will help activists who are working in the midst of poverty, violence, illiteracy, and environmental disasters to connect with each other and discover the power of community. Join the movement. Change the world. Give your support.


Other Ways You Can Help

1) Spread the word: Tell your friends, family, and colleagues that PTW is happening and ask them to donate and to attend the conference! Go to www.performingtheworld.org to learn more and register for the conference.

2) Donate Frequent Flyer Miles! Use your miles to purchase a ticket for one or more creative activists. Contact mauriciotsalgado (at) gmail.com.

3) Share this on Facebook: Like our facebook page. Invite your friends to our facebook event. Spread the word using the hashtags #ptw14 and #indiegogo. 

4) Share this on Twitter: Follow and retweet @ptwconf. Spread the word using the hashtags #ptw14 and #indiegogo.


What Happens With my Donation?

Your donation on Indiegogo will be processed by FirstGiving and sent to the non-profit East Side Institute who organizes the Performing The World conference. (The Institute is an international educational, training and research center for developing and promoting alternative and radically humanistic approaches in psychology, therapy, education and community building.) When you contribute you will receive an email from FirstGiving, confirming the tax-deductible status of your contribution.


Questions or comments?

Please contact our campaign manager Esben Wilstrup at esbenwi (at) gmail.com who will be happy to respond ;o)

story:
A new kind of daily deal site

FreePlay.com.au is a daily deals site like no other. We offer our subscribers the chance to secure fantastic, genuine products and services for FREE. No tricks. No gimmicks. No catch. Just the products and services you want - for nix!


What really sets FreePlay.com.au apart though is how we use our powers for good. We turn $1 from every user and $50 from every business that joins us into real contributions to those in need.


Our mission is to promote and support local business and the community that supports us and to encourage a culture of Philanthrepreneurship amongst our industry peers.


Help us make a splash!

There's some stiff competition in the daily deals segment but we have a secret weapon - you! (And ninjas. But we'll get to them later)

Your contribution will help pay for radio & TV advertising so we hit the ground running. The key to success here is user numbers. Our target is 50,000 and you're going to help us get there.

But that's just the start. Our long term goal is to compete with behemoths like Groupon, first in Australia and then the rest of the world. And when we get there you can tell everyone you helped make it happen, and have the t-shirt to prove it!


The Impact

Your contributions will help ensure we reach our short term subscription goals and in doing so give us the tools we need to make a real contribution to other peoples lives.

FreePlay aims to build stronger communities not only through donations to at-the-coal-face charities but also through our network of small business partners.

We believe that small business is the backbone of every community and we offer a them a fairer deal by not charging hefty commissions on deals they advertise through our site and encouraging our subscribers to deal directly with the business. This in not only better for the business but creates a more engaging and satisfying experience for the customer.


Dollars and sense

Not everyone can contribute, we get that. But that doesn't mean you're off the hook!

To avoid retribution from our team of highly trained (and colourful!) ninjas head on over our Facebook page and like the *bleep* out of us. 

And if you can share our page or this campaign with your friends and family you might even score a special ninja hug*

DISCLAIMER: Ninja hugs are lightning fast and you may or may not feel them.
story_txt:
A new kind of daily deal siteFreePlay.com.au is a daily deals site like no other. We offer our subscribers the chance to secure fantastic, genuine products and services for FREE. No tricks. No gimmicks. No catch. Just the products and services you want - for nix!What really sets FreePlay.com.au apart though is how we use our powers for good. We turn $1 from every user and $50 from every business that joins us into real contributions to those in need.

Our mission is to promote and support local business and the community that supports us and to encourage a culture of Philanthrepreneurship amongst our industry peers.







Help us make a splash!
There's some stiff competition in the daily deals segment but we have a secret weapon - you! (And ninjas. But we'll get to them later)
Your contribution will help pay for radio & TV advertising so we hit the ground running. The key to success here is user numbers. Our target is 50,000 and you're going to help us get there.
But that's just the start. Our long term goal is to compete with behemoths like Groupon, first in Australia and then the rest of the world. And when we get there you can tell everyone you helped make it happen, and have the t-shirt to prove it!

The Impact
Your contributions will help ensure we reach our short term subscription goals and in doing so give us the tools we need to make a real contribution to other peoples lives.
FreePlay aims to build stronger communities not only through donations to at-the-coal-face charities but also through our network of small business partners.
We believe that small business is the backbone of every community and we offer a them a fairer deal by not charging hefty commissions on deals they advertise through our site and encouraging our subscribers to deal directly with the business. This in not only better for the business but creates a more engaging and satisfying experience for the customer.



Dollars and sense
Not everyone can contribute, we get that. But that doesn't mean you're off the hook!
To avoid retribution from our team of highly trained (and colourful!) ninjas head on over our Facebook page and like the *bleep* out of us. 
And if you can share our page or this campaign with your friends and family you might even score a special ninja hug*
DISCLAIMER: Ninja hugs are lightning fast and you may or may not feel them.

story:
Need to Connect Mattru Jong to Digital Economy

It is now evident that developing countries which invest in broadband infrastructure see dramatic results. Broadband is not only about economic gain.  A number of studies have shown how internet connectivity can improve lives in various other ways, such as enhancing health and education services, creating enhanced government services, and increasing productivity.  Mattru Jong is a typical town in Sierra Leone.  It has a population of ~ 10K and is facing the most vexing problems of illiteracy and youth unemployment.  The town does not have high-speed broadband access and there are no imminent plans to invest in a reliable internet infrastructure in the near future. Without a new out-of-the-box initiative that infuses new skills and ideas into the community, Mattru Jong, along with similar towns in Sierra Leone, will continue to face a bleak future

Objective of the Crowdfunding Campaign

  • The long-term objective is to implement a holistic ICT program in Mattru Jong, including Broadband access for the hospital, vocational schools, and high schools as well as an internet café for the broader population.  Per a comprehensive business plan, an ICT program will require an investment of $200K over a period of 2 - 3 years.

  • To prove the business case of a project of this size, AYM has decided to establish a smaller Computer Center as a pilot.  The Computer Center will provide basic computer training and education for Mattru Jong’s youth and teachers in preparation for the larger project.

  • The objective of the Crowdfunding Campaign is to raise $20,000 to establish the Computer Center.  The Computer Center project will be modeled after proven World Youth Empowerment Foundation projects.

What this $20,000 will be used for?

  • 10 new entry level computers and 1 printer preloaded with software including shipping to Mattru Jong.  We expect that AYM will qualify for Microsoft’s software program for nonprofits through TechSoup.

  • 1 computer technician hired locally in Sierra Leone.  The computer technician will maintain the computers and teach the computer curriculum to students and teachers.

  • Travel and housing for 1 Volunteer for one month to teach the full-time computer technician the proposed computer literacy program.

  • Updated community center security to safeguard the computer equipment.  Bars on windows, locks on doors, securing the computers to the desks. Etc

  • Travel for one AYM employee to kick off the project and re-open the community Center.

  • Local resource to run the Community Center and offer the pre-Ebola services.  Based on pre-Ebola revenues, the expectation is that the services provided will generate revenue of $25K and sufficient funds to fund the ongoing operations of the Computer Center after the first year.

    During the first year of operations we expect to:


  • Provide basic computer training to  > 3000 students and teachers

  • Educate > 500 farmers on mobile applications

The Existing Community Center Provides the Foundation


The Mattru Jong Community Center was established in 2013 but had to close in 2014 due to the Ebola crisis.  Prior to closing, the Community Center generated revenues of $200 per day from charging cell phones, selling clean water, the snack bar, and the movie theater.  The second floor of the Community Center was not fully utilized and provides a large training room with space for 20 – 25 computers.  In addition to the available training room, the Community Center has available:

  • Solar power and electric installations

  • Electrical generator

  • Cell phone charging facilities

  • Secure storage room

  • Ample ventilation

As a result, the existing Community Center provides an excellent foundation for the Computer Center.


Volunteer Activities to Support the Computer Center Project

The AYM staff and UN volunteers will provide the following services to support the Computer Center:

  • Curriculum Development:  Computer training curriculum to deliver sound and qualitative computer literacy education to the Mattru Jong’s youths. Taking into consideration the needs of the target groups including age, literacy, culture, religion and socio-economic background.  The team will fully take advantage of existing resources and programs that are available.

  • News Letters:  Information service such as; weather updates for the farmers and fishermen as well as market prices for their products, health notices and healthcare advice for pregnant mothers as well and news updates. The team will also explore offering training for 2g mobile applications such as iCow and Farmerconnect

  • Project Monitoring, Oversight and Development: A project monitoring, evaluation to report the overall effectiveness of the computer project (equipment and people) over time. 

Risks & Challenges

How we will address:

  • Hire a local qualified IT professional willing to move to Mattru Jong

  • Targeting recent IT graduates from universities in Sierra Leone, ideally from the region

  • Budgeted to offer a competitive rate

  • Backup plan, to use volunteers from US, Canada or Europe for 3-month assignments

  • Not successful raising $20K to fund the pilot

  • Targeting to complement crowdfunding with grant applications:  Cisco, US Aid .....

  • Exploring partnerships with the hospital, vocational schools, mining company etc.

  • Scale back project

  • Technical challenges operating the computers on solar and / or diesel generated power.

  • Pre-Ebola proved that computers ran on the grid

  • Check the specifications with existing projects in Sierra Leone prior to purchasing the computers

  • Ebola outbreak, public events that disrupt operations

  • Emergency / security plan

  • Support from Paramount Chief of Mattru Jong and local community

    Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for reading our story.  You can help us raise the money we need:

  • Help spread the word about our campaign to your social media network.
  • Please use the social media tools to spread the word.

We thank you in advance for your help.

story:
Hello and welcome! Thanks for stopping by!!

 Hola! As some of you already know, I've been making boas and costuming performers for over 8 years now. I took the plunge into self employment in 2012 and have had a great time with my burlesque career, now I'm ready to launch my costume business in a serious way, get this thing off the ground and create more incredibly fabulous things for creative people all over the world!! It's been my dream since I was a child to dance, entertain and create costumes...  I'm 2/3 of the way there, now I need a little help, and I'm asking you fabulous creatures to help me make that happen!! And I have some gorgeous things to exchange for your support!! Everyone's a winner!

 

The filthy details.

  As a lot of you know, being self employed in the entertainment industry is not easy. We create, we rehearse, we share our craft and are lucky enough to get paid for doing what we love. Yay! However, when it comes to funding business ventures, the banks are loathe to touch self-employed people in such a precarious industry. Working part time and maintaining a career in the arts is hard, especially when the only things you've ever done (retail and bar work) require working weekends. I'm looking to raise £500 to pay for web space, hosting, product shots and of course the fabric in order to make up my samples. I've been making boas for the burlesque, drag and Rocky Horror communities for over 8 years now and would love to have the chance to expand my business into a professional entity which is ready to take over the very world with ruffly, spangly gorgeousness! YOU can help make my dream a reality!!

 

How you can help!!

Well, I have lots of things to sell and make for you!! If you ever wanted to own one of my boas, now is the chance!! I'm doing some special offers on Princess and Queen size boas, as well as taking general donations to my fund. I have everything in place.....web designer, photographer, models, designs, I just need the bunce to make it all happen. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You might not want a boa!! You might not know someone who you'd like to buy one for as a gift!! You might just be a super awesome person who wants to invest in an independant businesswoman who is eager to kickstart a long-running, well researched, fabulous business! There is the option of simply chucking a few quid in the pot if you're feeling kind!

You can find my work on Facebook at www.facebook.com/bruisevioletboas and find more pictures, testimonies and get a flavour of the quirky, unique costume pieces that I am lucky enough to make. Please feel free to share my page, give it a like, tell your friends!! Above all THANK YOU for coming to look at my project!!!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Harmony Knight, the creator and owner of ILoveMyFro, a natural hair care products and resource designed to inspire, educate and support women with natural hair. My Shea Butter Whips and Black Tea Leave-In Treatment are a favorite among many women in the natural hair community.

My 21 years of administrative and customer service experience obtained with working for companies such as, Citigroup, OpenLink Financial, The City of New York and MaGraw Hill Publishing company, along with my love and passion for natural hair prepared and inspired me to start ILoveMyFro.com in 2009.

Since 2011 I've been hosting annual summer events that celebrate as well as inspire women who are not yet comfortable with wearing their natural hair. I understand that for some naturals, the natural hair phenomena is just about hair, but for others, it's about finally looking in the mirror, and for the first time loving, appreciating and accepting themselves for who they naturally are!  

This campaign will enable me to take ILoveMyFro to a new level by purchasing supplies on a much larger scale to create bigger quantities of ILoveMyFro hair products in full and samples sizes for trade shows and subscription beauty boxes.

Your contribution will help me promote my business on a much larger scale so I can fulfill my long term goal by opening up the ILoveMyFro boutique in NYC. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Good ingredients and advertising are expensive!  I've done my research and have made the decision not to use a manufacturing plant to produce  my products as they use "watered" down ingredients and lots of chemicals.  I want to keep the ILoveMyFro brand personal and genuine all the while providing quality hair products.
  • For your contribution you will receive a personal thank you on my Facebook and Instagram page as well as a 2oz ILoveMyFro Shea Butter Whip in the scent of your choice. 
  • If the goal is not reached your support will still be greatly appreciated as ingredients and supplies will still be purchased to run ILoveMyFro as usual. 

The Impact

I  understand that for some naturals the natural hair phenomena is just about hair, but for others, it's about finally looking in the mirror, and for the first time loving, appreciating and accepting themselves naturally!  But we must not forget that here are many women who still need encouragement, one on one consulting, inexpensive products along with quality ingredients to help them on their natural hair journey.   Speaking and consulting with women personally is what I do and with your help I can continue to take ILoveMyFro to the next level without losing the personal touch.  

  • Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially you can still help by sharing this campaign with friends and family. Thanks for the love and support!

story:
*UPDATE 11/19/13*

Our campaign has now ended, and after eight days of fundraising, we were able to raise $16,276! Your support has been incredible, please stay tuned for more updates as we continue to distribute goods in Northern Cebu. Thank you so much for your contributions, they mean so much to the victims of Typhoon Haiyan. 

*UPDATE 11/12/13*

We are so overwhelmed with the support you have shown over the past few hours. Even though we've hit our goal, we are going to keep going! We assure you that every single last cent we receive in excess of our goal will continue to go towards this cause. Thank you so much!

Hi Everyone! 

We are Isabel, Adela, and Chiara, three Filipinos who have recently come home after studying abroad. While we were away at school, it was easy for us to feel disconnected from the Philippines especially in times of tragedy and in the wake of disaster. We wanted to find a way to minimize the divide between Filipinos abroad and kababayans back in the Philippines. connect.PH is an effort to bridge the gap, and a way for those who are abroad to directly contribute to relief efforts in the wake of disasters.

Super Typhoon Haiyan recently ravaged the Philippines. One of the strongest storms ever recorded, it destroyed many towns and cities in its wake. The ferocity of the winds even damaged buildings made of concrete. Thousands of people do not have access to clean water and electricity, and food supplies are scarce. Hospitals are full beyond capacity with medicines running low, making the spread of disease a real threat. With your help, we can provide some relief for the victims of this tragedy.

I currently live in Cebu City, close to the most devastated communities. While many individuals and organizations are sending aid across the affected areas, it is not enough. There are still many people in need of assistance.

Our goal is to raise at least $1,000 for the victims of Typhoon Haiyan. All proceeds from this campaign will go to directly toward relief efforts in Northern Cebu. The money will be used to buy rice, canned goods, potable water, medicine, and clothes. The goods from this campaign will be distributed to people in Northern Cebu by the 22nd of November.

A little goes a long way, below are some examples of what your money could buy.

$1: 12 fever and pain relieving pills

$3: 1 complete Aid Kit, which includes 2 kg of rice, 3 packs of instant noodles, and 2 cans of sardines

$5: 9 bottles of drinking water

$10: 5 shirts or 7 pairs of slippers

Every cent counts, and if we do not reach our goal, we will still use the funds to buy as much as we can for the people affected by the Typhoon.

If you cannot donate, we would appreciate it if you could help us get the word out about our campaign!

I will constantly update this page to keep you informed of our progress. You may reach me at isabel.binamira@gmail.com if you have any further questions.

Maraming at daghan salamat!

Isabel, Adela, and Chiara
