story:
*********************************

HEY RACERS:

Want your entry fee paid for a race weekend?! Of course you do.

If the Save The Lazer campaign makes it to 50% of its goal (that's $10,000), anyone who donated $10 or more will be entered in a drawing to have their fees paid for a race weekend in the SCCA, NASA, VARA, or similar racing organization!

Contribute $50 or more and your name will go in the drawing 8 TIMES!!!

*********************************

 

            

My name is Barret Hendricks, and it has been my lifelong dream to start my own racing business. To achieve this dream, I saved up money for years and recently bought all the tooling necessary to build the Lazer Formula Vee racecar. Unfortunately, a short time after I bought everything I needed, a couple of thieves stole all of the Lazer parts and tools.

 

  

 

I am now trying to raise funds to help rebuild and replace everything that was stolen, saving both my own dreams and a valuable part of Formula Vee history from destruction.

I invite you to be a part of this - both the fundraising campaign and the Lazer history itself. Please contribute today and help spread the word by sharing this campaign with your friends.

 

 

 

Why is this important?

It is obviously important to me because buying the Lazer project was the biggest risk I have ever taken, and I now stand to lose everything.

But this is also important to the Formula Vee community because the Lazer has such a proud 30-year history in the class. The Lazer is raced successfully by drivers around the country and holds many records. Several people have contacted me in need of various parts for their Lazers and I haven’t been able to help them. Since I am the sole owner to the rights of the Lazer Formula Vee, I am the only person who can build one. This means that these thieves could be the end of the Lazer’s history and cause for the Formula Vee class losing one of its best cars.

 

Why do I want to be a racecar builder?

After years of working with cars and studying Mechanical Engineering, I believe I would have a great deal to offer as a builder and could bring fresh new ideas and innovations to the class.

Being a builder would put me in a great position to promote the Formula Vee class. Formula Vee really gave me direction in life, and I would like to share that experience with younger drivers and recruit new talent into the Formula Vee class and Engineering field.

 

Why Formula Vee?

         

The reason I first started driving a Formula Vee 10 years ago was the cost. Formula Vee is a relatively inexpensive form of racing, which makes it a great class for those just starting in racing, those in school, those on a budget, or, well...anyone!

The reason that I have stayed in Formula Vee is the great sense of community within the class. The competition is amazing and, while the other drivers never make it easy to win, everyone ultimately just wants to see you succeed, and they’d do anything to help.

Formula Vee is the friendliest group of people I know, and I think it’s the greatest racing class in the world.

 

Why the Lazer?

Not to be shallow, but many people say that the Lazer is the best looking Formula Vee on the market.

That’s important to me because I’m an engineer and not a designer, so my expertise is optimizing the performance of systems and not their appearance. Having a nice, aesthetically pleasing foundation is a good start for me. It also makes the Lazer appealing to young and novice drivers, meaning I could use it to promote the class and recruit new drivers.

However, the Lazer definitely is NOT all about looks. Attention has been paid to every aspect of the car, resulting in an all-around great car that holds many records and can win on any track. The Lazer is an aerodynamic, great handling, easily serviceable, and ergonomically-designed purpose-built racecar... put simply, the Lazer is functional and beautiful!

 

What are my plans for the future?

Luckily I still have the drawings for all of the Lazer’s components. I’ve been in contact with various suppliers and fabricators and am absolutely certain that rebuilding will be possible, but I can't do it alone! Especially not on a student's salary while I finish my Masters program. This $20,000 will allow me to begin rebuilding the jigs and molds necessary for building the chassis, suspension, and body components of the Lazer Formula Vee and save a piece of racing history.

And that’s why I’m hoping that the kindness of others will help me raise funds on Indiegogo and fulfill my lifelong dream. 

I only have a limited time to raise these funds, so please help me and the Formula Vee community by contributing today and spread the word by sharing this campaign with your friends.

Thanks - and see you at the track.
story_txt:
*********************************
HEY RACERS:
Want your entry fee paid for a race weekend?! Of course you do.
If the Save The Lazer campaign makes it to 50% of its goal (that's $10,000), anyone who donated $10 or more will be entered in a drawing to have their fees paid for a race weekend in the SCCA, NASA, VARA, or similar racing organization!
Contribute $50 or more and your name will go in the drawing 8 TIMES!!!
*********************************
 
             
My name is Barret Hendricks, and it has been my lifelong dream to start my own racing business. To achieve this dream, I saved up money for years and recently bought all the tooling necessary to build the Lazer Formula Vee racecar. Unfortunately, a short time after I bought everything I needed, a couple of thieves stole all of the Lazer parts and tools.

 
  
 
I am now trying to raise funds to help rebuild and replace everything that was stolen, saving both my own dreams and a valuable part of Formula Vee history from destruction.
I invite you to be a part of this - both the fundraising campaign and the Lazer history itself. Please contribute today and help spread the word by sharing this campaign with your friends.
 

 
 
Why is this important?
It is obviously important to me because buying the Lazer project was the biggest risk I have ever taken, and I now stand to lose everything.
But this is also important to the Formula Vee community because the Lazer has such a proud 30-year history in the class. The Lazer is raced successfully by drivers around the country and holds many records. Several people have contacted me in need of various parts for their Lazers and I haven’t been able to help them. Since I am the sole owner to the rights of the Lazer Formula Vee, I am the only person who can build one. This means that these thieves could be the end of the Lazer’s history and cause for the Formula Vee class losing one of its best cars.
 
Why do I want to be a racecar builder?
After years of working with cars and studying Mechanical Engineering, I believe I would have a great deal to offer as a builder and could bring fresh new ideas and innovations to the class.
Being a builder would put me in a great position to promote the Formula Vee class. Formula Vee really gave me direction in life, and I would like to share that experience with younger drivers and recruit new talent into the Formula Vee class and Engineering field.
 
Why Formula Vee?

          


The reason I first started driving a Formula Vee 10 years ago was the cost. Formula Vee is a relatively inexpensive form of racing, which makes it a great class for those just starting in racing, those in school, those on a budget, or, well...anyone!
The reason that I have stayed in Formula Vee is the great sense of community within the class. The competition is amazing and, while the other drivers never make it easy to win, everyone ultimately just wants to see you succeed, and they’d do anything to help.
Formula Vee is the friendliest group of people I know, and I think it’s the greatest racing class in the world.
 
Why the Lazer?




Not to be shallow, but many people say that the Lazer is the best looking Formula Vee on the market.
That’s important to me because I’m an engineer and not a designer, so my expertise is optimizing the performance of systems and not their appearance. Having a nice, aesthetically pleasing foundation is a good start for me. It also makes the Lazer appealing to young and novice drivers, meaning I could use it to promote the class and recruit new drivers.
However, the Lazer definitely is NOT all about looks. Attention has been paid to every aspect of the car, resulting in an all-around great car that holds many records and can win on any track. The Lazer is an aerodynamic, great handling, easily serviceable, and ergonomically-designed purpose-built racecar... put simply, the Lazer is functional and beautiful!


 

What are my plans for the future?
Luckily I still have the drawings for all of the Lazer’s components. I’ve been in contact with various suppliers and fabricators and am absolutely certain that rebuilding will be possible, but I can't do it alone! Especially not on a student's salary while I finish my Masters program. This $20,000 will allow me to begin rebuilding the jigs and molds necessary for building the chassis, suspension, and body components of the Lazer Formula Vee and save a piece of racing history.
And that’s why I’m hoping that the kindness of others will help me raise funds on Indiegogo and fulfill my lifelong dream. 
I only have a limited time to raise these funds, so please help me and the Formula Vee community by contributing today and spread the word by sharing this campaign with your friends.
Thanks - and see you at the track.

story:
Short Summary:

According to CNN the “U.S. jails its people at a rate 7 to 10 times higher than any other developed nation.” In fact, we house 1/4th of the world’s prisoners. My name is Barbara Rhode. I have been a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist for more than 20  years & I started the Red Tent Women’s Initiative (Red Tent) at the Pinellas County Jail in St. Petersburg, Florida in  October of 2012.Our mission is to improve the lives of women, benefiting their families and communities through mentoring opportunities, financial empowerment and the social bonding that is the natural result of creating marketable crafts together in an atmosphere of trust and encouragement.

About 10 years ago, I was asked to assist the staff in a local work release/court ordered drug treatment facility challenged by  the sudden increase in the number of female inmates. I ended up working there for 5 years; teaching life-skills, providing staff trainings and completing mental health assessments for the inmates. It was apparent that many of the women I met with showed signs of Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) & most of them were mothers. National statistics report that approximately 3.5% of the general population has PTSD. I started administering PTSD surveys to the clients & I was shocked to see that 65% of the women in the work release center qualified for it. Most of them had never been treated & their symptoms contributed to the downward cycle that landed them in jail in the first place. 10 million children in this country have a mom or dad who is behind bars. 10 million children living through the traumatic pain of parental separation & oftentimes, having been tiny witnesses to their parent’s vicious cycle of substance abuse & incarceration.

 75% of the women incarcerated in jail or prison today have had to leave behind young children once sentenced and many of them have lost their parental rights. Statistics show that 65-75% of their children will also be incarcerated someday. Upon release, these women have to beat almost insurmountable odds in order to provide food and shelter for their families or begin the battle to regain custody of their children. I am convinced that this vicious cycle directly affects all of us; our communities are weakened as family bonds are broken instead of healed and ex-offenders are left feeling forced to return to their self-destructive lifestyle when door after door closes to them.

For the past 10 months, Red Tent has served more than 130 women in the Pinellas County Jail by creating a safe, nurturing space  every Thursday & Friday where women create meaningful art while attending workshops on important life skills such as anger management, codependency, addiction prevention & mindfulness training. Under the guidance of a fabric artist & classroom counselor, our participants learn valuable, life changing skills while creating crafts such as pillow shams & prayer flags that are up-cycled from reclaimed jeans, tablecloths or other donations. Many of the women tell us that Red Tent is the only program they signed up for while in jail. Our class is one of the most popular programs for women at the jail & we have a long waiting list to prove it.  

It is estimated that almost 50% of ex-offenders return to jail within the first 3 months of release. Of the 130 women Red Tent has served to date; less than 10% have been rearrested. We are having a lot of success in our program at the jail but we need your help to continue and build on these efforts. Red Tent is not a charity. Our goal, with your help, is to grow into a profit making business. Together, we will teach the women to take pride in the work created by their two hands & make an honest profit from their labors instead of depending on others for charitable handouts.

What We Need and What You Get

I pay for all the costs of the Red Tent classes at the jail out of my own pocket. I really believe in this program and continually see the powerful effect it has had on so many of the women who have participated. I want to continue providing these services at the jail but I need your help. My original intent was that we would be a self-sustaining business, selling the crafts the women create at local farmers’ markets and through our website with 100% of the profits benefiting the women. I now understand that it will take us more time to create a system that generates enough funds for us to continue and even allows us to expand our services without relying on donations and competing for charitable contributions.  

 

It will take a minimum of $ 17,700  to continue classes at the jail for another year. This will pay for the teacher, a classroom assistant/counselor, a very small part of the administrative costs and also allow us to buy some supplies that don’t typically get donated. I cannot afford to continue to pay all of the expenses myself. I believe Red Tent is a concept that deserves an opportunity to blossom into a self-sustaining business but I need your help in order to accomplish what we have set out to do.

 

Budget

Salaries – Teacher & Assistant                                     $15,000 

                  Administrative Assistant                             $ 2,000 

Supplies –                                                                 $    700

                                                        Total Requested Amount - $17,700

Perks:

Thank you very much for believing in us & becoming a Red Tent supporter. We will list each of our donations on our website and Facebook page as our way of showing our appreciation, no matter how big or small. You are all important to us & we are very grateful for your support.

Whatever funds we do receive will be used to pay for more classes at the jail. If we do not receive the full funding that we are requesting, we will use any & all the money that is donated to provide these services for as long as we can. We are grateful for whatever you can do to help us continue to reach these women. I promise that we will do our best with what we are given.

Impact:

There are approximately 3,000 inmates in the Pinellas County Jail & it costs taxpayers about $105 per day to house & feed each of them. That’s $315,000 per day. It costs $10 per day for a Red Tent participant to attend our program. If 54% of the inmates released end up returning to jail within 3 months, approximately 70 of our participants would have been back behind bars if Red Tent was not providing services. ***Less than 10% of the 130 women we have served so far have been rearrested. That means we have saved this county over $5,985 per day in recidivism costs.

Pinellas County Jail is just 1 jail in 1 city but this same story is told over and over again, all over the country. By refusing to break apart this vicious cycle by providing ex-offenders viable options in order to become contributing members of society, we spend countless dollars that could have been used on more important things like our children’s education or healthcare services. By sitting by & refusing to look at this problem & become part of the solution, we are creating a third world country right here in the US. In the upcoming year, with your help, Red Tent can become a self-sufficient, successful business that could be a model for other jails in other cities.

While  working with the work release program, I had an opportunity to read "The Tending Instinct," by Dr. Shellye Taylor which describes a socializing pattern of behavior in women that "From an evolutionary standpoint ...is a plausible account of female responses to stress." In her book, Dr. Taylor states that as social animals, women produce increased levels of oxytocin, a brain chemical that helps them feel safe & secure, from spending time in the company of other women. Tending & befriending includes the act of coming together to share stories, offer help, empathize & create mentoring relationships. Dr. Taylor goes on to build the case that women are hardwired to need to connect with each other and  require ample opportunities to express and satisfy this instinctual urge.

Years of private practice have  shown me that modern society actually inhibits tending & befriending through its obsession with safety, addiction to technology, competitive spirit and independent, individual lifestyles. Men & women live, often isolated, behind locked doors raising children who grow up feeling the fear and feeling alone.

A few years later, someone suggested that I read Anita Daimant's novel, "The Red Tent." By then, I had incorporated Dr. Taylor's information into my workshops; teaching others that the need women often feel to talk through problems with loved ones or professionals was instinctual & that satisfying this urge would ultimately benefit families and communities. Reading “The Red Tent” reinforced my belief that something needed to be done; preferably a grassroots effort to encourage and empower women to schedule in time spent in the company of other women. Daimant’s story, which is set during Biblical times, described a red tent where women could stay when ill, depressed, alone, grieving or afraid; a place where young & old  could share stories, wisdom and compassion. Where is our red tent now?  What happened to a tradition that benefitted men, women & children and brought about a sense of community & togetherness?

Last year, this urge to start a red tent became more real for me.  Within minutes after walking into a neighbor’s house for an estate sale, I realized that something felt very odd; as if the owner of all this stuff had left one morning and never returned.  I asked another neighbor also shopping there if he knew the story behind this strange sale. He whispered that the woman who had lived there had killed herself recently & that her daughter was sitting by the front door, managing the sale. It looked as if everything  of hers was for sale; the comb that still had some of her hair in it, her worn-out, well-loved teapot & even a 1/2 bottle of her favorite perfume. I decided to leave but for some reason, I took a walk through her bedroom, maybe to try to get a better understanding of who she had been and why she had taken her own life. There on her nightstand was a copy of "The Red Tent."

Her book now sits on my office shelf; reminding me that this woman might have made a different choice if there had been a red tent to go to when the world closed in on her. Since that day, I have worked to provide women with a place to come together; my own small attempt at creating a red tent where women can reach out for help, share stories and mentor the young & in need. A safe place where women can come together to tend & befriend.

The class we currently provide at the jail is the first step in creating a Red Tent space for women in this area. I chose to reach out first to incarcerated women after watching the challenges they & their children face on a daily basis. Florida is #2 on the list of unchecked prisoner population growth. The women who graduate out of our classes are keeping in touch with us & many of them attend the Monday support group I offer in my private practice office. We hear over & over again that Red Tent made it possible for them to make better, wiser choices after release; just knowing that there are people in the community that care for many has been enough to keep them out of jail.

With your help, we will be able to continue providing classes at the jail 2 days per week while we focus on establishing a community drop in center for any woman, not just ex-offenders, to participate in. Please help us make a difference. Their stories & challenges affect all of us, even when you pretend not to notice them. They are your neighbors, your sisters, your daughters & you…..

“Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." - Margaret Mead

story:
Short Summary

BIG NEWS BONUS- Starting 4/18/2014 all donations over $100 will receive a FREE 1 day pass for the California Audio Show held in San Francisco August 15-17 2014!

http://caaudioshow.com/           Thank You Constantine Soo for your support

Greetings,

We are Audio Vision SF, a small but nationally and internationally known hifi shop in the heart of San Francisco. Our landlord has recently given us notice that they will be re-claiming their space to use for their current facilities.

Antonio Long and Randolph Johnson (who recently, after taking the Star Wars Character Quiz, discovered that he is R2D2) have been in business for 15 years and at this current location for 11 years, navigating the ups and downs of the San Francisco economy.  We are best friends of 28 years, starting and playing in several bands together while chasing our love of music thru the years.

Running a hifi shop is by no means a get rich proposition, it is a labor of love and every contribution, no matter how small, will make sure that Audio Vision SF stays in San Francisco and continues to bring the joy of music to our patrons.

BIG NEWS ! We have found a space and will be relocating to 1628 California Street! That's only 1.5 blocks away! It is an empty shell..So now we need your support to build out this space to better serve you in the future.


What We Need & What You Get

We have a goal of $50,000, every penny of which will go to the relocation and interior construction of our new home in SF.  And if we don't reach our goal, the funds received will still go to our relocation fund, NOTHING goes into our pockets!

We also have at least a dozen audio manufacturers who are contributing some really exciting products to our effort.

The Impact

As many of you know, hifi shops are not located on every corner. 

Retail (brick & motor) stores are an essential and declining part of experiencing something as personal as choosing a hifi system.  Deciding on a music playback system, or a new part to add to your current system, is like deciding on a favorite beer or wine. The majority taste good, but only a few will have that distinctive flavor that you prefer.  You can’t hear what a particular pair of speakers sounds like on line, nor can you tell how that pair of speakers sounds with a particular amplifier or source.  These are things that you need to figure out for yourself and to do that, you need a place with the expertise to guide you on your journey and the product selection to make sure that you arrive at your destination.  With your help, our decades old shop can continue to help people enjoy the music.

Other Ways You Can Help

Every little bit helps!  If you can't contribute monetarily, please use the Indiegogo Share Tools to pass the word on to friends, family, co-workers, cyborgs or any Wookies that you may know!  Thank you for reading this and taking an interest in Audio Vision SF!

AND OF COURSE IF YOU CAN PLEASE TAKE A MINUTE FILL OUT OUR SIMPLE QUESTIONNAIRE!   https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1O3d0kOHZqpB1wAzFAAjv_WdHRSKZQg6fkLSQp2PkZiI/viewform ..

love and every contribution, no matter how small, will make sure that Audio Vision SF stays in San Francisco and continues to bring the joy of music to our patrons. BIG NEWS ! We have found a space and will be relocating to 1628 California Street! That's only 1.5 blocks away! It is an empty shell..So now we need your support to build out this space to better serve you in the future.What We Need & What You GetWe have a goal of $50,000, every penny of which will go to the relocation and interior construction of our new home in SF.  And if we don't reach our goal, the funds received will still go to our relocation fund, NOTHING goes into our pockets!We also have at least a dozen audio manufacturers who are contributing some really exciting products to our effort.The ImpactAs many of you know, hifi shops are not located on every corner.  Retail (brick & motor) stores are an essential and declining part of experiencing 
something as personal as choosing a hifi system.  Deciding on a music playback system, or a new part 
to add to your current system, is like deciding on a favorite beer or wine. The majority taste good, but only a few will have that distinctive flavor 
that you prefer.  You can’t hear what a particular pair of speakers sounds like on line, nor can you tell how that pair of speakers sounds with a 
particular amplifier or source.  These are things that you need to figure out for yourself and 
to do that, you need a place with the expertise to guide you on your journey and the 
product selection to make sure that you arrive at your destination.  With your help, our decades old shop can continue to help people enjoy the music.Other Ways You Can HelpEvery little bit helps!  If you can't contribute monetarily, please use the Indiegogo Share Tools to pass the word on to friends, family, co-workers, cyborgs or any Wookies that you may know!  Thank you for reading this and taking an interest in Audio Vision SF!AND OF COURSE IF YOU CAN PLEASE TAKE A MINUTE FILL OUT OUR SIMPLE QUESTIONNAIRE!   https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1O3d0kOHZqpB1wAzFAAjv_WdHRSKZQg6fkLSQp2PkZiI/viewform ..

story: Andy Kavanagh-Mosson was diagnosed with vascular dementia last year.  The condition has progressed quickly, and he now requires 24 hour care and support.  Due to cuts in funding for care services, respite care services are very restricted.  The goal of this fund raiser is to raise money to help pay for extra care services to lighten the burden on Andy's partner Paul, and to help ensure that Andy can avoid going into residential care.
story_txt: Andy Kavanagh-Mosson was diagnosed with vascular dementia last year.  The condition has progressed quickly, and he now requires 24 hour care and support.  Due to cuts in funding for care services, respite care services are very restricted.  The goal of this fund raiser is to raise money to help pay for extra care services to lighten the burden on Andy's partner Paul, and to help ensure that Andy can avoid going into residential care.

story:
Short Summary

Berakah Educational Foundation is a registered South African Non-Profit Organization

Berakah operates in the township of Mamelodi, to the east of Pretoria, and provides 200 children from the ages of 6 month to 6 years with quality early childhood development

This organization is in desperate need of raising funds to keep their water connection, fix toilets, and provide proper sanitation through installing sinks with hot water in the bathrooms.

Because of a lack of funds, Berakah has not been able to maintain the toilets and sanitation at this center properly, 200 children make use of these toilets daily, and because of a lack of maintenance the water bill for this center has grown to $13,000.


The good news, Berakah has fixed all water leaks and is no longer accruing a large water bill.


The Need, Berakah doesn't have the cash to pay the water bill or to fix the sanitation problems, with your help you can help us provide this to the 200 children that are relying on our center for education.




What We Need & What You Get


$5,000 will help us fix / replace the toilets, install a hot water heater for the sinks, and install 8 sinks in the bathrooms.

 $13,000 will go to the City of Tshwane Municipality to pay Berakah's water bill so that they can keep their water connection.

$2,000 will go to paying people for the administration of this project and carrying out all of the necessary installations

$1 will get an honorable mention on our web page www.berakah.org.za/indiegogodonors

$5 Honorable Mention & Picture on our wep page www.berakah.org.za/indiegogodonors

$15 will get your name on a plaque of donors that will be put on our center in Mamelodi once the project is finished

$100 adopt a toilet, and name it whatever you want.

$100 adopt a sink, and name it whatever you want.

$150 Corporate Sponsorship we will add your company name, and a link to your website on our webpage

www.berakah.org.za/indiegogodonors

$200 Silver Corporate Sponsorship

We will add your company name, logo, and a link to your website on our webpage

www.berakah.org.za/indiegogodonors


$500 Gold Corporate Sponsorship

We will add your company name, logo, and a link to your website on our webpage

www.berakah.org.za/indiegogodonors

and we will add your logo plaque of donors that will be put on our center in Mamelodi once the project is finished


$20,000 Make It Happen

We will give you all of the above perks and personally fly you out to South Africa for a week so that you can be a part of this project and meet the people that its benefiting.


If we don't receive all of the funds needed for this project whatever is raised will go to pay Berakah's Water Bill with the City of Tshwane.


The Impact


By helping us with this you will be helping us further the cause of Education in the township of Mamelodi.

Lack of education is the number one cause to poverty and crime in Africa.

This center is meeting a very practical need within this community by providing education to 200 underprivileged children.

Other Ways You Can Help


Let your friends know about this project.

Advertise for us on Facebook, Twitter, or any other social media platform.

story:
Hi, my name's Patrick Hayden, and I've created The Quality Alternative. And with your generous donation, we can help bring back American manufacturing jobs all across the United States, from sea to shining sea.

  • The Quality Alternative is an internet-based retail business that is strictly going to sell quality American-made merchandise from a wide selection of useful, interesting, and fun products, with a passion for customer satisfaction, and a true dedication to helping less fortunate Americans in need. Imagine a store that carries gadgets, tools, toys, electronics, games, musical instruments, sporting goods, pet supplies, furniture, decor, clothing & accessories, collectibles, memorabilia, etcetera … and they’re ALL made right here in the United States! Imagine the impact this could have on our economy!

  • We’re also going to offer a TRUE customer satisfaction guarantee- Where if your order is not as described, or is of poor quality, we’ll simply refund the full product price within the stated time frame (excludes shipping, handling, and tax, of course). And for returns, you’ll have at least 30 days from the day you receive your package, not from the day we ship it. We feel that a customer won’t be truly satisfied until the day they receive their order and is able to verify it’s how it should be. And we’ll always make sure that our products are of respectable quality. So, if we consistently have problems with a certain product or manufacturer, and the issue is not resolved when brought to their attention in a timely manner, we’ll simply remove that product or manufacturer from our product line, because maintaining quality control throughout The Quality Alternative is more important to me than big profit margins for selling cheap junk.

  • And finally, no matter what you buy or how much you spend, we will ALWAYS donate at least TWENTY FIVE PERCENT of our gross profits from EVERY SINGLE PURCHASE toward the qualified charity of the customer’s choice during order check-out. This offer has no time limit and will always be available. You won't pay anything extra, but you will get to choose where one-fourth of our profits go! In fact, you don’t have to pick just one charity to donate to. You can pick as many as you want, and the donation gets divided up by the number of charities you picked. And we also give you the option to donate directly to your local chapters of each charity based on whichever zip code you provide us.

To be a "qualified charity", each must adhere to specific guidelines to be eligible for donation through The Quality Alternative.

  • Must be an officially-recognized and legally-compliant 501(c)3 non-profit charitable organization.

  • Must be based in, or have at least 50 chapters throughout the United States.

  • Charity must perform services such as research, treatment, assistance, shelter, etc.. There will be no “awareness” charities with The Quality Alternative.

  • At least 66% (or 2/3) of the charity’s total annual revenue must go towards charity expenses.

  • At least 66% (or 2/3) of the charity’s total annual expenses must go towards the program services.

  • Charity’s total annual revenue cannot be subsidized by taxpayers through the government by more than 10%.

  • The CEO cannot make more than 5% of charity’s income.

  • No bipartisan political causes. This is not a left-wing or a right-wing business. This is an American business designed to help other Americans.

  • Must not directly harm or kill any people or animals in conducting its services. (with the rare exception of euthanasia ONLY when an animal is severely suffering due to a late-stage terminal illness or other circumstance where putting them out of their misery would be the only humane option)

  • Must not be guilty of any fraudulent activity of any kind, past or present.

Now, in order to do all of this, I do need time and money. I currently spend over 80 hours a week between work and commuting, which leaves just a tiny bit of time to help raise my family each night. It also leaves almost no time to work towards this goal.

So, here are my plans for the funds that are raised:

I will use the necessary portion of the funds raised for operating costs such as facilities rent, internet, phone, fax, shipping supplies, web hosting, purchasing inventory, and other utilities or services required to operate my business.

I will also be applying funds toward marketing and ad production costs such as radio advertisements, print advertisements, billboards, social media and other internet marketing, and then release some video advertisements, giving top priority to the people that purchased one of our campaign perks. I really want to get creative with this!

Also included will be the initial production costs of designing the website, writing content, and any other one-time production assistance required to get The Quality Alternative going live and taking orders!

So, I am humbly requesting at least $25,000 to cover the costs for at least 6 months of operation. At that point, we will have enough revenue to cover our own costs, and can continue to provide support to these quality American manufacturers, as well as the charities that deserve it the most.

And if you want to take advantage of all the perks we have to offer, that would provide us with an incredible boost in our abilities and outreach right out of the gate when we launch The Quality Alternative.

CAMPAIGN PERKS

Now, here’s what you get out of it- each perk is designed to put you in the spotlight via internet, print, radio, and video. We will be marketing The Quality Alternative nationwide, starting with local radio here in Houston, and other major US cities, coast-to-coast. Then we’ll be marketing our print ads and videos on the internet, including social media. This is your chance to get your face seen and your voice heard by millions for a great cause! And if you want to contribute, but don’t want your image or voice in our advertisements, you can substitute a family member or a friend. You don't have to look like a chiseled model. Be funny.. be goofy.. be original.. be yourself! That's what we want to see!

note: There are certain guidelines in order to get your advertisement premise approved. We will not allow any obscene or vulgar language and imagery. I don’t mind edgy humor, but this really should be a common sense issue. If you’re not sure if your idea will get approved, please email me before you pay for the perk and I will let you know for certain. I want both of us to be satisfied with the final outcome.

The Quality Alternative simply wants to provide quality American-made products for customers, and to bring American manufacturing of all kinds back into the spotlight, while also contributing to the worthiest charitable causes. If this is something that inspires you in any way, shape, or form, please consider supporting our cause in any way you can, whether it's a monetary donation, production assistance, or simply sharing our campaign link on your Facebook or Twitter for all your family and friends to see. Your contribution does matter.

Thank you.

story:
Summary

     When I was 17 I spent 2 weeks in the Philippines, it was part a of much longer missions trip that had us going through out  Asia trying to help out in under privileged areas.  In the Philippines I saw a lot of beautiful nature and wonderful people. Our primary job there was working with elementary aged children and I will never forget how sweet and loving these children were who had almost nothing in terms of material possessions.   
      Seeing the news coming in with the devastation that Typhoon Haiyan did to the Philippines is simply heart breaking.  With an estimated 10,000 people dead and another 630,000 est left homeless by one of the biggest storms in history the path to recovery can only be long and difficult.  We at Athena's Wink are doing this fundraiser to try and help the people of the Philippines in any way that we can. We got other artists to chip in additional items to expand the effort.  Every donated dollar helps.  The funds raised will be donated to the Philippine Red Cross. 
      We chose the Tarsier as the mascot for this project as it is a very unique and adorable animal that  is native to the Philippines and can translate easily into a variety of products.  I hope you like what we have made and above all I hope you donate! 

Who we are:

Athena's Wink is an established company with a presence on Etsy, Amazon, Ebay and ThinkGeek.  The owners Carrie Wink and Carolann Voltarel are two crafters from Brooklyn who make cute hats, flasks and other items and sell them online and at conventions around the US.  They have done fundraising efforts in the past for the Red Cross for the Japanese earthquake and Hurricane Sandy. They have also raised over 1k for Child's Play.  https://www.etsy.com/shop/athenaswink

Hikari wo Sagasu's mission to make everyone shine in their own way~! Dory Eng makes gorgeous origami earring and hair accessories using Japanese washi paper. She currently resides in NJ and travels to sell at many conventions throughout the year and online on Storenvy. Hikari wo Sagasu has done fundraising efforts for the Japanese Earthquake Tsunami and for Hurricane Sandy, we have chosen to join hand in hand with Athena's Wink and Studio Kitsu to raise funds for the people of the Philippines devastated by Typhoon Haiyan.
http://www.storenvy.com/stores/22888-hikari-wo-sagasu

Studio Kitsu
https://www.etsy.com/shop/StudioKitsu

What We Need & What You Get

  • We're looking to just raise any money that we can, if we get $1? Great. If we get $1000? Amazing. Every little bit will help.
  • All the items are the product of artist who want to help, please check out their other stuff as well at their shops! Most of us make our livings selling the items we make.
  • Even if we don't reach the goal you'll still get your items and money will still go to the Red Cross, we would love to raise over $500 but nothing much will change if we don't.  
  • New things are still being added! This was kinda a scrambled together effort and people are still making prototypes to be added to this page. We have several artist currently working on products for this and they will be up shortly!

The Items


$5 PostCard Print

This postcard is an adorable way to show support! This is a glossy 3x5 size print signed by the artists with personal message of thanks.

$4 of this will go directly to the Red Cross.Made by Athena's Wink

$6 Button pack

A super adorable 1" Tarsier button + a 1" Philippines flag love button.

$5 of this will go directly to the Red Cross  Made by Studio Kitsu 


$8 Tarsier Acrylic Charm Keychain /Cell phone strap


Charms are made of 100% acrylic to be waterproof, scratch proof, and fade proof. They are a perfect accessory of adorableness!

$4 of this will go directly to the Red Cross Made by Dex Studios

$13 Tarsier Charm Earrings

Charms are made of 100% acrylic to be waterproof, scratch proof, and fade proof. They are a perfect accessory of adorableness!
$8 of this will go directly to the Red Cross Made by Dex Studios

$15 Beach Gel Candle

This beautiful hand made 4oz candle brings the feeling of the ocean to your house with the light refreshing scent of celestial waters.
$10 of this will go directly to the Red Cross
Made by Geek Fire Gifts
http://geekfiregifts.com

$16 Crane Earrings


These earrings are made of beautifully folded origami paper and coated in varnish.  They come in a choice of  colors and will add a sparkle to any outfit.
$10 of this will go directly to the Red Cross Made by Hikari wo Sagasu

$25 Flask


This flask is an adorable way to show support, cute and useful! This is a high quality stainless steel flask wrapped in high quality vinyl with super-strong adhesive that attaches all the way around the flask.

$15 of this will go directly to the Red Cross. Made by Athena's Wink

$30 Hat 

This hat is made of nice soft fleece and will cutely keep your head warm all winter. It  comes in sizes 20" -Child, 22"-Adult and 24"- large adult.   

$20 of this will go directly to the Red Cross. Made by Athena's Wink

The Impact

    We're looking to make as much money as possible to donate to the Red Cross, don't like our items? Please donate anyways

Other Ways You Can Help

  If you're also an artist/crafter who wants to help just drop us a line at athenaswink@gmail.com  with the product you make, how many you can provide and the cost per item. We will be adding new items though out  the campaign and would love to include yours!

$16 Crane EarringsThese earrings are made of beautifully folded origami paper and coated in varnish.  They come in a choice of  colors and will add a sparkle to any outfit. $10 of this will go directly to the Red Cross Made by Hikari wo Sagasu
$25 Flask
This flask is an adorable way to show support, cute and useful! This is a high quality stainless steel flask wrapped in high quality vinyl with super-strong adhesive that attaches all the way around the flask.
$15 of this will go directly to the Red Cross. Made by Athena's Wink
$30 Hat 
This hat is made of nice soft fleece and will cutely keep your head warm all winter. It  comes in sizes 20" -Child, 22"-Adult and 24"- large adult.   
$20 of this will go directly to the Red Cross. Made by Athena's Wink
The Impact    We're looking to make as much money as possible to donate to the Red Cross, don't like our items? Please donate anyways Other Ways You Can Help  If you're also an artist/crafter who wants to help just drop us a line at athenaswink@gmail.com  with the product you make, how many you can provide and the cost per item. We will be adding new items though out  the campaign and would love to include yours!

story:
My wonderful friend Kimberly requires a spinal assessment that the Alberta Govt. will not cover unless she goes on a disability. Disability is much like income assistance and this young mother has worked very hard over the past 10 years to get off and stay off assistance. She does not want to be a burden on taxpayers - she desperately wants to continue moving forward with her life.

 She currently works with kids and goes to school and as a single parent approaching Christmas, she simply cannot afford the $200 needed for the spinal assessment. Any contribution is greatly appreciated.

The entire amount is needed for the assessment and Kimberly would be so very grateful to have this covered for her. Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
I am a U.S. trained, registered Dental Hygienist practicing for over 20 years now.  At the moment, I would like to progress to setting up my own office as an Independent Dental Hygienist, providing the same services I normally do for a dentist, but independently.  It has been a joy helping others through the preventive work that I do, that contributes to helping eliminate the primary cause of tooth loss worldwide in those above the age of 35: Periodontal Disease caused by longstanding, bacterial laden tartar that's hidden beneath the gum line.  Regardless of the age factor, however, as a Dental Hygienist, I have seen and treated Periodontal Disease that causes persistent bad breath, bleeding gums, infections, and loose teeth in teenagers as well as adults.   It's amazing seeing adult patients being more concerned about having orthodontically straightened, chemically whitened teeth, than they are about the presence of inflamed, bleeding gums, bacterial laden tartar and pockets and its consequences, that will eventually cause their teeth to lose support and in the end either fall out or be extracted.  Thus nullifying all the expensive dental work in which they had previously invested.  But then it's understandable, seeing how on many occasions, Dental Hygienists and their profession have been ridiculed by actors in comedic presentations, when the fact is that our preventative work is no laughing matter, and especially so to those who are toothless due to Periodontal Disease that went untreated for years.  Therefore, do not neglect having the tartar periodically removed above as well as below the gum line to prevent this eventuality.  I have a saying: "Fill up the cavities with white and gold, attach the bridgework that it may hold, but after getting that beautiful crown, Perio. disease will knock it all down!"  Besides being a major cause of tooth loss, research has shown that there's a connection between Periodontal Disease and other ailments: (http://www.perio.org/consumer/other-systemic-diseases). 

What does an Independent Dental Hygienist do?

Independent Dental Hygienists where they are available have their own offices and are viable options to clients who are afraid to go to the dentist, as well as to clients who are disabled, bedridden or who reside in nursing homes.  Independent Dental Hygienists provide dental hygiene services such as general dental cleanings, scaling and root planing with or without anesthesia, periodontal pocket assessments, oral exams, pit and fissure sealants, bleaching, fluoride applications, take impressions for mouth guards and custom trays, give nutritional counseling as related to oral health, give oral hygiene instructions, and they encourage clients who are in need of further care to visit a dentist.

Items needed for setup and Cost:

The larger equipment, which are the operatory unit, stool, vacuum system, compressor, and autoclave sterilizer are quoted at US$ 28,623., which includes shipping, installation and importation charges. The hygiene instruments, including scalers, ultrasonic apparatus and scaler tips, mouth mirrors, explorers, probes, slow speed handpiece, prophy angles, college pliers, curing light, sharpening stone, educational tools, dappen dishes, and cheek expanders are quoted at US$ 3,891.23, including shipping charges. The above items (US$ 32,514.23) are being covered by a bank loan, which I finally got, and also by personal investment.   The funds I am seeking to raise, however,  which is US$ 4000 are needed to acquire an office space and make it functional (Electrical, plumbing, carpentry and interior logistics design costs).

Would you consider using the services of an Independent Dental Hygienist?  Do let me know by responding either Yes or No in your   feedback.  Thank You.

story:
It's always been a dream of mine to coach youth soccer.  My first week working in the pediatric ward at "Hopital Albert Schweitzer" in Lambarene, Gabon, I played pick up soccer with some of the local teenage boys.   As we wrapped up, I offered to start coaching them starting the next week.  From then on, when I wasn't busy taking care of sick children, I gave my heart and soul to these young men.  It started with 11 boys during the first practice but then quickly grew to over 40 players and an assistant coach.  We started with weekend scrimmage games but soon traveled to play other local teams.  Through activities on and off the field, I became part of these young men's lives, homes, and community.  I was incredibly happy.  

Before leaving Lambarene, I found a Gabonese coach to take over the team and I signed them up for a tournament. Now that I'm back in the US, I want to stay involved and give these children hope for a professional soccer career.

My fundraising goal is to purchase all the necessary soccer accessories for this team to progress.  As you can see in the video, we had to be creative.  Many boys didn't have athletic shoes, there was no goal net, no cones, and we went through over 10 soccer balls in just 3 months. Because coaching is a major time commitment and a consistent leader is an absolute necessity for the team, these funds will also provide a coaching stipend to ensure the team continues year after year. 

What The Team Needs 

1) 10 soccer balls 

2) 20 soccer bibs

3) 24 water bottles

4) 2 official size soccer nets 

5) Soccer ball pump + needles 

6) 24 Plastic Disk Cones

7) Soccer cleats ~20 pairs

8) 2 small sided soccer nets 

9) Coach Stipend  

10) Equipment Shipping costs

Note: If the entire goal is not reached, the money will be used for the most essential items on the list above. 

The Impact

Most of us are fortunate to know how being a part of a team impacts us.  It teaches us how to work together, work hard, build confidence, discipline and sportsmanship.  This soccer team may be the only way for these young men to experience that.  Furthermore, the team impacts the younger kids who watch in anticipation of playing in the future, and the families and community members who come together to cheer them on.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out to all of your friends and family who share a passion for soccer. The Indiegogo share tool makes it really simple to do.

story:
Short Summary

Project 143 (http://www.projectonefortythree.org) is a non-profit organization commited to bringing orphans from Latvia, the Ukraine and China to host families in the United States for summer or winter hosting experiences. 

For many orphans, coming to America is a dream they have only read about in storybooks. They often have few, if any, happy memories of childhood and hosting provides a respite from life in an orphanage, an opportunity to create positive and memorable childhood experiences, an opportunity to travel to a new place, medical, dental and vision care, a chance to eat healthy food, a chance to live in a family setting (some for the first time ever!), a chance to see appropriately modeled relationships, a chance to gain exposure and meet caring people in a country where they might have a chance of being adopted, and a chance to learn English which gives them yet another skill set to help overcome the overwhelming inequality and prejudice they face as orphans in their countries.

Children who live in orphanages own nothing as most of the orphanages all share community property. This means that even if you go to adopt a child there you have to bring them a change of clothes because nothing is allowed to go with them or leave the property. For many orphans, they have not yet learned that their society looks down on them to the point that they are excluded from many careers such as being a police officer, lawyer, teacher or doing much more than building trades despite their hard work, academic excellence and potential. In these countries, orphans over 9 years old, ones that are part of a sibling set, or ones with any type of mental, physical or learning disability are all considered lost causes and chances are slim to none that they will ever find a family in their own country. Instead they will be forced out of the system at 16 and go straight to work in an attempt to support themselves any way they can. 

Project 143 tries to change that by advertising these great kids to potential host families in the United States. In some instances the host families fall in love and choose to adopt their host child. In situations where that is not a possibility or not desired by either party, the host family can still act as an adoption advocate and try to find a loving adoptive home for the child here in the US where their many talents can be utilized and developed despite their orphan upbringing and status in their home country. Also, with permission from the orphanage, many host families and children keep in touch through letters, care packages, and sometimes email when they return to their country. Through hosting they are provided with the love of a family and hope for their future.

About Sasha 

Though there are hundreds and thousands of orphans hoping to be chosen to come abroad and/or be adopted, we did hours of research and chose to fundraise for Sasha because his video and his bio touched our hearts. He is 13 years old, far older than what are considered "adoptable" children in the Ukraine. He has lived in the orphanage since he was 5 years old and has a 20 year old sister who was also there at one point, but they have had no contact since she left a few years ago. His bio reads that he is thoughtful, introspective, gentle and caring. He loves animals, swimming, tennis and volleyball and dreams of riding horses if he is chosen to come to the US. He also says he likes school and his favorite subject is math. He says he would like to have a career with animals one day, maybe as a dog behaviorist or a veterinarian, or as a builder.

What We Need & What You Get

The details:

Cory and I are discussing the possibility of hosting this child this summer ourselves and are currently discussing it with the coordinators. So exciting! Regardless of whether we end up being the host family for Sasha, all money raised will go to him as a sponsorship to help him make the trip one way or another.

What we need: ($5250 Total)

$250 - non refundable deposit to hold the child

$3000 - the cost of Project 143 to host an orphan. This includes visa and passport costs, transportation from the orphanage to the airport, all additional fees, round trip airfare to and from the US, and the cost of the mandatory chaperone/ translator who travels with the child and stays for a couple of days until they get settled in. 

$1000 - while in the US the organization asks that we take care of all vaccinations, doctors visits, a dental exam and any dental work needed and a vision exam and glasses if needed. While we plan to seek out pro bono services we know everything won't be free so we are building a fund for this purpose.

$500 - a basic fund for food, clothing, shoes, school supplies and any other needed materials

$500 -  the final money here will be used to make Sasha' s trip as memorable as possible and to address any other unforeseen needs that might arise. We are looking at the Boys and Girls Club Summer Camp so he can meet and interact with kids his own age and practice his English skills; taking him to lots of DC museums, the zoo, and potential trips to the beach, a potential long weekend in NYC and any other authentic American experiences we can cram into one summer. All suggestions welcome but remember we are on a strict budget :)

What you get:

All donations are welcome, big and small!  

As a contributor you will get lots of pictures and updates of Sasha's time in the US. For the lucky ones who live in close proximity or want to come visit, you will get to meet and hang out with him as well. Maybe he will even help you learn a little Russian! 

Full disclosure: if he ends up going to another host family this summer we will do our best to update you and send pics of his progress there as well. You will still have the intrinsic reward of knowing you helped him get here, get some TLC and medical care and hopefully find a family to call his own! :)

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can’t contribute and that is a-ok, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

Please help us spread the word and SHARE, SHARE, SHARE! 

If 1000 people donate just $5 Sasha will be on his way in a few short months!

Thanks for your consideration and your kindness! :)

story:
You don't stop playing because you've grown old. You've grown old because you have stopped playing. 



Every day thousands of kids and adults alike venture out into the world in hopes of exploring and playing in their surroundings. However, all too often, we are told "get down from there" or scolded for not taking the stairs like "a normal person." It is time for us to stand up for our selves, it is time to have a place we can call home. We need the freedom to run, jump, climb, and explore the true potential we all have in a space created just for people like us.  


What We Need & What You Get

 Freedom In Motion (F.I.M.), located in Murrieta, CA, is a personal instruction facility dedicated to the art of movement. Freedom In Motion is a facility which offers a controlled environment for people to come train in their sport or movement. We offer classes in various sports with a focus on parkour. As well as provide an open gym where people can come and train freely. We also sell athletic Freedom In Motion apparel and gear.


  • We need $10,000 to help boost us up to creating the area's first and only parkour gym. The extra funds will help ensure that we bring our athletes what they need in order to grow with this amazing sport. 
  • Every dollar contributed, you will get back and then some! Check out our contribution perks and see how you can double your money. (and in one case, triple it)
  • Even if we don't reach our goal, the money will still go right into this gym project. We hope to be open by Summer 2014, and of course sooner depending on our funding! 

Above is a parkour gym concept from Americanparkour.com

The Impact

Your contributions go directly into this gym, which is owned, built, and operated by the local parkour community.

  • No other space exists for parkour minded people to run, jump, train, and play. This will provide a safe and effective learning environment for everyone who wants to explore their inner Spider Man. Freedom in Motion is a place for Kids and adults alike!
  •  Currently Temecula Parkour is one of southern California's largest parkour communities. Find our YouTube videos online and see for yourself! This will help progress parkour in the area, and help it grow with a positive productive culture that it currently has. When you think about someone who trains parkour, we want adjectives like kind, creative, and innovative, to come to mind. 
  • This gym will provide a space for kids, teens, and adults who are looking for an alternative way to keep active, and gain a new creative out look on life. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, no problem, we understand. But that doesn't have to be the end of the line for you! 

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about what we're working so hard to achieve! 
  • Hit that Indiegogo share tool!  Any little bit of help goes a long way! even just allowing us to be on your Facebook wall is a huge honor to us. 

Love, Freedom in Motion, and the local parkour community as a whole. 


<3

to the art of movement. Freedom In Motion is a facility which offers a 
controlled environment for people to come train in their sport or 
movement. We offer classes in various sports with a focus on parkour. As 
well as provide an open gym where people can come and train freely. We 
also sell athletic Freedom In Motion apparel and gear.

We need $10,000 to help boost us up to creating the area's first and only parkour gym. The extra funds will help ensure that we bring our athletes what they need in order to grow with this amazing sport. 
Every dollar contributed, you will get back and then some! Check out our contribution perks and see how you can double your money. (and in one case, triple it)
Even if we don't reach our goal, the money will still go right into this gym project. We hope to be open by Summer 2014, and of course sooner depending on our funding! 


Above is a parkour gym concept from Americanparkour.comThe ImpactYour contributions go directly into this gym, which is owned, built, and operated by the local parkour community.
No other space exists for parkour minded people to run, jump, train, and play. This will provide a safe and effective learning environment for everyone who wants to explore their inner Spider Man. Freedom in Motion is a place for Kids and adults alike!
 Currently Temecula Parkour 
is one of southern California's largest parkour communities. Find our 
YouTube videos online and see for yourself! This will help progress 
parkour in the area, and help it grow with a positive productive culture that it currently has. When you think about someone who trains parkour, we want adjectives like kind, creative, and innovative, to come to mind. 

This gym will provide a space for kids, teens, and adults who are looking for an alternative way to keep active, and gain a new creative out look on life. 

Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can’t contribute, no problem, we understand. But that doesn't have to be the end of the line for you! 
Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about what we're working so hard to achieve! 
Hit that Indiegogo share tool!  Any little bit of help goes a long way! even just allowing us to be on your Facebook wall is a huge honor to us. 
Love, Freedom in Motion, and the local parkour community as a whole. <3

story:
Sign up for our newsletter

Summary

It all started when a teenage neighbor next door asked me for a lift to a skatepark one town over. "I'm too busy today", I told him. "I wish we had a skatepark, he said." Fast forward one city council meeting later, and I was "all-in" when another kid said before the council, "[We'd like a skatepark.] We're not bad kids." No, they aren't bad kids, and why is it we make them feel this way? They're good kids with a passion for skateboarding. Our city spends money on soccer, basketball, baseball, and many other legitimate sports, why not skateboarding? Skateboarding is cheaper, and cities have liability protection against injuries! Skating teens are worthy of our public dollars.

My name is Angela, but my friends call me "Ange." I'm a Newark, CA resident, and a mother of a 4-year old son. I'm a technical writer by profession. My friends tell me that I'm highly organized and a shrewd business woman. I am starting a nonprofit, Newark Parks Foundation—to meet a community need, serving as the Foundation's volunteer Executive Director.

Newark's total population under 18 in 2013-2014 was 25.4%. The city and the school district expects the number of families to increase as a result of the city’s new housing developments (2,500+ homes) currently scheduled for construction, yet no new parks are scheduled for construction, investments in existing parks are unsubstantial, and deferred park maintenance is at an all-time high.

My community needs more urban parks and open spaces to meet our growing outdoor recreational needs and desire for gathering places, and I want to do something about it. I want to harness the grass roots volunteers and leaders that I've already mobilized. My team and I have projects in the planning stage, including:

  • City's first skatepark for teens and pre-teens. Teens need safe places to socialize. Skateboarding fosters confidence, resilience, and independence. We've identified a couple of neighborhood parks with space for a skatepark!
  • City's first native plants garden ("demonstration garden") for all to enjoy. The proposed site is a neighborhood park that serves at-risk youth and seniors. The park is adjacent to Head Start and a Senior Center. We already have a commitment from SF Don Edwards Wildlife Refuge's Native Plants Nursery to donate the native plants!
  • Tri-City Area's first dirt-jump pump-track bike park. This is a popular sport among mountain bikers and BMX bikers of all ages, and it's a family sport that brings people together from our neighboring communities and generates economic activity for our city. We've already identified volunteer dirt track shapers/builders!
  • City's first off-leash dog park. For many residents, their pets are part of their outdoor experience, especially for dog owners who have limited mobility. We have the public land!
To successfully deploy these projects, my team and I need to start up a nonprofit organization to acquire the necessary legal structure and status.

Our Cause & Case

According to California Department of Education data for 2013-2014 school year, the health risk of Newark’s teens is more than double and sometimes triple than that of Fremont’s, Newark’s neighboring city. Whether the direct cause of these health disparities is income or education or both, one solution is greater access to free, neighborhood (aka “around-the-corner”) recreational activities for teens.We've published articles and a strong petition to the City of Newark to make our case. Won't you please read on, and learn more about our cause.

Our Case:

https://newarkparks.wordpress.com/our-case/

Our Petition & Community Support
https://www.change.org/p/skatepark-for-newark

(Video) Teens, in Their Own Words (Skip To 47:07)
http://newarkca.pegcentral.com/player.php?video=b6ff587a9a7b9b691f0baa50d279e9d7

Skatepark for Newark Kids, Not Screen Time
http://patch.com/california/newark/skatepark-newark-kids-not-screen-time-0

RideOn Skatepark: What a Newark Legacy!
http://patch.com/california/newark/rideon-skatepark-what-newark-legacy-0

Our Team:
https://newarkparks.wordpress.com/board-of-directors/

What We Need & What You Get

Over the next 60 days, we are seeking to raise $3,000 to pay for the necessary state and federal filings, nonprofit branding, financial software, insurance, and needed office supplies:
  • Federal 501(c)(3) application
  • State incorporation application
  • General Liability insurance
  • Customized website hosting and email addresses
  • Additional website development and graphic art work
  • Advertising for additional Board members
  • QuickBooks software
  • Office supplies and business cards
Though I cannot offer you a tax-deductible donation because my team isn't yet a 501(c)(3), I have a number of perks, all of which involve me thanking you personally. I hope you choose the BBQ as one of my teammates makes a "mean" tri-tip rub.

The Impact

My city doesn't have a nonprofit with our mission; in fact, we have very few nonprofits. My city is very small—only 45,000 people, and so the impact will be noticeable. Parks promote health and community, and, with your support, we'll deliver on this vision. My team and I bring a lot of skills to the table, and you can read about us on our website.

Risks & Challenges

My goal isn't without risks. One risk is that the federal government doesn't approve my organization's 501(c)(3) status in a timely fashion thereby delaying our projects. This is "par for the course." I have included buffer in the project timelines; nonetheless, should our projects "slip," I'll make adjustments to our project schedules and continue forward, never losing site of the overall mission.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share this campaign with your friends, family, and neighbors.
  • Important: Sign up for our newsletter.
  • If you're local, volunteer by contacting me at info@newarkparks.org. We have a task for you!
  • Write an opinion piece in the local paper (or blog) about our Foundation and our capital projects.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Welcome to our fundraising page!

                 

BBQ Pork Tacos

Who we are

We started with a white rock hauling 82' stepvan and turned it into an amazing little food truck, The Ginger Armadillo. After new tires, a new engine, an entire kitchen, and a red coat of paint, we hit the road. Being a 100% mobile food truck for two years, we've set up shop all over Austin and the surrounding areas: at office buildings, breweries, private parties, movie sets, and signature Austin events. Our motley crew includes Chef Jen, Tyler, Devon, and Justin. Here's our story.


At the center of our business is the idea of the Food Community. It's what makes our business different. It's easy to profit from cooking with cheap ingredients, paying your employees too little, and charging your customers too much. But it also alienates people from the beautiful process of making and eating food. We value every phase of that process. It starts with buying as many seasonal, local products from local farmers and purveyors as possible.
 
Brenton the owner of Johnson's Backyard Garden
Places like Johnson's Backyard Garden, Hudson's Meat Market, and Vital Farms are a few we love, but we're always looking for new local growers to be part of our food community.

Lamb Kolache Slider (left), Brisket Kolache Sandwich (center), & Texinha with Mardi Slaw & Herbed Potato Salad (right)
We want our employees to live fulfilling lives, and the Ginger Armadillo's primary goal as a business is to provide for them and provide a creative space for them to contribute to Austin cuisine. Our employee's creative and financial autonomy also creates a healthy work environment filled with passionate people, and communicates how indispensable they are to our food community.

We want you to eat our food. Money keeps us and local farmers in business. But we run this business to keep central Texas cuisine alive and vibrant. That vibrancy comes from Austinites eating at the Ginger Armadillo and participating in our food community. That's why our prices are so low and our portions so generous even though you're eating such high quality ingredients. 

Fun on the truck (left), Crispy Harvest Cakes (center), customer enjoying a Spicy Pork Burger (right)
Opening a permanent location will help grow our food community, and give more and more access to the deeply local traditions of central Texas cuisine that the Ginger Armadillo represents.

It's Time to Expand

We've learned many things over the last few years. Being a completely mobile business, driving from place to place and promoting each event on Facebook and Twitter has worked very well for us (we doubled our revenue from 2014 to 2015). 

The question we get all the time is "Where are you normally located?" We've realized that we're at the maximum for our mobile capacity, so it's time to open a stationary location. Not only will a stationary truck increase our purchases from our farming neighbors and allow us to employ more people, but instead of having to wait for us to come to you, you can come and eat with us on a regular basis. 

Our philosophy works because the goal of our business is to reinvest into our community. But that continual reinvestment limits our ability to spend the kind of large one-time capital that expansions depend on. That's why we're running this campaign.

The New Truck

Here's our canvas. We have some pretty exciting ideas for the exterior design. Finding the truck is always a challenging step, so we're pleased to have already passed that hurdle. 

We're excited about getting it up and cooking! This is what we need to do.

What We Need

The truck needs to be remodeled on the outside and have a standards-compliant kitchen installed on the inside. Here is some of what that entails:

  • The interior of the truck must be lined with a fire resistant material (for obvious reasons), plus a new floor, and a window cut out for service.
  • We'll need a new fryer, char grill, freezer, and reach-in fridge. That's just the appliances. We'll also need to build counters and storage cabinets.
  • For sanitation, Austin requires a three-compartment sink,  extensive plumbing, and waste-water disposal system. It's a good thing.
  • A vent-a-hood is required to get smoke out, and an air-conditioner is required to prevent everyone from turning into puddles in August.
  • We're going to install all new metal siding - we plan on leaving the new sheet metal exterior exposed. We're also working on a design to have the roof shaped into a covered wagon. Think of it as airstream meets chuck wagon. Something like this:                                                                                                                                                                           

  • This new truck will need all new inspections and permits, because the city of Austin needs to sustain the lavish lifestyles of its bureaucrats somehow. 

  • Plus all the inevitable pitfalls and setbacks waiting for us along the way.

What We Will Do For You

Our perks section reflects our philosophy. We think of this campaign as an opportunity to have more people join our food community; which means making it easier for y'all to eat our food. Your donation will be rewarded with vouchers to be exchanged for Ginger Armadillo food, and they'll be good at either our future stationary or current mobile location. So as soon as the campaign ends, you can redeem your vouchers before our stationary location is even up and running. Just go to our on-line calendar and track us down! We'll be waiting for you!

We'll also being offering traditional merchandise like T shirts and bumper stickers so you can spread the good news and tell people that you are keeping central Texas cuisine alive in Austin. 


Please enjoy the full length version of our fundraising video. Same message as the small one, just with a few more friends and loved ones involved.  P.S. - Some people were wondering about the cows. That's the Stratman family herd in Shiner, Texas!
