story:
Help us to build the Backyard at River and Woods, and then come this summer to enjoy the taste of Colorado Comfort Cuisine you helped to create!

Imagine an outdoor restaurant space where you can come to enjoy great food and great company under the open sky, a place for date nights and family nights and warm weekend brunches, a place to gather with friends, to enjoy a drink from a converted airstream bar and some live acoustic music, a place to hold private parties and receptions, and to embrace the amazing outdoor and culinary culture of the little mountain hamlet that remains at the heart of Boulder-town. 

 

The large, fully-enclosed backyard oasis will provide a space unlike anything else in Boulder. With a grassy area for kids to run, an outdoor rotisserie and food bar, a mobile beer, wine and cocktail bar, strung lights and beautiful landscaping, the Backyard at River and Woods will be a truly special community experience. 



Once upon a time, an historic old home on the east end of Pearl Street was made iconic by John's Restaurant, one of Boulder's first fine dining establishments. Forty years later, Chef John and his family wanted to ensure that the little house would remain a place to embody a culinary legacy, an authentic space where the community could come to connect through great food. 

Enter River and Woods, a true community restaurant serving an unprecedented taste of Colorado Comfort Cuisine, opening summer 2016. 


River and Woods is a joint endeavor of Chef Daniel Asher and Josh Dinar. 

Daniel is the culinary wizard behind some of Denver's buzziest eateries, including root down, linger, and Ophelia's. 

Josh is co-owner of the Boulder hotspot T|ACO, co-founder of Boulder's Restaurant Week, and publisher of DiningOut Magazine. 

Together, they hope to breathe new life into this one-of-a-kind space, simultaneously honoring its history and energizing its vibe. 


The backyard isn't all that we're changing in this amazing restaurant space! We're re-energizing this iconic building, simultaneously paying homage to and re-defining its history. An enclosed front porch waiting area opens to a front bar with a vaulted roof and hand-hewn framing. Beams from a Colorado silver mine create an entryway to a warm, intimate dining area featuring barn wood ceilings. And finally, a sleek, updated kitchen space offers unique “food bar” seating, So guests are a part of the action. 

The natural intimacy of the building lends itself perfectly to a neighborhood bistro, frequented by locals and visitors who can return back time and again to enjoy favorite menu items at a great value, and to explore the rotating roster of recipes supplied by the community. 

The $30,000 we're looking to raise will cover a small portion of the overall costs to build the Backyard at River and Woods. Because it will be designed as a true community gathering space, we want to offer the opportunity for our community to be a part of its vision and execution. 

Those who contribute will be a part of our family. You'll be recognized on a wall of founders, kept up-to-date on the restaurant construction as it happens, and, of course, be invited in to recoup your investment in amazing food and sweet gear! Contribute at higher levels, and you'll also be invited to an exclusive opening party or have the opportunity for a private dining experience hosted by Chef Daniel. 

(Eat in the kitchen at River and Woods)


Aside from contributing financially, there are other ways to join the River and Woods experience. As a part of a regularly-rotating menu, we invite the community to submit the recipes that mean the most to them. On a regular basis, Chef Daniel and his crew will choose from those recipes, experiment with them, invite the submitter to a special tasting event, and ultimately showcase your dish—and its story—to guests at River and Woods. Pretty cool, huh? 
Lastly, we ask that you help us spread the word by sharing our campaign with your own friends and family through your social media networks. Please like us on Facebook and follow us on Instagram and Twitter, and reach out to us any time with thoughts, suggestions or anything else. We look forward to seeing you this summer in your own Backyard at River and Woods!

Those who contribute will be a part of our family. You'll be recognized on a wall of founders, kept up-to-date on the restaurant construction as it happens, and, of course, be invited in to recoup your investment in amazing food and sweet gear! Contribute at higher levels, and you'll also be invited to an exclusive opening party or have the opportunity for a private dining experience hosted by Chef Daniel. 






(Eat in the kitchen at River and Woods)



Aside from contributing financially, there are other ways to join the River and Woods experience. As a part of a regularly-rotating menu, we invite the community to submit the recipes that mean the most to them. On a regular basis, Chef Daniel and his crew will choose from those recipes, experiment with them, invite the submitter to a special tasting event, and ultimately showcase your dish—and its story—to guests at River and Woods. Pretty cool, huh? 


Lastly, we ask that you help us spread the word by sharing our campaign with your own friends and family through your social media networks. Please like us on Facebook and follow us on Instagram and Twitter, and reach out to us any time with thoughts, suggestions or anything else. We look forward to seeing you this summer in your own Backyard at River and Woods!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Stewart Thompson. Living here in Orange County, California, I have noticed that there are no actual personal training gyms in the whole county that focus on the wellness and well being of those who have suffered a Spinal Cord Injury and are left in a wheelchair. I myself have had an "SCI" for 3 years now and having to travel all over for treatment, San Diego, Brea, Huntington Beach, Etc. My wife and I thought, "Why not have it all in one location?" 

This is exactly what we have decided to do. We started a Non-Profit company right here in Irvine, the business heart of the county, where there are 65,000 disabled people in all of Orange county and have already contracted a Acupressure professional, and three Acupuncturist who will work out of our gym with us. We have contracted with a Chiropractor and have several personal trainers who are very well trained in the field of "SCI" and are confident, that with all these things combined, all of our clients, including myself, will be able to get back something that we lost, maybe even Walking!

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for a minimum of $5,000, however, could certainly use much more:

  • We need this to fund our cause and Start-Out
  • This will be used to lease a space and get things operational
  • It will also be used to help start a local fundraiser to raise more money

    The Impact

    When people are thrown into this new lifestyle, like I was, it is extremely hard to adjust and know exactly what to do next:

    • We will be the choice for these new ones to come and understand that movement is going to be the best option possible!
    • We have a highly trained and extremely skilled staff at each clients disposal.
    • And with a combination of Personal Training, Acupuncture, Acupressure and Chiropractic care, we are sure to see major results, and major life changes.

    Risks & Challenges

    The major risk involved here is not getting enough to start up our company and losing out on bettering these peoples lives. And too, another risk is that it is too costly for the individual client to pay for:

    • We don't want to miss out on this opportunity to change peoples lives and really help the community. 
    • We want to really give people like me a fighting chance at recovery, something that doctors can't even do. 
    • When a client can't pay, as a Non-Profit, we cannot carry a profit at the end of each year, so we are planing on being able to gift one or more clients $5,000-$10,000 to use at our facility as a gift to the client.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • We would love to have more help in funding and hope that you would feel moved to assist through getting the word out via Facebook or whatever means
    • And you can always contact us and visit our website LetsWalkINC.com

    Thank you!

story:
The crowdfunding guide says I should type a short summation of my story. That’s a hard thing to do when any amount of words is already not enough to describe what my son and I are going through. Have you ever noticed- in the middle of some personal tragedy- that the words in our language really can’t describe much of what we go through? Well, hopefully this is short: There was love, and then there was a baby. Things were very sweet, or so I thought, and then I found out that when my love was visiting an old college friend in San Diego he was actually visiting a girl. We tried to work it out. We went to counseling. I became one of those girls you lose respect for- the ones who try to save the relationship at all costs, the ones who love when all hope is gone.

Then, he walked out. Literally. He said he had tried to love me, but he couldn’t. He said he wanted to love me, but he didn’t. Then he walked out the door and got in his car, but he didn’t go anywhere. He started sleeping in his car every night. Sometimes at night I would sneak downstairs to see what he was doing. He was just sitting in his car, drinking beer and watching movies. In the morning, he would come in and loom over us while we slept. I often woke up to find him standing over me in a towel, fresh from his shower, just standing there, staring. At first, I thought that he didn’t really want to leave us and I felt hopeful we would work it out. As the weeks passed, I started to get scared. Often, after work, he would let himself in with his key and come in and sit down as if nothing had ever happened. A few times, he even asked “What’s for dinner?” He was always cheerful and happy, as if everything was going great. I started to feel uneasy that he didn’t understand boundaries. Then, he told me his “grand plan”. I was allowed to go back to work part time, either in Target or at a flower shop (extremely weird considering I have two postgraduate degrees and we met at work). We were going to get either adjoining apartments or houses on the same street. We would spend many evenings together having dinner and playing with our son. In two years, we would move together either to Colorado or Texas, whatever he decided was better for his career. Hopefully, in the meantime, we would both meet someone we would actually love. I tried to explain how weird this plan was, and how he didn’t understand what breaking up meant. He refused to listen to any of it. He was downright chipper about the entire thing. To me, it sounded like he had completely lost his mind. When I told him that I felt very uncomfortable having him around so much, he told me that when he came to visit our son, I had to leave. The next time he came over he did, in fact, make me leave my own house so he could spend time with our son alone. My son, who is almost two, completely stopped talking during this time. I believe he was traumatized by the situation, and I was very worried he was regressing in his development.

I was offered a job by my old boss, and I took it. It was in Virginia, but I felt the distance would be good. At this point, I felt like my X was delusional, scary, and possibly dangerous. I packed the baby up, left most of our possessions for my X, and took off. I told him I was leaving the day that I left, but not before. My X was furious. He didn’t want me to work full time, because he didn’t want a “Juanita” to raise our baby. He wanted me to stay in California, so he could continue with his career unimpeded. He wanted us to all see each other almost every day- to spend all our time together, although he would be free to explore other women and other relationships. I refused to come back, and started my new job.

Although he was angry, he said if I found a lawyer and paid for custody papers to be drawn up, he would sign them. So I did. I found a lawyer in Virginia and had papers drawn up that offered him three days visitation a week and joint custody, provided he moved. I didn’t even ask for child support. He came to visit our son on the weekend and he took the papers home with him to look them over. The Monday after he left I was served. He had secretly retained a lawyer in California and filed for sole custody, with no visitation rights for me at all. He additionally asked that I be investigated for kidnapping, and further, he asked that our son be put in foster care while the court granted him sole custody. He stated that he had no idea where I was that and I was holding our son hostage, even though he had just left from visiting us. He asked that I pay his lawyer fees. He also included many personal details in his filing (I assume just to upset and shame me) about how he had never found me attractive after I had the baby because of my babyweight and nursing. About a month later- this past weekend, his lawyer sent me more papers, asking for a record of all my financial holdings since 2012. Long story short, he wants the apartment I bought before I ever met him. He wants to be reimbursed for the money he spent during our relationship. He wants half of anything I got for Christmas, for birthdays, everything. Even though I had already paid for a lawyer here in Virginia, I have now had to retain lawyers in Orange County, where he filed, to fight him in that jurisdiction. I have to fly out to California for the court date, missing work (and I haven't earned any paid time off yet) pay for a plane ticket, leave my son with my parents, and hope that I'm not held in California for future court proceedings. My X is not giving me any kind of normal child support. At first, he agreed to pay $100 a week, but for example this week he decided to give me $93, for no reason I can discover, and then he deducted the cost of Netflix from my payment (which he watches on the Wii I bought but left for him in our old apartment in California) so I ended up with a little less than $70. His goal is to completely destroy me and make it so I'm unable to raise our son.

I didn’t work after our son was born. I thought I was lucky to be a stay at home mom, but I gave up all my financial independence to care for the family. This is my first job in almost three years. I paid a full retainer for a lawyer in my new state of residence. I’ve only had one paycheck so far and I have two months of unpaid bills. I have had to retain a second lawyer in California because that is where my X filed his suit. I was only able to pay part of their retainer because my financial situation is so dire. I only need the last $2,000. I’ve never done a crowdfunding request before, but I’m so afraid of losing my son, my new job and our only means of support, and now my old apartment which being sold because I can’t afford the mortgage in my new situation. Please help me to make a stable, normal space for my precious little one. Even though I’m dealing with heartache, harassment and constant fear and stress, my goal is to provide a bubble for him so he doesn’t know anything is happening and he can exist, and grow and thrive in the eye of the storm. I need the lawyers to help me fight against my X’s weird, innapropriate and cruel requests, so I can focus on the best thing that’s ever happened to me, my little boy. In America, ‘right’ is only who has the best lawyers and ‘wrong’ is who couldn’t afford them. He has never had anyone stand up to him before, and frankly, he's just an angry and thoroughly selfish person without morals or remorse. I need to try and stand up to him, and keep my beautiful and innocent son safe.

story:
Every day, Puente helps families fight back against detention and deportation.

We need your help to buy a van, so that we can bring more people to visit their loved ones in detention while they fight to build community power against deportations.

Donating to help us buy a van is a powerful way you can stand with us to say #Not1More!

When people are arrested in Phoenix, they are often held at Eloy Detention Center, an hour away from Phoenix, while they fight their deportation cases.

Many people are unable to visit their family members while they are in detention, for many reasons: because they don't have gas money or driver's licenses, or because they are scared to go to an ICE facility because they don't have papers. 

Every weekend, we bring people to detention centers to visit their loved ones, so that families can stay connected and strong while they fight back against the deportation monster.  But we don't have space in our cars anymore, to bring all the people who want to travel with us to Eloy.

By bringing families to visit their loved ones together, people also build solidarity and support with each other, as they see they are not alone in struggling with the trauma and hardship of detention.

We need your help to raise $10,000 so that we can support families in staying connected to their loved ones while they fight deportation and detention. 

Our community is stronger than the walls that try to keep us apart.  Please show your support by donating to help us buy a van today.

story:
Armored Earth  is a vision that has been several years in the making. It has now become a reality! This money would help me to buy heavy equipment needed to keep up with demand. This will also help me hire people who are currently unemployed and looking for construction work. The Industry was hit hard in recent years due to recession. I was one of those hit and lost everything, including the track loader in the above picture. To top that off I lost my Dad to cancer. Due to all of this I do not have sufficient credit to acquire the necessary equipment needed. This size loader is hard to find from a rental company and if you can find one they cost way too much to rent which is why I would like to buy a good used one to start off again. The Segmental Retaining Wall Industry is starting to make a comeback with new construction on the horizon. Now my phone won't quit ringing with jobs for me to do.I came up with the name Armored Earth because it explains our mission in two words. We armor the earth by keeping it in its place! I have always had a passion for building retaining walls. I have over 25 years experience in the industry and continue to improve my business skills by knowing what mistakes to avoid and continuing to gain knowledge in all areas of business and construction management. I have a couple of charities that I am  really passionate about and would be able to donate to them as a form of thanks from my donors. Please help spread the word and share my story. Use the indiegogo share tools.

This trench roller is one of the pieces of equipment that is needed to construct a wall. They cost $33,000.00 new. I just need to find a good used one with the funds raised.


Below is a wall being built, the base course is the most important 1st step in building a wall. 

How can I give back?

I am a Freemason and we support the Masonic Children's Home . I would be able to donate .05 cents per square foot of block as a way of giving back and helping this home.  We project to do at least 30,000-50,000 block within the next year. This will require equipment and man-power. I look forward to putting people back to work.

Thank you for your donations and support! Please share this story with your connections, even if you cannot contribute monetarily.

Eddy

story:
A Treasure Hunt for Good

The Cash Stash is a community-driven scavenger hunt dedicated to promoting the stories of animals in need of adoption at local animal shelters. By contributing to this campaign, you will help us to bring this fun and actionable event around the country, and ultimately help local shelter animals find their forever homes! (Note: If you are participating in this Saturday's (11/8) Cash Stash event in Nashua, sign up for email alerts here).

How it Works

We’ll be hiding cash in cities all across the east coast of the United States. When people find this cash, they’ll also find the picture and story of a shelter animal currently up for adoption. 

         

When someone finds the picture of a shelter animal and shares it on Facebook, VidFall makes a matching donation to the local shelter where the animal lives!

                                 


Our Goal - Get as many animals adopted as we can!

The donations provided through this campaign will allow us to take the event to bigger cities and help a much larger number of animals get adopted. As winter approaches, it’s important to help the strays who may not make it through the cold. 

Here’s our list of cities, and we’ll be adding new cities if we reach our $10,000 goal!

  • Manchester, NH - September 18th, 2014 - SUCCESS!
  • Nashua, NH - November 8th, 2014 ($1,000 Raised) SUCCESS!
  • Boston, MA - Spring, 2015 ($2,500 Raised)
  • Baltimore, MD - Spring, 2015 ($3,500 Raised)
  • Manchester, NH - Spring, 2015 ($6,000 Raised)
  • New York City, NY - Spring, 2015 ($10,000 Raised)
  • Your City? - Spring, 2015 ($15,000 Raised)


Why do people love Cash Stash

1. We're lending a helping hand to animals in need.

In each cash-filled envelope, we hide the story of an animal in need of adoption. When someone finds the envelope, we unlock the power of social sharing by asking participants to post the story online in hopes of finding forever homes for the animals. Please read the story above about two soul-mates, Roy and Libby! 


2. Cash drives action!

We want to motivate everyone to go out and support their local animal shelter, so all of the cash-filled envelopes will have prizes that range from $5 to $50. The more cash we can hide, the more motivation there will be for everyone to participate in our treasure hunt to get animals adopted!

   


3. It's fun and exciting to hunt for clues!

A large part of the excitement is figuring out where the cash is hidden. We do our best to make the treasure hunt as fun and as family friendly as possible. Although we can’t guarantee everyone will win a prize, we can promise you will have a fun time searching. Watch one of clue videos from Manchester, below.

   


The Perks (Hey, what's in it for me?!) 

Supporting this Indiegogo campaign means supporting the countless shelters across the country that are underfunded and overcrowded.

Donations will allow us to make our events bigger and increase the number of shelter animals shared online. The social media sharing that’s intrinsic to the Cash Stash is key – And your help could single-handedly get an animal adopted!

Many of our perk packages revolve around sponsoring a specific number of animals. These packages will cover the amount of cash hidden with the animals' stories, as well as matching donations to animal shelters.

Along with the ability to sponsor animals, we’re making available Treasure Hunting T-Shirts (featuring Pirate, the puppy - see below!), 2015 calendars featuring kittens and puppies, and even the opportunity to bring the Cash Stash fundraiser to your city! 


All perks come with early access to clues for finding cash at the Cash Stash events, and also VF Rewards Points that you can use to discount prices VidFall.com. For more information about these prize packs, please view our perks section to the right. Please reach out to info@vidfall.com with any perk-related questions! 


Why we know this will work!

Our first event in Manchester, NH was a huge success. Not only did we raise money for the shelter, but we also helped share the story of animals that soon after got adopted. Over 500 Manchester residents participated in the treasure hunt for cash, and hundreds of dollars were donated to the Manchester Animal Shelter!

We know there are countless animals around the country that need our help, and with your assistance, we can help create a better life for many of them!



Other ways you can help.

Share, share, share! Each day, we will be sharing the stories of animals that need forever homes. We understand that not everyone has money to contribute, but everyone has a voice. To help us, please:

·  Share this Indiegogo campaign page on social media.

·  Follow VidFall on Facebook and share our posts of animals.

·  Reach out to your local animal shelter and tell them about this campaign (as hard as we’re trying, we can’t contact every shelter in the country!).

If you help us with these things, you can be just as powerful as a big donor. You never know what a share can lead to. So please take the time to share this with your animal-loving friends!


More About Us

   


VidFall is an auction website dedicated to giving back to the community by providing huge discounts. We’re able to create these huge discounts by drawing people together to watch video ads, then using the money advertisers pay us to discount the price of the product up for sale.

VidFall has been featured as a Reddit /r/startups Startup of the Month, on the front page of Y Combinator's Hacker News, and the first place winner in the Rochester, NH Startup 2014 Contest.

Try VidFall today! 

                               


Contact Us

For general questions and assistance, please contact info@VidFall.com. For press inquiries, please email Steve@VidFall.com. We will get back to you as soon as we can.
story_txt:
A Treasure Hunt for Good

The Cash Stash is a community-driven scavenger hunt dedicated to promoting the stories of animals in need of adoption at local animal shelters. By contributing to this campaign, you will help us to bring this fun and actionable event around the country, and ultimately help local shelter animals find their forever homes! (Note: If you are participating in this Saturday's (11/8) Cash Stash event in Nashua, sign up for email alerts here).

How it Works
We’ll be hiding cash in cities all across the east coast of the United States. When people find this cash, they’ll also find the picture and story of a shelter animal currently up for adoption. 
         
When someone finds the picture of a shelter animal and shares it on Facebook, VidFall makes a matching donation to the local shelter where the animal lives!

                                 
Our Goal - 
Get as many animals adopted as we can!


The donations provided through this campaign will allow us to take the event to bigger cities and help a much larger number of animals get adopted. As winter approaches, it’s important to help the strays who may not make it through the cold. 
Here’s our list of cities, and we’ll be adding new cities if we reach our $10,000 goal!



Manchester, NH - September 18th, 2014 - SUCCESS!


Nashua, NH - November 8th, 2014 ($1,000 Raised) SUCCESS!


Boston, MA - Spring, 2015 ($2,500 Raised)


Baltimore, MD - Spring, 2015 ($3,500 Raised)


Manchester, NH - Spring, 2015 ($6,000 Raised)


New York City, NY - Spring, 2015 ($10,000 Raised)

Your City? - Spring, 2015 ($15,000 Raised)







Why do people love Cash Stash

1. We're lending a helping hand to animals in need.


In each cash-filled envelope, we hide the story of an animal in
need of adoption. When someone finds the envelope, we unlock the power of
social sharing by asking participants to post the story online in hopes of
finding forever homes for the animals. Please read the story above about
two soul-mates, Roy and Libby! 




2. Cash drives action!


We want to motivate everyone
to go out and support their local animal shelter, so all of the cash-filled envelopes
will have prizes that range from $5 to $50. The more cash we can hide, the more
motivation there will be for everyone to participate in our treasure hunt to get animals adopted!
   



3. It's fun and exciting to hunt for clues!

A large part of the excitement is figuring out where the cash is hidden. We do our best to make the treasure hunt as fun and as family friendly as possible. Although we can’t guarantee everyone will win a prize, we can promise you will have a fun time searching. Watch one of clue videos from Manchester, below.
   

The Perks (Hey, what's in it for me?!) 



Supporting this Indiegogo campaign means supporting the
countless shelters across the country that are underfunded and overcrowded. 
Donations will allow us to make our events bigger and increase
the number of shelter animals shared online. The social media sharing that’s
intrinsic to the Cash Stash is key – And your help could single-handedly get an
animal adopted! 
Many of our perk packages revolve around sponsoring a specific number of animals. These packages will cover the amount of cash hidden with the animals' stories, as well as matching donations to animal shelters.
Along with the ability to sponsor animals, we’re making available Treasure
Hunting T-Shirts (featuring Pirate, the puppy - see below!), 2015 calendars featuring kittens and puppies, and
even the opportunity to bring the Cash Stash fundraiser to your city! 



All perks come with early access to clues for finding cash at the Cash Stash events,
and also VF Rewards Points that you can use to discount prices VidFall.com. For
more information about these prize packs, please view our perks section to the right.
Please reach out to info@vidfall.com with any perk-related questions! 


Why we know this will work!

Our first event in Manchester, NH was a huge success. Not only did we raise money for the shelter, but we also helped share the story of animals that soon after got adopted. Over 500 Manchester residents participated in the treasure hunt for cash, and hundreds of dollars were donated to the Manchester Animal Shelter!
We know there are countless animals around the country that need our help, and with your assistance, we can help create a better life for many of them!








Other ways you can help.
 

Share, share, share! Each day, we will
be sharing the stories of animals that need forever homes. We understand that
not everyone has money to contribute, but everyone has a voice. To help us,
please:
·  Share
this Indiegogo campaign page on social media.
·  Follow
VidFall on Facebook and share our posts of animals.
·  Reach out
to your local animal shelter and tell them about this campaign (as hard as
we’re trying, we can’t contact every shelter in the country!).
If you help us with these things, you can be just as powerful as
a big donor. You never know what a share can lead to. So please take the time
to share this with your animal-loving friends!

community by providing huge discounts. We’re able to create these huge

advertisers pay us to discount the price of the product up for sale. 
VidFall has been featured as a Reddit /r/startups Startup of the
Month, on the front page of Y Combinator's Hacker News, and the first place
winner in the Rochester, NH Startup 2014 Contest.

story:
Stacey's Sweets is the amazing Cookie Empire that I started in December 2012.  This company was born of passion and necessity and has become more than I could have ever dreamed!  I've always loved to bake for people because it's a wonderful way to spread love and kindness.   Stacey's Sweets didn't start until I was 41 and now I finally know what I'm supposed to be when I grow up ... SUGAR MOMMA to the WORLD!
     I'm amazed with the Sugar Baby Angels that come into my life on a daily basis that truly want to help me and see me succeed.   The blessing and curse of not having deep pockets is that I can't grow too quickly but I also can't afford my next move, without your help.  Many people have asked me to open a store front, that was never my vision or intention.  My personality isn't stagnant and I would get bored staying in one place.  When my close friend suggested I get a Cookie Truck, I knew that was my next move.  That's why I'm CROWD FUNDING! 
     Stacey's Sweets has always  been a grassroots business, right from the start.  This company wouldn't be where it is without my supporters and friends that have helped me every step of the way.  Don't get me wrong, I work my tail off, day and night, but I wanted this Cookie Truck to represent how many people have stood along side me through this Cookie Journey of mine.  My vision is to have the whole back side of the truck be a reflection of my Sugar Baby Angels.  That's where the PERKS come in.  Imagine having your name, family name, picture, biz logo on Stacey's Sweets FIRST Cookie Truck for everyone to see!
     This first truck will be small and cozy.  It will be equipped with a kitchen that can bake on the go and keep my Cookies safe until consumed by my Sugar Babies.  The idea of traveling around and sharing Stacey's Sweets gives me chills!  The opportunities are endless, think ice cream truck but MUCH cuter and more fun and yummier.
     A lot of thought has gone into this campaign and the Perks assigned to the different contribution levels.  I hope you will find them fun, enticing and full of things that you can't live without!  Thank you for helping me realize my dreams of building my empire, one cookie at a time.

 How will the donations be used (all approximations):
  1.      Empty Box Truck $6,500
  2.      Outfit the inside with a mobile kitchen (oven, fridge, etc) $10,000
  3.      Wrap the outside of the truck with logo and sponsors $4,000
  4.      Design of outside of truck $1,500
  5.      City of Houston and Harris County inspections for 1 year $1,500
  6.      Balance of donations will be used to pay other unforeseen expenses,    insurance on truck, finish overhaul of website to represent new branding and easier ordering, outsource label production, buy ingredients in bulk and store them safely (stop paying retail), and grow faster than I could have otherwise!  If this campaign is wildly successful, it will be a game changer in the future of Stacey's Sweets!  I can start on my Pet Treat line sooner than I thought and grow, grow, grow!
THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU!  EVERY penny counts and I couldn't do this without your support. 
IMPORTANT:  BIZ Logos have been increased in size to 10"x10" for $500.

Peace, Love & Cookies
Sugar Momma Stacey

story:
Here's The Deal...

We are genuine artisans in Vermont who labor lovingly in the business niche known as craft chocolate. Doing business as Middlebury Chocolates, we make chocolate straight from directly traded cacao beans, and we use this fresh chocolate to create some of the finest of chocolate bars and confections. All of our chocolate products are truly luxurious, made in small batches from the finest ingredients available.

We founded our business in February of 2010 and a few months later launched a small chocolate café. The following year, we began producing our own chocolate, and quickly outgrew our tiny kitchen space. We have moved twice to enhance our production capabilities, most recently in February 2013, but in doing so we sacrificed our small café business.

Now, effective July 1, 2014, we are leasing a beautiful, commercial space in downtown Middlebury, next to a picturesque waterfall; the river runs underneath and next to the building! We expect that the special qualities of this leased space, combined with our extraordinary products and our hard work, will produce a wonderful, economically successful business.

Middlebury is one of the most economically healthy and culturally rich small towns in Vermont. In our new location, we’ll be benefitting from, and contributing to, the vitality of the downtown business district.

We are excited—almost ecstatic!—about bringing our chocolate café and dessert lounge back to downtown Middlebury!



{a view of our new location, overlooking the Otter Creek falls}


What We Need & What You Get...

We are self-sufficient already as producers of super-premium chocolates. What we need now is additional money to enable us to open the café and dessert lounge in a timely fashion. With your help, we can have them open by October 1.

Here is what we need:

  • A functional POS system and cash register, with software for tracking inventory for both retail and wholesale accounts.

  • Signage and accent lighting.

  • Indoor and outdoor tables and chairs for the café.

  • An additional grinder that makes chocolate from cacao beans, which will allow us to greatly increase our chocolate.

  • An additional chocolate tempering machine, which will allow us to produce confections and specialty desserts without interfering with our production of chocolate bars.

  • A beverage dispenser for homemade sodas, root beer floats, and hopefully the hosting of some special local brews in the future.

  • A major upgrade of our website, <middleburychocolates.com>.

{a peak inside our new space}


What Difference This Will Make...

We have been sharing production space with our kind friends at Daily Chocolate, which is located in the tiny city of Vergennes, near Middlebury. This arrangement doesn’t give us enough space and time. In Vergennes we can produce just enough chocolate bars to supply our existing 26 wholesale accounts.

When we move our production into our new space during the month of July, our production capacity will increase by 40% almost immediately. Our goal is to double production and sales by the end of this year, so it is key that we continue adding necessary equipment to achieve these goals.

When our café-and-dessert lounge is up and running, it will provide:

  • Steady employment for three to five local residents.

  • A place to go that serves the social and [dietary] needs of many Middlebury area residents and visitors. Our dessert lounge will be an amazing place to hang out and decompress—especially on Thursday, Friday and Saturday evenings.

  • Improvement of local foot traffic and commerce, benefitting the downtown business community.

{Dark Chocolate Truffles with Violet Balsamic and Elderflowers}


Other Ways You Can Help...

Share this campaign with your friends and family, and spread the word about our move back to downtown Middlebury. We at Middlebury Chocolates thank you all for your support, and we look forward to providing you with exquisite products.


{a collection of our craft chocolate bars in a stamped cotton gift bag}


Rewards...

Most of the rewards are pretty straightforward, but here are some extra details.

>>>>>

Single Batch Chocolate will be produced exclusively for this Indiegogo campaign, made from a particularly exceptional micro-lot of Venezuelan Patanemo cacao. This batch will be like nothing you have ever experienced before—the beans will be lightly wood-fire roasted, mellowed for 10 days in cocoa ash, then winnowed, crushed, and ground at a low temperature for 7 to 10 days. It will then be left to rest for 20 to 30 days before being tempered and moulded. The percentage is yet to be determined but will likely fall in the 80% range. These bars will be 2.0 ounces (57 grams) and will be delivered in custom keepsake packaging, signed by the chocolate maker. (UPDATE: the chocolate is currently in the grinder, and will have a final percentage of 86%, using only maple sugar from a particularly amazing harvest from our friends at Little Hogback Farm - it is incredibly mild maple sugar with aromas of vanilla and cinnamon.)

>>>>>

Gift Cards can be redeemed in our new downtown Middlebury location or on our website, and are valid for 24 months. A gift card can be used to purchase anything that we will be offering to the public, including desserts, chocolate products, confections, coffee products, and non-food merchandise such as mugs and clothing.

>>>>>

Chocolate Subscriptions can be gifted to anybody you like (including yourself!), with shipping included anywhere in the continental USA. For addresses outside of the 48 contiguous states, please contact us beforehand to verify any additional shipping charges.

>>>>>

Signature Bars can be created in your honor, a loved one's honor, or simply to promote an idea or business. ALL signature bars must be green-lighted by us, and cannot contain any politically biased, overtly religious, offensive or otherwise inappropriate content. Other than that, we will work with you to create an utterly delicious and unique chocolate bar for a once-in-a-lifetime experience!



{a great example of one of our custom creations}


Chupacabra - maple, habanero, vanilla, sea salt
"Stunningly warm & antique oak scent presages salted caramel on the tongue, then some maple goodness sweetening a kindling pepper at the back... never raging though never shy either... as much flavor as heat, especially since abundant butter cools whatever flames threaten to get out of control; a masterful production of thermo-chocodynamics on the edge."
-Mark Christian, the C-Spot, www.c-spot.com

"Companies such as Middlebury are exactly where we should be looking to for our chocolate."  -Lee McCoy, www.chocolatiers.co.uk

story:
Short Summary

Despite global progress in the campaign to address the challenge of HIV/AIDS, Uganda still ranks higher on world HIV/AIDS prevalence list. According to UNAIDS 2013 Uganda HIV and AIDS Country Progress report that was published in March this year, Between 2007 and 2013, the estimated number of people living with HIV increased from 1.2 million to 1.6million. While other countries continue to experience diminishing statistics, results indicate an increase in the rate of infection in Uganda.

HIV/AIDS prevalence rates are on the increase in rural areas of Uganda due to lack of access to interventions available to urban dwellers. Last year I lost a family member and three friends to HIV/AIDS and the major cause was lack of access to treatment and early intervention, a reason why I contacted fellow Directors at Face of Hope International USA to create this project “The Mobile HIV/AIDS Clinic” which is intended to partner with AHF Uganda Cares to take HIV/AIDS services closer to people in rural areas with this mobile HIV/AIDS clinic. The Ambulance will stocked with supplies and health professionals will go deep to villages and provide free testing, counseling, and IRVs, and make follow-up with those who need advanced treatment.

Face of Hope International bidded for the Ambulance on Auction International and won the bid at a cost of $3,078.00. We received approval of the bid and we have 10 working days to pay for this spacious, well equipped Ambulance that will be shipped to Uganda and managed by Face of Hope International Uganda to provide HIV/AIDS services where they are much needed (See the invoice and other photos in Gallery) 

Please consider a donation of any amount to help us raise $3,078.00 needed to pay for this Ambulance (HIV/AIDS Mobile Clinic) that will invaluably help thousands to access HIV/AIDS services.

The Impact

The Mobile HIV/AIDS Clinic will help to contain HIV/AIDS infections by providing free testing and counseling services to those who otherwise would have no access; reduce HIV/AIDS mortality by providing ARVs.

Risks & Challenges

We have a very short time (10 business days) to raise this amount, but I believe there millions of people out there who are so passionate about helping and being a blessing in others lives.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also get involved by telling family and friends with a passion for serving underserved populations to help raise needed funds for this project. Excess funds out of this fundraiser will be used towards shipping costs after the Mobile Clinic is purchased.

NOTE:

Face of Hope International USA is a 501(c)3 Organization. EIN: 46-1398141, all your donations will be tax deductible.

 The ImpactThe Mobile HIV/AIDS Clinic will help to contain HIV/AIDS infections by providing free testing and counseling services to those who otherwise would have no access; reduce HIV/AIDS mortality by providing ARVs. 
  Risks & ChallengesWe have a very short time (10 business days) to raise this amount, but I believe there millions of people out there who are so passionate about helping and being a blessing in others lives.
  Other Ways You Can HelpYou can also get involved by telling family and friends with a passion for serving underserved populations to help raise needed funds for this project. Excess funds out of this fundraiser will be used towards shipping costs after the Mobile Clinic is purchased.NOTE:Face of Hope International USA is a 501(c)3 Organization. EIN: 46-1398141, all your donations will be tax deductible.

story:
We're ColoRADogs and we want you to help us make a difference for dogs and their people!


We are a 501C3 group based out of Fort Collins, Colorado but wandering all over this great state. We're sure you've heard about Fort Collins being number one on all sorts of lists. What they don't talk about is the need for resources for dogs and their people all over this state.

We've been in this gig in CO since June 2012. We're known for our outreach and advocacy, as of lately the ballot measure in Aurora to repeal BSL,  and while we do a bit of rescue (mostly large scale dog fight busts and those big headed dogs people like to call "pit bulls") we are most passionate about keeping dogs with their loving people whenever that is possible. You might be surprised how often we can succeed in doing just that!

We have a tag line at ColoRADogs. We say, "Responsible Ownership is Not Breed Specific." But neither is income level, whether you have a home, or any of the million other variables we measure our fellow man by. 

The number ONE issue we hear from people we help is that they can't get to available resources. Whether they live way out in rural areas, don't have available transportation, can't provide the sometimes daunting paperwork requested, or in some cases, suffer from mental illness that makes them fearful of judgement or mistrusting of people. The reality is that needs are not being met and that person's friend, sometimes the only friend they have, is suffering. 

Your contribution to this project will save lives. We're going out to the streets and meeting people where they live. No more worrying whether or not they will be able to find help in hard times. No forms, and NO judgement. We're passing out resources and hope! 

As lame as it sounds, we need your help to make this happen. Let's keep dogs and their people together and prevent someone's best friend from being relinquished to a shelter for something as little as just not having enough food.

What We Need & What You Get

We need a trailer. Our poor little truck and her shell just don't have enough room. 

Here are some FAQs:

Why do you need a trailer?

Our truck is small, and even with a shell she just does not hold enough supplies for what we’d like to do. But she can tow a trailer just fine.

Why THAT trailer?

We chose that trailer based on the width and depth, plus the weight. It will allow us to carry a ton of food and supplies. The height allows us to walk into it and avoid bumped heads and possible injuries as we walk in and out. The double doors on the back and the side allow both easy access and ability to go out in the elements without opening a ramp and letting snow, rain, heavy winds in.

Where do you plan on taking supplies and to whom?

All over Colorado wherever we’re needed. To the homeless and under served. In areas where resource islands exist. To rural shelters who are struggling to feed dogs. We are going where the need takes us.

What are you going to carry?

Food, leashes, collars and bowls. Crates, blankets and beds. Yearly vaccinations (not including rabies unless a Vet wants to ride alongJ). Microchips, flea treatment, toys and most of all HOPE! If you think we should have something on there, let us know or go to the wish list we’ll be posting and put it on there! We’ll make sure it’s offered.

Why? Why are you doing this?

The number one reason we hear from people in need is that they can’t access resources for their pets. Whether they are in a rural area, have no access to transportation, live where there are simply no available services or are unable to provide the sometimes-incredible amount of “proof” required to access those services. The end result is the person and their dog suffers. Oftentimes, resources scarcity can mean the difference between being able to keep a dog out of the shelter, and relinquishing them.

    The Impact

    This resource wagon will literally make difference between life and death for a whole lotta four-legged best friends. You'll be able to follow along on FB as the moment we've funded the trailer she's going to have her own page and post her adventures.

    Risks & Challenges

    There is little risk. We know this gig. We lived in Fresno, CA in one of the most underserved and pet loving neighborhoods for 19 years. We've always found ways to help people who needed it for their dogs. We've got the truck, the tow hitch and the passion. We just need the trailer.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you can't help by donating, please share out and ask for people to help support our campaign. Then find a person who needs help in your community to keep their dog, and offer them hope.

story:
About me...

I found the courage to leave my abusive husband just under two years ago, in that time I have had another child and rebuilt emotionally but not financially. 


We had run a business together that when I left I was locked out of, I was given the legal choice of funding either to fight for possessions or access to my children, (when I left I decided they were better off with a roof over their head than homeless like I was) so I chose the children and left with a lot of debt, a car and my clothes. 

Through 18 months of courts we now have shared care of our two beautiful children Jack and Selina and absolutely no contact with each other,  and I have Layla to my new partner. 

Now that I am settled into a new life, I want to secure a financial future for my children.  Up until now we have been supported by our government and we could continue to be, but I want to set a better example. 

With young children I was searching for a work from home option and have a business idea selling promotional and humorous products for everyone from businesses to children's parties, a select line of products that has numerous possibilities in our local area and world wide. I have saved enough for a website, business cards, etc, however I need a little more help.


Your $5.00 donation can make my dreams come true, that's less than a cup of coffee.

Why do I want to work from home with my children, being there for them through what could soon be a very trying time is vitally important to the grieving process.  (I have heard that my ex-husband has cancer) I don't have proof but I have seen him recently and he certainly looks ill).   I want to grow strong, confident children that know the world is there oyster.


The machine and enough components to get started is $550

What your donation will help do is

  • Purchase of machine and components.
  • In return for your help I am of course offering perks.  I will have a website up and running that every donation will receive a thank you on it as well as on social media.  The link back from a blog post is great to boost your Google ranking, don't have a business or website yourself why not nominate a friend that works from home or a charity your passionate about. 
  • I will be grateful to make goal, so I am very flexible on perks, ask me if you would like a little more bang for your buck so to speak.  I will be emailing everyone personally.   If I don't reach complete target it will get me the machine quicker.
  • If we make more than target it will allow me to expand sooner.
  • I believe in karma so I will pay it forward.

The Impact

The impact reaching goal will have on my family will be amazing setting the example that no matter what you have gone through you can bounce back.


I inherently believe good people are out there that want to make a difference, and I am one of them.  I only need 300 people to donate the $2.00 to reach target, can you do it?


      Other Ways You Can Help

      Please help by sharing the word, even if your not donating, sharing is appreciated, thank you for your time.

story:
Our Campaign:

We are seeking contributions to fund a project that will provide accessible clean drinking water, as well as empower underprivileged sections of the community. There are eighteen families who do not have access to clean water in their homes. Drinking unsafe water and lack of basic sanitation can cause sickness and disease. Many people in the community, usually women and children, walk hours each day to fetch "clean" water, that is likely to make them sick.

Our Background:

Wasandi Foundation is a community-based organization focused on on bio-gas and water filtration projects. Starting in May 2009, our founder, Dr. Abdul Khalique provided the funding which has allowed Wasandi to build bio-gas plants in different villages of Sind Pakistan. The Wasandi Foundation has also distributed many bio-sand water filters in different areas. In April 2010 we launched the Wasandi Savings and Loan. Our mission is to break the Cycle of Poverty in our area by providing loans to people who otherwise are not able to raise funds or get loans from any other financial institution in the country. Most recently, we have started to focus on organic farming. We have planted three acres of sugarcane crop as a test case while instructing the community to learn the process in order to be self-sustaining. Our goal is to have farmers using organic fertilizer for their crops within 12-18 months.

What will the funds be use for?  

 Our plan is to construct:

One concrete water tank for eighteen families (Total Cost- $2,776)

One Solar powered water pump (Total Cost- $1,680)

1,000-foot pipeline and outlet plumbing to provide water in homes (Total Cost- $806)

TOTAL EXPENSES:  $5262

How can I track the project’s progress?

We will let you know all activities from start to finish on our Facebook page.

The image below is from Google Earth and shows the location we will be working on. Upon completion of our fundraising campaign, it will only take two months to finish the project. When Google Earth updates their images, our 20 foot water tank will be visible where noted.

In the image we have tried to let you know what actually will happen on the site. Red arrows indicate where the water tank and solar water pump will be installed. The yellow lines indicate the water supply line from the water tank to houses. This way all eighteen families will have easy access to water. As you can see in our video, women and children are fetching water from the pond noted in this image.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can spread the word about our campaign to your friends.

story:
So What's This All About? 

As many of you reading this know, I have spent the better portion of a year (August 2013 - present) in the country of South Sudan as a Salesian Lay Missioner working with the Salesians of Don Bosco to educate and form the youth into Christ-like people. It's been a beautiful journey and I cannot express what it has done for me and how much I gained from the people, the culture, and the community I spent my time with. You can read about some of my journey and see some photos and videos here: All of South Sudan, Bless the Lord!

But a year of service has its downsides, mainly financially -- In other words, I am coming home broke.

You are probably thinking, "Mike, are you really trying to raise money now for your personal expenses? Didn't you understand that when you signed up for mission work?" Yes, I am, and you are completely right, I should have! But that is only half of the story, so don't judge too quickly. I plan on tithing back any and all money I make to the Church once I find a job. Until I have a job, though, I know I will have to borrow money from my family (if not my friends) until I have a paycheck. So don't think of it as me begging for money as a pauper, but as a pauper who will eventually give back all that he has been given once he is able. 


That's Nice, But Still...

I know our culture. So, better than just donating money to me because you love me (or appreciate what I did for a year), I want to give you some incentives. So, I have listed the possibilities under the perks section.


The Impact

In the end, you help out so many people: a friend, the Church, and hopefully yourself if you like me enough to be motivated by one of the perks. 

You also put the money to be tithed in trustworthy hands. I seriously have 1 million ideas of where to specifically put it, mostly involving the Church in South Sudan, and have the contacts (priests and religious) here to make sure it actually is used well (... let's just say I have a good idea of money being misused when donated to NGOs and the UN... sorry, it's just the truth).

Also, the impact can be seen in the universality of the Church. It's communal and cyclical; I receive money from you who then gives it to the Church who then gives it to those they serve which happens to be you and me. In a way, the money never left the Church! I will also pray for you who help me get back on my feet, which again shows the universality of the Church. Our prayers connect us and make us one. I can support you wherever I am in the world, and vice versa; hence, Catholic.

God is good, all the time! All the time, God is good and that is His nature WOW!


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell others about my story and how they can participate!
  • Pray for me, the Church, and especially for South Sudan.
  • Tell people about the plight of South Sudan and bring awareness to the suffering in Africa, especially Sub-Saharan. Lack of peace and more suffering than is imaginable can be seen in the Congo, Central African Republic, and many other countries. 
  • Participate in the community around you: the Church as well as the common, sharing Christ not only in word but in deed. "Faith without works in dead." (Js 2:17) Thus you represent what the Church is - not a pretty, closed up box, but an open book with many pages left to be written in. 
  • Finally: Donate a car to me! Haha, only kidding! (But if you seriously have one or know someone who can help, let me know)

story:
Save the Silver Bullet Fund

We all know and love Jenalea's Hyundai Elantra. For most of us, it's been around since the beginning. If you think about it, the Silver Bullet has been a friend to us all over the years. It was there on the 5 year reunion trip to Frankfort, Kansas to hang out with the Stauffers. It was there that time we played air guitar on our way to see the Suppes family in BFE. Hell, I remember when my neighbor had to push the Silver Bullet out of my driveway in the snow.

    If you haven't had a memory with the Silver Bullet yet, it's not too late. Donate some cash and plan some memories.

    What We Need & What You Get

    The Silver Bullet is in desperate need of some fine-tuning. Specifically, it needs to have some work done to the suspension so that she can be rockin' and rollin' for our next road trip. In addition, she needs four new beautiful black high heels (AKA tires) for her next dance. 

    With your help, the Silver Bullet can be as good as new with $1,000 worth of plastic surgery.

      Why Now?

      Jenalea's birthday is this weekend. So, in lieu of gifts, we ask for donations toward the Save the Silver Bullet Fund. No gift is too small or too large. If you don't feel that you can contribute in any way, that's fine, too. We're all broke..or else we wouldn't be doing this to begin with.

      Awards

      People love awards. Even if the awards are shit. So, we've come up with some designations for all of you generous friends of the Silver Bullet. Once you make your gift, you'll receive a commemorative certificate of your generosity for the following levels:

      • $5 - I love Jen, but I have my own shit to pay for.
      • $6-10 - Eh, I got some spare change for a pretty lady.
      • $11-25 - Jen’s good people, I’ll give a little extra dough.
      • $26-50 - A girl should get at least her age worth of cash!
      • $51 + - Jen’s frickin amazing, I’d give my last beer on a hot day.

story:
Short Summary

Small business with experience in the profession

  • The idea for this service created itself by the annoyance IT service providers give costumers in Belgium.
  • Prices are too high, the service provided isn't what it should be and a lot of lies are being told.
  • By contributing you will help us take over a large part of this service, providing good quality parts, and excellent service & repairs, at an honest price.
  • We start with Media Markt Gent, most devices get send to big corporate companies with only profit in mind. Repairs take weeks and service is bad & expensive.

Roughly 60% of devices that are send in for service are 'Out of Warranty'. The client has to wait up to 3 weeks before getting their devices back, at a high price, not known in advance.

We take over all these repairs, repair time is cut back to a maximum of 2 days, plus the client knows the price in advance & gets another 6 months of warranty on the service.

What We Need & What You Get

How will we spend the funds:

  • In order to start this service the way it should be, we have to acquire around € 7500. 
  • The funds will be used to cover some of the expenses we need to make;
  • 50% of the funds WILL be donated to charity!
  • This includes part of the start-up expenses, professional tools and parts.
  • We work with the biggest multimedia company on the Belgium market.
  • We will work with schools, providing training & support to students & teachers.
  • Should we not meet our goal, the funds raised will all go to charity (chosen by the contributors). Because, without it, we can't start at all.

The Impact

  • We no longer live in a society that throws away a product when it breaks, we recycle. With this project, even less products will get discarded, causing less waste. Everything that can be used again, will be.
  • If even 1 person doesn't trow away their electronic device, it means less junk.

Risks & Challenges

  • We are in a unique position with a big player on the market. We start with Media Markt Gent and are already talking to several others, hoping to expand to Media Markt Belgium within the first year.
  • Competition is high in this field, but with the service we offer, and by partnering up with Media Markt, we have the opportunity to get to the top of the pile, providing a better service for everyone. 

Show us your support!

  • If you can't contribute but are interested in what we plan to do, please show your support by sharing our project with your friends,family and associates!
  • Please do use the Indiegogo share tools to do this!

Thank you for reading, hope you liked what you saw!

story:
Upa Chair and Desk are suited for use throughout children´s lives concurring their age development with comfort and simple ergonomic requirements. Our products are carefully thought of to support and encourage children development and autonomy. 


  


You guarantee that with Upa Chair and Desk you have a set of furniture that can accompany your child’s growth and adapt to his lifetime needs. If you would rely on fixed sized furniture to guarantee the adequate level of comfort for every stage of your child’s development, it would imply the purchase of 5 to 7 different chairs or desks, being costly and leading to increased levels of waste and space consumption at home. 

By creating a space of its own you are promoting your child’s autonomy and helping him to build his self-confidence, while you are creating an exciting place to learn and grow outside of school. In their private space, children can choose what is important to them, how they will express themselves, how they will manage their things and how they want to spend their time.




UPA Chair and Desk can be adjusted to 5 different levels according with the growth of your child. Both the seat height and depth are adjustable, as long as the backrest height, to allow for a good sitting posture at any age.

They are delivered to your home in flat packs, allowing to cut down on shipping costs and reduce the carbon footprint. At the same time, the packs’ flat shape makes them easier to carry around in your home. 

Our unique design allows for a simplified assembly procedure, including all subsequent adjustments, requiring a minimum of tools either furnished by us or readily available at home.



We guarantee the quality and durability of our products as they are manufactured using sustainably harvested, FSC certified furniture grade plywood. Our manufacturer has been developing personalized carpentry for more than 35 years, in a constant quest for technological leadership and innovation. We produce our pieces with great material efficiency, consistency and high-quality, thanks to the latest C.N.C. (Computer Numerically Controlled) technology. 


Upa chair and desk are finished in natural birch color and white laminate, protected with a water based varnish that is phthalate-free, formaldehyde-free, solvent-free and heavy metal-free. 



Upa chair and desk can be used from 4 years old up to adult age. We follow the European Standard (EN1729) which specifies functional dimensions, related to children’s body dimensions, and chair’s and table’s markings, for educational institutions. 


Poor posture, assumed by children sitting in a chair that is not suitable for their age, can cause discomfort and loss of concentration in the short term and back pain and more serious musculo skeletal disorders in the long term.  Upa furniture is designed to suit a child’s needs at every stage of its life, offering ergonomics and safety along the way. 




As parents of two small boys, we found the need to design high quality, safe and ergonomic furniture, that could be good looking and at the same time accompany our children’s growth.

We felt from the beginning that it’s important for a child to have its own dedicated space to play or study in order to build its self-assurance and autonomy. Upa Chair and Desk create a safe and empowering environment, where children find joy in learning and can train good habits from an early stage in their lives.

As eco-conscious parents we also felt it would make sense to have fittings that can be used for a lifetime. We believe in sustainable, long lasting furniture, that can be passed on for generations.


We have worked on different prototypes before we reached the perfect products. We also performed several safety and ergonomic tests with children of all ages and adults.









Patrícia is a chemical engineer, with an MBA, and an entrepreneur. With an extensive experience in management she is also an assistant professor at the university. She adores writing and reading and is always looking for children’s picture books with great illustrations.

Gonçalo is an architect with a passion for product design. He is the creative mind and the technical brain of the duo. He loves playing the piano, photography and building legos with his kids.



We have already produced a small batch of UPA Chairs and Desks that were very well received from all our users. You too can create a cozy, cheerful space for your kids to study and develop!

We have everything ready to begin production and with your help we can make more children grow healthier, learn independently and think constructively and creatively!

If you like what we are doing, share it on FACEBOOK. It’s a big help for us.



Actual products may not be exactly as shown in the video and photos of this campaign. We are making Upa Chair and Desk even better, therefore products resulting from this campaign will have improvements, namely Upa Chair will have a curved seat for increased ergonomics.

Manufacturing furniture for children is challenging, that's why we decided to partner with a manufacturer that has an installed capacity ready to respond to our requests and the necessary experience to guarantee the highest quality possible.

Our estimates for delivery are conservative and our partnership is reliable but delays may arise from the following: 

  • Sourcing of sustainable harvested FSC plywood
  • Delivery time for screws, nails, fixings and fasteners

We will keep you posted on a weekly basis, and in the event of unexpected situations, we will work hardly to minimize impact on delivery time.

story:
Who Are We & How Did We Get Here?

We are Kate Merrill and Paige Tyler - Chefs and Co-Owners of Edge of Sweetness Bakery located in Edgewater, a lakefront community on the North Side of Chicago.  We met last year while building our individual bakery brands at a local shared kitchen. We instantly connected - sharing a passion for quality homemade baked goods and a dream to own a neighborhood bakery.  It didn't take long for us to merge our existing bakery brands, and Edge of Sweetness was born! 

We quickly identified what we wanted our business to accomplish - and narrowed it down to three overarching goals: 

  1. To create a community bakery and coffee shop where neighbors can come together and enjoy quality baked goods, coffee, and teas. We are dedicated to producing an array of fresh and delicious products, ensuring each customer has a memorable experience that will keep them coming back for more. 
  2. Because we started our baking careers working in a shared kitchen space, it is also important for us to extend our spacious kitchen to other chefs who are starting or building their own culinary businesses.
  3. And as parents, we have a passion for our local community and will actively support causes that promote exercise through school sports programs and healthy eating programs for the children based in the Edgewater neighborhoods. 

Keeping those objectives top of mind, we've worked diligently to fine tune a solid and profitable business plan and select the perfect retail location for Edge of Sweetness. We decided on a 3,200 square foot, corner retail spot with expansive windows and room for an outdoor patio in the warmer months. The spot is the perfect gathering space for Edgewater families, commuters, tourists and "work from home" employees; and is spacious enough to allow for events and parties, as well as cooking classes. And keeping in line with our goals, we also have room for designated shared kitchen spaces where other chefs can have an opportunity to expand their growing businesses, especially throughout the Edgewater community.

But having a solid business plan and finding the perfect empty retail space was only the beginning. We spent this past Summer working  tirelessly on securing the bakery space, and the multitude of city licenses and building permits required to get our bakery going. 

In the meantime, we scoured the city for bakery and coffee equipment - ovens, sinks, coolers, freezers, bakery tables, floor mixers, rolling racks and oh-so-many cookie sheets, cake pans, and whisks - oh my! We met with countless retail vendors- for tables, chairs, counters, display cases, window blinds, lighting, flooring, and shelving! Who knew they even made washable ceiling tiles, let alone required them in a kitchen? Then there were the never-ending interviews with construction contractors, plumbers, and electricians - that all promised they could take all of this stuff and whip it into a working bakery! 

The great news is that Edge of Sweetness in currently under construction and slated to open before the new year!! We have personally invested over $200,000 towards building permits, architectural plans, construction costs and the purchase of bakery equipment. We need your help in getting across the finish line and getting our doors open - not only for ourselves but for the super supportive Edgewater community and the shared kitchen clients that share our space.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our campaign is for $30,000  - which will go towards the cost to purchase and install a stack convection oven and a walk-in cooler/freezer. 
  • We have funded $200,000 on our own, securing all the other equipment and the construction build-out costs, including permits, licenses, and other fees. 
  • For your contributions, you'll be rewarded with valuable and exciting perks including bakery and coffee packages and experiential cooking classes.
  • All funds that are raised will go directly to the purchase of bakery equipment. 
  • The money we've invested gets us 85% there. We need YOU to get us across the finish line!

The Impact

The success of this campaign will not only impact Kate and Paige as business owners, but the Edgewater community and our future customers - who are watching the construction project and cheering us on.

And we can't forget the 6 other businesses waiting for us to open our doors so they can continue to grow their individual businesses in our shared kitchen spaces! And that number will grow as we bring new clients on throughout 2017. And when you add in the community youth outreach programs we will support, it's easy to see the broader reach this campaign will have. The direct impact YOU can make on this community.

It takes a village to build something truly amazing and we are reaching out to YOU, our village, to help get our doors open.

Risks & Challenges

With any business venture there are risks and pitfalls, we have the mindset that we will deal with business matters with integrity and professionalism, staying true to our values and commitment to quality products and service.  We have armed ourselves with the business knowledge and surrounding support systems including family, friends, mentors and professional partnerships.

We never knew the challenges of being women business owners until we began the process of opening our own brick and mortar bakery.  We were initial challenged by the male-dominated field of commercial architecture and construction, until they realized we were tenacious, teachable, and willing to roll up our sleeves and do the dirty work.  We're no longer strangers to a jack hammer, sledge hammer, concrete saw, or shovel! We've been there every step of the way, contributing where we can - all while continuing to expand our bakery clientele. We have a fabulous and collaborative team of contractors who see our passion and vision, and are working diligently to help us make it a reality. 

As strong women, we would like to think we can do everything on our own. But we've learned, the hard way, that we can't do it all. And sometimes you have to ask for help. Amazingly, every time we ask for help, we get an army of assistance. We want to fund this project ourselves, do as much work as possible, and continue to serve our amazing customers.  It has been those amazing customers who have encouraged us to reach out and open ourselves up to "the village" approach! If you join us, we promise to uphold our end of the bargain!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help greatly by expanding our reach through spreading our message, our campaign through social media, media contacts, email friends and family.  Once person can touch so many, lets see how many people we can reach together to make this campaign a success!

story:
Hello, my name is Shavin and I'm a 21-year-old Sri lankan tour guide. 

Tour guiding is one of the greatest blessings of my life.
I share beauty, diversity and adventure with people from around the world.
I love to see the brightness in their eyes when they experience breathtaking landscapes and see indigenous animals they've never seen before.

My profile was created for a down payment on a vehicle that fit my tourism needs to create the best tours possible. 
With my own tourism vehicle I can showcase new places and offer more diverse tours (adventures). 

For transport I've been hiring licensed and insured vehicles suited for tourism.
A few challenges I encounter
-Time restrictions on tours (an occurrence whilst hiring vehicles, they are needed to be picked up & returned at specific times) Thus, less time spent touring.
-Cannot operate small tour groups (4 people and under) vehicle costs are far too expensive.
-Vehicle availability is not guaranteed, thus very limiting.

I'm now at a stage where hiring vehicles regularly, limits me tremendously.

You will certainly impact my life with your donation. No matter the amount you can contribute.
I deeply appreciate your support for this exciting new chapter in my journey!

If you believe in my potential, what I’ve shown, what I’m doing, and me then I especially ask this of you

Thank you for taking the time to read my story. God Bless.

Regards,

Shavin

https://www.facebook.com/shavin7777

story:
The Michelle Wie Tournament of Champions

We are so excited to have Michelle Wie join us as the official ambassador of the Hawaii State Junior Golf Association (HSJGA) Tournament of Champions. The TOC is an annual event that gathers top talents in Hawaii junior golf to the beautiful Wailea Resort in Maui to battle it out for the coveted Tournament of Champions title. Michelle herself won the 15-18 age division in 2002 as a 12 year old! 

Purpose of the event: The Michelle Wie Tournament of Champions will be the key fundraiser for the HSJGA, and the funds will go towards tournament operation costs, new tournament development, and Hawaii youth golf development in general. With the funds raised through this campaign, we would like to start awarding travel scholarships to help our juniors travel inter-island and to the mainland for golf tournaments. These scholarships would allow some extremely talented kids on HSJGA that may lack the resources to cover high travel expenses to compete on the national junior/amateur circuit. 

Michelle Wie's statement: 

HSJGA and I go way back to when I was just a kid who loved to hit the ball a long way. They gave me the opportunity to develop my game and competitive drive in an open, nurturing environment - they really made it possible for me to take my game to the next level. This is my chance to give back to the organization and help the young golfers in Hawaii grow in this game that's given me so much.

Partners:

My good friends at Nike Golf and Kia have already joined me in supporting the event with generous donations which leads me to... 

the Perks: 

By donating to this fundraiser, you will receive cool stuff like:

Custom designed and autographed Kia golf staff bag (that I've used in competition in 2013). It's purple leopard print and my absolute favorite golf bag!

HSJGA and Michelle thank you for your generous donations and please check frequently for pictures and updates from both of us!
