Custom designed and autographed Kia golf staff bag (that I've used in 
competition in 2013). It's purple leopard print and my absolute favorite golf bag!

HSJGA and Michelle thank you for your generous donations and please 
check frequently for pictures and updates from both of 
us!

story:
Hi guys! My name is Cierra and I am currently volunteering at Mombasa, Kenya for the summer with WOFAK (Women Fighting AIDS in Kenya) through DukeEngage, a summer program funded by Duke to send their students all over the world to participate in civic engagement work. It's been a great experience and I am asking for your support as I am trying to do something really impactful here. I am currently starting a pilot project to bring HIV/AIDS testing and basic medical services to unreached slum communities who lack access to even the most basic care, but we lack the financial means to fully implement it. The project will cost $4000, but $3000 is already funded via local resources and organizations (Deutsche Stiftung Weltbevolkerung, Tupange, Dream Achievers Youth Organization, Foundation for Sustainable Development, WOFAK) so I need raise $1000 by August 1st. Money will go towards mobilization for all involved staffs and medical supplies, water and snack supplies during the camp, mobilizers for the community, and airtime for communication. It would be so great if you could support me in this endeavor.

 

A little background

But before anything, a little about the first targeted community... Junda is a slum community of approximately 40,000 people dispersed throughout an area of 10.5 km2. Many of the households, if not all, live in poverty and cannot afford transportation to government medical facilities to receive care because the time they must sacrifice to travel the distance by foot. Also, many of the homes are inaccessible by vehicles. From personal accounts, some have to walk for hours and sometimes, wait for days to finally get any sort of medical care. The consequences: Days of no work, no pay, no dinner.

 

The big project

To address this, I want to implement a one-day pilot-program medical camp called Inuka Uangaze (rise and shine; a saying that lifts up spirits here in Kenya) here in Junda to give the community members free HIV/AIDS-related testing and medical support. Through our partnership with multiple organizations, we will provide medical services (i.e. cervical cancer screening, family planning, HIV/AIDS testing and counseling) and an interactive assembly, where community members will be informed on the importance of their testing and ways to over the feelings associated with the stigma for HIV/AIDS. We will also connect the participants to support groups, community health workers, and organizations based on their needs.

 

Future development

Most medical outreaches choose locations that are convenient for the general population, thus isolating a rather large portion of Kenya’s population. This pilot program, if successful through your support, will be the pioneer and an example for future endeavors in reaching and impacting once unreached slum communities. This camp is not about making a one-time impact; it’s about creating a life-sustaining change for a neglected group of people. At the conclusion of the camp, we will have once unavailable compiled data to present to the government and donors for further funding and interventions.

 

Help us be a blessing

So please help me raise $1000 by August 1st and I will be ever grateful. Any amount will help tremendously. Seriously. I’ll take anything! Anything over our goal will go towards supporting the future of this program. And last but not least, please, share this with your friends and family! Thank you so much!

 

And last but not least... rewards!

Any donations $25 or above will get... 

a personal thank you note and a wonderful group photo of the people you graciously supported. AND, you will get an authentic Masai bracelet (some images below; more can be found at http://goo.gl/Dt8bR). These are vibrant bracelets that surely make you stand out! As you can see, these vary GREATLY so if you have a color/design preference, please let me know via comments and I will try my best to find something that matches that.

Any donations $75 and above will get....

everything from above and an authentic handmade kikoy blanket (image below; more can be found at http://goo.gl/AuWjj).  Soft and thin, they serve as great beach towels, light blanket, or just something to throw over while watching TV. Again, these vary a lot too so if you have a preference, please leave a comment and I will do my best to find something for you!

 

Masai bracelets

 

Kikoy blankets

story:
Update: App ideas now in the Updates available to Backers.

Prime Software

I'm a father of two young boys. Most evenings I can be found playing floor hockey or wrestling in the basement. I've always felt called to leave my specific mark on the world and after having children that calling only grew stronger. I've been a professional software developer for almost 10 years now and want a way to code up my own ideas to set loose on the world. These funds would help cover initial hardware costs, the Apple developer license, and general setup expenses.

Needs

I plan on purchasing a MacBook Pro laptop to allow me to develop anywhere. This gives me opportunities to develop at the park while the kids are playing or on the couch while everyone's trying to fall asleep.

I will need to purchase an Apple developer license. Apple requires each company to acquire a developer license before allowing for apps to be published.

I am going to create a Limited Liability Company (LLC) to become an established, legitimate business.

Perks

  • Access to a blog that details the process of creating Prime Software's first app while balancing family life
  • Listing in the credits of Prime Software's first published app
  • Access to the source code for Prime Software's first published app
  • A signed t-shirt from the development team
  • The gratitude of helping a code monkey live out his dream

The Point

Demonstrate to my boys that if they have a dream they should pursue it and not be afraid to ask for help to achieve it. Provides for a chance for Prime Software to crank out some useful apps and attempt to reach even farther than this basement.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute much there are other things you can do to help Prime Software become a reality:

  • Spread the word and help more people find out about our campaign.
  • Share this page using the provided social media links.
  • Even a $1 would let me know that someone's there and that I'm not just babbling into the Tubes.

story:
Who we are

We are Alison Watterson and Julianne Norman, and together we are the co-founders of Watterson-Dupont Consulting, a newly established non-profit program evaluation consultancy.

Our vision and mission is to bridge the gap between effective grassroots NGOs and donor organizations and see a non-profit sector that is effective, efficient, transparent, and able to justify to donors why they are an invaluable part of their community. We do this by providing free consultancy and program evaluation services to grassroots NGOs who are struggling to secure funding or who wish to improve areas of their organization.


Why do we care?

Approximately 842 million people (one in eight people in the world) do not have enough to eat and suffer from chronic hunger. Each year more than 11 million children die from preventable health issues such as malaria, diarrhea and pneumonia. Over 1.4 billion people live on $1.25 a day or less and 22,000 children die each day due to conditions of poverty. Over 1.7 billion people lack access to clean water and 2.3 people suffer from water-borne diseases each year. 

We aim to ensure that those trying to help and change the world for the better are doing good and doing it well.


What do we need?

We need a website in order for us to be accessible to the grassroots organizations that need our services the most. It will cost us $500 for a website. We are working with a web designer who has offered to design and set up our website at a reduced cost due to our non-profit status.

Once we have a website, we will not only have a global reach and be able to help more non-profits become effective and efficient, but also be able to appeal to donors ourselves! 


Why should you bother to give?

So far we have worked with five grassroots organizations, making a positive impact on their communities, helping them to become more effective and proving to donors the value in their work. Our clients are from around the world, and we have the privilege of having a global impact, from South Africa to Haiti, Cameroon to Iraq.  

We help make the development community more effective and more accountable. We help ensure that those who give donations to help others can be confident that their money is actually making a difference.


How else can you help?

1. Spread the word! Tell other people about us!

2. Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/WattersonDupont

3. Read our blog: http://watterson-dupont.blogspot.com/ 

4. Offer us your expertise: We are always looking for volunteers and people willing to give us a little of their time to help us achieve our goal of making development work better and more effectively.

story:
Hi there

My name is Micky McDonagh and I am a fundraiser for Carping4Heroes.  It is through my support of this fantastic event over the last couple of years, that I have got to know Simon Bangert and his lovely daughter Abi.  The time and effort that they put in to raising funds for our returning injured service personnel is beyond belief.  Over the course of three years they have raised a staggering £18,000 and with this years event already in the planning, it looks like they will make it well over £30,000.

The reason I started this campaign was after reading about Simon's troubles with a new car he has just purchased.  After a period without transport, Simon saw an opportunity to get mobile again (due to having a rent free month) and decided to take the plunge and buy a cheap second hand car.  Within twenty minutes of driving away from the seller the car had broken down on the motorway and the AA indicated a new clutch was needed.  Now this is going to set Simon back £300 and will hit his finances hard. 

It is my aim for a handful of us to raise £500 to cover the cost of the repairs and to give Simon a small fund to ensure any further problems are less painful to the wallet.  My reasoning for this is that Simon works so hard in aid of others, I personally think it would be great if we could return the favour and show him just how much we appreciate him and all he stands for.

The cash!

I have opted to go with a flexible funding system whereby even if we don't hit the target, all funds (minus a small Indiegogo fee) will still go to Simon in four to five weeks time.  The fee they charge is 4% if we hit target and 9% if we don't.  I'm currently struggling with thoughts as to rewards for donating, but I'm sure that Jonathan Dodds, Pete Robinson, Richard Share and I would be up for some crazy challenges at this years Carping4Heroes event, should you make it along.  The real reward in this is in knowing that you've made Simon and Abi's life that little bit better.

I'm not looking to publicise this campaign as I believe that word of mouth and a few sneaky links to the people we know care for Simon and Abi, should have us hitting target anyway.  I'll start us off with a twenty pound donation (I just wish I could personally make it more). Whatever you can give is most appreciated.
